titleAttr: World History Atlas | Ancient and Modern States
title: Interactive Historical Map
info_1: TROY (3000–1260 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by Trojans in the territory of the modern Turkey. The capital is Troy. Destroyed by the ancient Greeks.
info_2: KHETTITE KINGDOM (1790–1200 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Turkey. Formed by the Hittites. The capitals are Coussart (1790–1650 BC) and Hattusas (1650–1200 BC). Destroyed by "Sea Peoples".
info_3: MITANNI (1520–1267 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Formed by Khurites. The capital is Vashukkanni. Conquered by Assyria.
info_4: MILETUS (1500–334 BC) City State. Formed by ancient Greek tribes in the territory of modern Turkey. Destroyed by Macedonia.
info_5: ASSYRIA (1400–605 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Separated from Mitanni. The capital is Ashur. Destroyed by the coalition of Babylonia and Media
info_6: PHRYGIA (1200–550 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by Phrygians in the territory of modern Turkey. The capital is Gordion. Conquered by Lydia.
info_7: TABAL (1180–800 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by Hittites in the territory of modern Turkey. Has become a part of Assyria.
info_8: STATE OF DANUNITES (1000–700 BC) State, slave-owning. Formed by dununites in the territory of modern Turkey. Conquered by Assyria.
info_9: COMMAGENE (1000–800 BC),(162–83 BC),(65 BC – AD 72) State, slave-owning. (Created in 1000 BC in the territory of modern Turkey. Conquered by Assyria}. {Separated from the Seleucid Empire. Conquered by Great Armenia), (Out of the Great Armenia. Has become a part of The Roman Empire). The capital is Samosata (from 162 BC)
info_10: QUE (1000–700 BC) State, slave-owning. monarchical. . Originated in the territory of modern Turkey. Has become a part of Assyria.
info_11: MUSASIR (900–800 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Turkey. Conquered by Urartu.
info_12: SAM'AL (900–720 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Turkey. The capital is Sam'al. Turned into the province of Assyria
info_13: URARTU (860–585 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Turkey. The capital is Tushpa. Conquered by Media.
info_14: CYZICUS (756–334 BC),(188–128 BC) City State. (Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Turkey. Conquered by Macedonia}. {Out of Seleucid Empire. Became part of the Roman Republic).
info_15: LYDIA (700–546 BC) State, slave-owning. Originated in the territory of modern Turkey. Out of Phrygia. The capital is Sardis. Conquered by Achaemenid Empire.
info_16: MEDIA (670–550 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iran. Out of Assyria. The capital is Ecbatana. It ceased to exist as a result of the seizure of power by the ancient Persian dynasty of the Achaemenids, who created Achaemenid Empire.
info_17: BYZANTIUM (660–74 BC) City State. Formed by the ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Turkey. Became part of The Roman Empire. Subsequently, was the capital of The Roman Empire (from AD 330 – Constantinople); The Byzantine Empire (from the beginning of the 4th century – Constantinople), Ottoman Empire (from AD 1453 — Istanbul), Turkey - (from AD 1918 - AD 1923). At present, Istanbul is the largest city in Turkey.
info_18: SINOPE (630–183 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Turkey. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus.
info_19: AMISOS (630–183 BC) City State, colony, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Turkey. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus.
info_20: KOTYORA (630–183 BC) City State, colony, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Turkey. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus.
info_21: TRABZON (600–183 BC) City State, colony, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Turkey. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus.
info_22: HERACLEA PONTICA (550–88 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by the ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Turkey. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus. Nowadays - the city of Ereğli (Turkey).
info_23: ACHAEMENID EMPIRE (550–330 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iran. Formed as a result of the seizure of power in Media by the ancient Persian dynasty of the Achaemenides. The capital is Persepolis (main). Become a part of Macedonian Empire. The most distinguished ruler - Cyrus II [550–530 BC]
info_24: BABYLONIA (1894–729 BC),(626–538 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. (Formed as a result of separation from the state of Isin. The capital is Babylon. Conquered by Assyria),(Separated from Assyria. Become a part Achaemenid Empire by Cyrus II). The most distinguished rulers: Hammurabi [1792–1750 BC]; Nebuchadnezzar II[ 604–562 BC]
info_25: MACEDONIA (ancient kingdom) (495–330 BC),(281–148 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Greece. (Formed as a result of separation from Achaemenid Empire. Become a part of Macedonian Empire}. {Out of The Lysimachian State. Conquered by Roman Republic). The capital is Pella. The most distinguished rulers: Philip II [382–336], Alexander the Great [356–323]
info_26: MACEDONIAN EMPIRE (330–301 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Created by Alexander the Great by conquering Macedonia (ancient kingdom) of the Achaemenid Empire. The capital is Babylon. Disintegrated into a number of states: Seleucid Empire, Egypt (Ptolemaic dynasty), The Lysimachian State
info_27: LESSER ARMENIA (322–107 BC) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by as a result of the collapse of Macedonian Empire in the territory of modern Turkey. Capital – Ani. Has become a part of Kingdom of Pontus.
info_28: THE LYSIMACHIAN STATE (301–281 BC) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Turkey. Formed by as a result of the collapse of Macedonian Empire. The capital is Lysimachia. Included in the composition of Roman Republic. The most distinguished ruler: Lysimach [361–281 BC], former bodyguard of Alexander the Great.
info_29: SELEUCID EMPIRE (312–83 BC),(69–64 BC) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Formed by as a result of the collapse of Macedonian Empire. The capitals are Seleucia, Antioch. Conquered by Great Armenia), (Out of Great Armenia. Included in the composition of Roman Republic). The most distinguished rulers: Seleucus I Nicator [356-280 BC], the former commander of Alexander the Great.
info_30: EGYPT (Ptolemaic dynasty) (305–30 BC) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Egypt. Formed by as a result of the collapse of Macedonian Empire. Included in the composition of Roman Republic. The most distinguished rulers: Ptolemy I [305-283 BC], former commander and bodyguard of Alexander of Macedon, Cleopatra [69-30 BC] and others
info_31: KINGDOM OF PONTUS (301–63 BC) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by as a result of the collapse of Macedonian Empire in the territory of modern Turkey. The capital is Amasia. Included in the composition of Roman Republic
info_32: IBERIA (300 BC – AD 580) State, slave-owning, monarchical (Kingdom of Iberia). Originated in the territory of modern Georgia. From BC 83 vassal of the Roman Republic, then the Roman Empire, from AD 387 — Sasanian Empire. Conquered by Sasanian Empire. The capitals are Armazi, Mtskheta, Tbilisi (from 400)
info_33: BITHYNIA (297–74 BC) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed as a result of the collapse of Macedonian Empirein in the territory of modern Turkey. The capital is Nicomedia. Has become a part of Roman Republic.
info_34: KINGDOM OF PERGAMON (283–133 BC) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed as a result of the collapse of Macedonian Empirein in the territory of modern Turkey. The capital is Pergamon. Included in the composition of Roman Republic
info_35: PAPHLAGONIA (281–107 BC) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed as a result of the collapse of Macedonian Empire in the territory of modern Turkey. Included in the composition of Kingdom of Pontus.
info_36: CAPPADOCIA (250 BC – AD 17) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey. Separated from Seleucid Empire. The capital is Mazaca. Has become a part of Roman Empire.
info_37: PARTHIAN EMPIRE (250 BC – AD 224) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iran. Detached from the Seleucid Empire by the Saka tribe of pairs. The capital is Hecatompylos. It ceased to exist as a result of the seizure of power by the ancient Persian Sasanian dynasty (Sasanian Empire)
info_38: GALATIA (228–25 BC) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Turkey (Separated from Seleucid Empire). The capital is Ankira (modern Ankara). Has become a part of Roman Empire.
info_39: GREATER ARMENIA (190 BC – AD 387) State, slave-owning. Originated in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Seleucid Empire. The capitals are Armavir (until the middle of the 2nd century BC), Artashat (the middle of the 2nd century BC – AD 387), Tigranocerta (77–56 BC), Vagharshapat (AD 163–330). Divided between the Sasanian Empire and the Roman Empire. The most distinguished ruler: Tigranes the Great [95–56 BC]
info_40: KINGDOM OF SOPHENE (190–94 BC) The state, the Armenian, slave. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey. Separated from Seleucid Empire. Included in the composition of Greater Armenia.
info_41: LYCIA (168 BC – AD 43) Association (League) of 23 city-states ( Xanthos, Patara, Pinara, Olympos, Myra, Teos and others), slave-owning. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey. Adhered to the Roman Empire. The capital is Patara.
info_42: LAMPSACUS (196–188 ÂÑ) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey. Out of Seleucid Empire. Became part of Kingdom of Pergamon. Lampsacus — the birthplace of the philosopher Epicurus (341–270 BC)
info_43: RHODES (408-340 BC),(190 BC – AD 44) State, slave-owning. (Formed in the territory of modern Greece as a result of the unification of Rhodes. Conquered by Achaemenid Empire}.{Out of Seleucid Empire. Has become a part of The Roman Empire). The capital is Rhodes.
info_44: ILION (190–128 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey. Out of Seleucid Empire. Became part of Roman Republic. It was located on the site of ancient Troy.
info_45: SMYRNA (190–133 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey. Out of Seleucid Empire. Conquered by Roman Republic. As the city exists to our time, the modern Turkish name Izmir.
info_46: ODRYSIAN KINGDOM (460–341 ÂÑ),(171 ÂÑ–AD 46) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Bulgaria. (Formed as a result of merger of Thracian tribes. The capitals were Apollonia and Cypselus. Conquered by Macedonia),(Separated from Macedonia. Has become a part of The Roman Empire).
info_47: SIDE (168 ÂÑ – AD 36) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey. Out of Rhodes. Conquered by Roman Empire.
info_48: ROMAN REPUBLIC (509–27 BC) State, slave-owning, form of government was a republic. Originated in the territory of modern Italy. Founded as a result of the overthrow of the king in Rome (ancient). The capital was Rome. Converted to monarchy — Roman Empire.
info_49: ROMAN EMPIRE (27 BC – AD 395) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of the establishment of the monarchy in the Roman Republic. The capital was Rome. Divided into the Western Roman Empire and the Eastern Roman Empire.
info_50: SASANIAN EMPIRE (AD 224-651) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iran. Formed in place of the Parthian kingdom as a result of the seizure of power by the Sassanid dynasty. The capital was Ctesiphon. Conquered by Umayyad Caliphate.
info_51: EASTERN ROMAN EMPIRE (AD 395–476) State, slave-owning, monarchical. It was formed as a result of the division of Roman Empire in the territory of modern Turkey. The capital was Constantinople. Renamed into Byzantine Empire at the same time as the fall of Western Roman Empire
info_52: BYZANTINE EMPIRE (AD 476–1204),(AD 1261–1453) State, slave-owning, monarchical. (It appeared as a result of the renaming of Eastern Roman Empire in the territory of modern Turkey. The capital was Constantinople. After the conquest of the capital city and part of the territory by the crookednessers and the creation of Latin Empire, Empire of Nicaea became the legal successor on the remaining territory}. {After the liquidation of Latin Empire, returned the capital of Constantinople and the name of the Byzantine Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Empire)
info_53: UMAYYAD CALIPHATE (AD 632–750) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Saudi Arabia. Formed Muhammad by unifying Arab tribes. The capital was Damascus (from 661). Converted to Abbasid Caliphate by changing Umayyad dynasty to the Abbasids
info_54: ABBASID CALIPHATE (AD 750–945) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed by changing Umayyad dynasty to the Abbasids in the territory of modern Iraq. The capital was Baghdad. Conquered by State of Buyid.
info_55: TARON (AD 830–968) State (principality), Armenian feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey. Separated from Abbasid Caliphate. The capital was Muş. Has become a part of Kingdom of Vaspurakan.
info_56: PRINCIPALITY OF TAO-KLARJETI (AD 813–1008) State, Georgian feudal, monarchical. Occurred in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of the overthrow of the power of Abbasid Caliphate by Ashot I on most of Georgian lands. The capital was Ardanuç. Converted converted into Kingdom of Georgia.
info_57: BAGRATID ARMENIA (AD 885–1045) State, Armenian feudal, monarchical. Occurred in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of the overthrow of the power of Abbasid Caliphate princely clan of the Bagratids in most of Armenian lands. The capitals were Kars (for 961), Ani. Conquered by Byzantine Empire.
info_58: EMIRATES OF QAYS (AD 860–1040) State, Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of the collapse of Abbasid Caliphate. Conquered by Byzantine Empire.
info_59: OWNERSHIP OF THE HAMDANIDS (AD 905–1003) State, feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Iraq as a result of the collapse of Abbasid Caliphate. The capital was Mosul. Conquered by Fatimid Caliphate.
info_60: KINGDOM OF VASPURAKAN (AD 908–1021) State, Armenian feudal, monarchical. Occurred in the territory of modern Turkey. Extracted from Bagratid Armenia. Conquered by Byzantine Empire.
info_61: FATIMID CALIPHATE (AD 909–1171) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed by the nomadic tribes of Oghuzes-Seljuks as a result of the seizure of the northwestern part of the Ghaznavid Empire (the territory of modern Iran). The capitals were Kairouan (up to 921), Mahdia (921–973), Cairo (from 973). As a result of the state overturn converted in Ayyubid Sultanate.
info_62: KINGDOM OF KARS (AD 963–1064) State, Armenian feudal, monarchical. Occurred in the territory of modern Turkey. Allocated from Bagratid Armenia. The capital was Kars. Conquered by Byzantine Empire.
info_63: KINGDOM OF GEORGIA (AD 1008–1245),(1353–1466) State, Georgian feudal, monarchical. The capital was Tbilisi. (Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of Bagrat III's unification of Georgian lands on the basis of Principality of Tao-Klarjeti. Conquered by Mongol Empire),(Restored independence after the collapse of Ilkhanate. Separated into states: Kingdom of Kartli, Kingdom of Kakheti, Kingdom of Imereti, Samtskhe-Saatabago)
info_64: SELJUK EMPIRE (AD 1038–1157) State, feudal. Formed by the nomadic tribes of Oghuzes-Seljuks as a result of the seizure of the north-western part of the Ghaznavid Empire (the territory of modern Iran). The capitals were Rey (up to 1072), Isfahan(from 1072). It ceased to exist as a result of raids by the nomadic tribes of Oghuzes and the conquest of most of the territory by Khwarezmid Empire
info_65: SULTANATE OF RUM (AD 1077–1307) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Seljuk Empire. The capital was Konya. Disintegrated into small principalities. One of them, the principality of Osman, was the core of the Ottoman State, formed in the early 14th century
info_66: DANISHMEND(AD 1071–1157) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of the transfer to the Turkmen military leader of the Seljukids Danishmandu Gazi, reclaimed from the Byzantine Empire by the Seljuk Empire. Conquered by Sultanate of Rum
info_67: ARMENIAN KINGDOM OF CILICIA (AD 1080–1375) State, Armenian feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey on the southern border of Byzantine Empire during the Seljuk invasion. The capital was Sis. Conquered by Mamluk Sultanate of Egypt
info_68: AYYUBID SULTANATE (AD 1171–1250) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Egypt as a result of the state overturn in Fatimid Caliphate. The capital was Cairo. As a result of the state overturn converted in Mamluk Sultanate of Egypt.
info_69: PRINCIPALITY OF ANTIOCH(AD 1098–1268) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed by crusaders in the territory of Seljuk Empire (territory of modern Syria). The capital was Antioch. Conquered by Mamluk Sultanate of Egypt.
info_70: COUNTY OF EDESSA (AD 1098–1144) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Turkey. Formed by by crusaders in the territory of Seljuk Empire. The capital was Edessa. Conquered by Zengid dynasty
info_71: LATIN EMPIRE (AD 1204–1261) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey by the crusaders as a result of the conquest of part of the Byzantine Empire. The capital was Constantinople. Eliminated by Empire of Nicaea.
info_72: EMPIRE OF NICAEA (AD 1204–1261) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey. Legacy of the Byzantine Empire in the territory left after the formation of Latin Empire. The capital was Nicaea. After liquidation of Latin Empire returned Capital Constantinople and name The Byzantine Empire.
info_73: EMPIRE OF TREBIZOND (AD 1204–1461) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey by the grandchildren of the Byzantine emperor after the conquest of the Byzantine Empire by the crusaders. The capital was Trebizond. Conquered by Ottoman Empire.
info_74: ARTUQID STATE (AD 1098–1232) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Seljuk Empire. The capital was Diyarbakır. Conquered by Ayyubid Sultanate
info_75: STATE OF SHAH-ARMENS (AD 1100–1207) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Seljuk Empire. The capital was Ahlat. Conquered by Ayyubid Sultanate
info_76: MONGOL EMPIRE (AD 1206–1271) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Mongolia as a result of the seizure of northern China by Genghis Khan. It ceased to exist as a result of the uprising of the Red Bandages and the transformation into the Great Ming Empire
info_77: ILKHANATE (AD 1256–1353) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of separation from Mongol Empire by grandson of Genghis Khan Khulagu-khan. The capitals were Maragheh, Tabriz, Soltaniyeh. It split into several states (Jalayirid Sultanate, Muzaffarids and others)
info_78: ZENGID DYNASTY (AD 1127–1186) State, feudal. Formed as a result of the transfer of power by the Sultan Seljuk Empire to the atabeku (ruler) of the city of Mosul in the territory of modern Iraq. Conquered by Ayyubid Sultanate
info_79: MAMLUK SULTANATE OF EGYPT (AD 1250–1517) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Egypt as a result of the state overturn in Ayyubid Sultanate. The capital was Cairo. Conquered by Ottoman Empire.
info_80: KARAMAN (AD 1307–1390),(1403–1419),(1421–1483) State, feudal. (Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of the collapse of Sultanate of Rum. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik),(Restored by the Timurid Empire. Conquered by Mamluk Sultanate of Egypt),(Out of Mamluk Sultanate of Egypt. Conquered by Ottoman Empire). The capitals were Karaman (1256—1483), Alanya (1293—1471)
info_81: OTTOMAN BEYLIK (AD 1281–1452) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey by Ottoman Turks on selected Sultanate of Rum territory. Independent sultanate from 1299. The capital was Bursa. Turned into the Ottoman Empire as a result of conquests in Asia, Europe and Africa.
info_82: MENTESHE (AD 1282–1391),(1402–1425) State, feudal. (Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Sultanate of Rum. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik),(Restored by Timurid Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik). The capitals were Milas, Menteshe
info_83: PERVÂNEOĞLU (AD 1292–1393),(1402–1461) State, feudal. (Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Sultanate of Rum. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik),(Restored by Timurid Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik). The capital was Sinop
info_84: AYDIN (AD 1300–1390),(1402–1425) State, feudal. (Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Sultanate of Rum. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik),(Restored by Timurid Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik). The capital was Birgi, then Aydın, Smyrna
info_85: ACHI (AD 1292–1398) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Sultanate of Rum. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik
info_86: GERMIYANIDS (AD 1300–1390),(1402–1429) State, feudal. (Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Sultanate of Rum. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik),(Restored by Timurid Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik). The capital was Kütahya
info_87: CANIK (AD 1292–1393),(1402–1428) State, feudal. (Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Sultanate of Rum. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik),(Restored by Timurid Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik).
info_88: ISFENDIYARIDS (AD 1292–1393),(1402–1461) State, feudal. (Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Sultanate of Rum. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik),(Restored by Timurid Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik). The capital was Kastamonu
info_89: KARASI (AD 1300–1349) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik. The capitals were Bergama, Balıkesir
info_90: SARUHAN (AD 1300–1390),(1402–1405) State, feudal. (Formed as a result of separation from Sultanate of Rum. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik),(Restored by Timurid Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik). The capitals were Magnesia, Manisa
info_91: TEKKE (AD 1321–1390),(1402–1427) State, feudal. (Formed as a result of separation from Hamid. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik),(Restored by Timurid Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik). The capital was Antalya
info_92: HAMID (AD 1300–1390),(1402–1425) State, feudal. (Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Sultanate of Rum. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik),(Restored by Timurid Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik). The capital was Eğirdir
info_93: ERETNIDS (AD 1335–1398) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Karaman. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik. The capitals were Sivas (1335—1398), Erzincan (1375—1398)
info_94: DULKADIR (AD 1339–1516) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of separation from Eretnids. Conquered by Ottoman Empire. The capitals were Maraş, Malatya
info_95: KHANATE OF BUKHARA (AD 1500–1740),(1747–1785) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the collapse of Timurid Empire and the conquest of Central Asia by the Shaybanids. Captured by the Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah and established the Persian Protectorate — Khanate of Bukhara (Pers.)),(Liberation from the Persian Protectorate. Converted to Bukhara Emirate).
info_96: AQ QOYUNLU (AD 1468–1508) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the victory of the nomadic Turkmen tribes over Kara-Koyunlu. The capital was Tabriz. Defeated by Safavid Empire
info_97: KARA KOYUNLU (AD 1375–1468) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the unification of nomadic Turkmen tribes. The capital was Tabriz. Conquered by State Aq Qoyunlu
info_98: JALAYIRID SULTANATE (AD 1335–1432) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the collapse of Ilkhanate. Conquered by State Kara-Koyunlu
info_99: OTTOMAN EMPIRE (AD 1453–1918) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Turkey from Ottoman Beylik as a result of gains in Asia, Europe and Africa. The capital was Istanbul. Disintegrated as a result of defeat in World War I and occupied by the victorious states (Great Britain and France)
info_100: TURKEY (British-French occupation zone) (AD 1918–1923) The territory occupied by the victorious states in World War I (Great Britain and France). Formed in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of the collapse of Ottoman Empire. The capital was Istanbul. October 23, 1923 proclaimed independent Republic of Turkey
info_101: TURKEY (AD 1923–) State, capitalist (Turkish Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Turkey (British-French occupation zone) October 23, 1923. The capital was Ankara.
info_102: SAMTSKHE-SAATABAGO (AD 1466–1555) State (principality), Georgian feudal, monarchical. The capital was Akhaltsikhe. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the collapse of Kingdom of Georgia. Divide into two possessions, fell into a vassal dependence on the Ottoman Empire and the Persian Safavid state
info_103: SAFAVID EMPIRE (AD 1502–1736) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the seizure of power in the capital of Ak-Koyunlu Tabriz by the Safavid dynasty. As a result of the state overturn converted in Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah.
name_104: Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah
info_104: AFSHARID PERSIAN EMPIRE OF NADIR SHAH (AD 1736–1750) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the coup d'etat in Safavid Empire by Nader Shah. The capital was Mashhad. Disintegrated, the power of the Zand dynasty came to power, forming Persia
label_104: Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah
info_105: RUSSIAN EMPIRE (AD 1721–1917) State, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Russia on the basis of Russian kingdom, which Peter I declared an empire. The capital was St. Petersburg. As a result of the February Revolution, the Russian Republic was proclaimed.
info_106: SOVIET RUSSIA (RSFSR) (AD 1917, October–1922) State, socialist. Formed in the territory of modern Russia As a result of the state overturn (October Revolution) in Russia Republic. The capital was Moscow. On December 30, 1922, it was converted to the USSR by unifying the RSFSR, the Ukrainian SSR (Ukraine), the BSSR (Byelorussia), and the ZSFSR (Transcaucasian Socialist Federative Soviet Republic). The capitals were Petrograd (up to 1918), Moscow
info_107: MANNEA (843–800 BC),(714–585 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Appeared in the territory of modern Iran. (Formed by Mannaeans. The capital was Zirta. Conquered by Urartu}. {Out of Urartu. Conquered by Media).
info_108: PERSIA (AD 1750–1935) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the collapse of Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah and the coming to power of the Zand dynasty. The capital was Tehran. Renamed to Iran
info_109: MARI (2400–2315 BC),(2150–1758 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Was in the territory of modern Syria. (Formed by Sumer. The capital was Mari. Became part of Akkadian Empire), (Out of Akkadian Empire. Become part of Babylonia)
info_110: YAMHAD (1800–1280 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Was in the territory of modern Syria. Formed by Amorites. The capital was Aleppo. Destroyed by Hittite Empir.
info_111: AKKADIAN EMPIRE (2315–2150 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Formed as a result of merger City States: Mari, Eshnunna, Umma, Lagash, Uruk, Ur. The capital was Akkad. Destroyed by Gutian people, broke up into separate city-states. The most distinguished ruler: Sargon of Akkad (2316–2261 BC) — founder of the state.
info_112: PHOENICIA (2025–564 BC) The conglomerate of city-states, Phoenician slave-owning. Originated in the territory of modern Lebanon. Formed by Phoenicians. Conquered by Babylonia
info_113: BYBLOS (2025–564 BC) City State, Phoenician slave-owning . Was in the territory of modern Lebanon. Formed by Phoenicians. Conquered by Babylonia
info_114: SIDON (2000–564 BC) City State, Phoenician slave-owning . Was in the territory of modern Lebanon. Formed by Phoenicians. Conquered by Babylonia
info_115: EGYPT (ANCIENT) (3000–525 BC),(405–343 BC) State, slave-owning , monarchical. Was in the territory of modern Egypt. (Formed as a result of the merger of Upper Egypt and Lower Egypt. The capital was Memphis. Included in the composition of Achaemenid Empire),(Out of Achaemenid Empire. Conquered by Achaemenid Empire). The most distinguished rulers: Cheops (end of 2800-middle of 2600 BC) and others
info_116: ARWAD (1500–564 BC) City State, Phoenician slave-owning. Was in the territory of modern Syria. Formed by Phoenicians. Conquered by Babylonia
info_117: TYRE (1400–564 BC) City State, Phoenician slave-owning. Was in the territory of modern Lebanon. Formed by Phoenicians. Conquered by Babylonia. Now in its place is the city of Sur (Lebanon)
info_118: ARAM-DAMASCUS (1100–732 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Syria. Created by Arameans. The capital was Damascus. Conquered by Assyria
info_119: ISRAEL-JUDAH KINGDOM (1020–928 BC) State, slave-owning. Originated in the territory of modern Israel. Formed by ancient Israeli tribes. The capital was Jerusalem. It fell apart into the Israel and Judah kingdoms
info_120: HAMAT (1000–732 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Syria. Formed by Arameans. The capital was Hamat (modern Hama). Conquered by Assyria
info_121: ISRAEL KINGDOM (928–722 BC) State, slave-owning. Originated in the territory of modern Israel. Formed after the dissolution of Israel-Judah Kingdom. The capital was Samaria. Conquered by Assyria
info_122: JUDAH KINGDOM (928–587 BC),(141 BC–AD 6),(AD 66–73) State, slave-owning. Originated in the territory of modern Israel.(Formed after the dissolution of Israel-Judah Kingdom. Capital — Jerusalem.Destroyed by Babylonia),(Separated from Seleucid Empire. Conquered by Roman Republic),(Separated from The Roman Empire. Conquered by Roman Empire).
info_123: KINGDOM OF CHALCIS (100–64 BC) State, slave-owning, Arab-Aramaic Hellenized. Originated in the territory of modern Lebanon. Created by the Arab tribe of the Iturians. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_124: OSROENE (132 BC–70 BC),(65– AD 244) State, slave-owning, Arabic. (Originated in the territory of modern Turkey. Separated from Seleucid Empire. Conquered by Greater Armenia), (Out of Greater Armenia. Conquered by Sasanian Empire. The capital was Edessa.)
info_125: SYRIA (British-French occupation zone) (AD 1918–1920) The territory occupied by the victorious states in World War I (Great Britain and France). Formed as a result of the collapse of Ottoman Empire. The capital was Damascus. Divided into states State of Aleppo (Fr.), State of Damascus (Fr.) and Alawite State (Fr.)
info_126: SYRIA (Fr.) (AD 1925–1946) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France (AD 1925–1932, 1939–1941 — State of Syria; AD 1932–1939, 1941–1946 — Syrian Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Syria as a result of the union of states State of Aleppo (Fr.), State of Damascus (Fr.). The capital was Damascus. April 17, 1946, the independent Syrian Republic was proclaimed
info_127: SYRIA (AD 1946–1958),(1961–) State, capitalist (AD 1946–1958 — Syrian Republic, from AD 1961 — Syrian Arab Republic). (Formed in the territory of modern Syria in the mandate territory of the League of Nations France Syria (Fr.) February 22, 1958 Joined with Egypt, forming the state of the United Arab Republic (UAR)}. {Out of UAR). The capital is Damascus.
info_128: UNITED ARAB REPUBLIC (UAR) (AD 1958–1971) State, capitalist. Formed in the territory of modern Egypt and Syria as a result of merger Egypt and Syria. The capital was Cairo. In 1961 yria out of UAR), and in 1971 UAR was renamed to Egypt
info_129: STATE OF ALEPPO (Fr.) (AD 1920–1925) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France. Formed in the territory Syria (British-French occupation zone). The capital was Aleppo. United with State of Damascus (Fr.), forming the mandate territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France Syria (Fr.)
info_130: STATE OF DAMASCUS (Fr.) (AD 1920–1925) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France. Formed in the territory Syria (British-French occupation zone). The capital was Damascus. United with State of Aleppo (Fr.), forming the mandate territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France Syria (Fr.)
info_131: ALAWITE STATE (Fr.) (AD 1920–1930) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France (AD 1920–1925 — Territory of Alawite, AD 1925–1930 — Alawite State). Formed in the territory Syria (British-French occupation zone). The capital was Latakia. Renamed to Latakia (Fr.)
info_132: LATAKIA (Fr.) (AD 1930–1936) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France (Sanjak Latakia). Formed in the territory of modern Syria as a result of renaming Alawite State (Fr.). The capital was Latakia. Become a part of Syria (Fr.)
info_133: JABAL AL-DRUZE (Fr.) (AD 1921–1922),(1927–1936) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France (AD 1921–1922 — Jabal al-Druze County, AD 1927–1936 — State of Jabal al-Druze). (Formed in the territory of modern Syria. Separated from Damascusa (Fr.). Renamed to State of Souaida (Fr.)}. {Formed as a result of renaming from State of Souaida (Fr.). Become a part of Syria (Fr.)). The capital was As-Suwayda.
info_134: State of Souaida (Fr.) (AD 1922–1927) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France (State of Souaida). Formed in the territory of modern Syria as result of renaming Jabal al-Druzea (Fr.). The capital was As-Suwayda. Renamed to Jabal al-Druze (Fr.)
info_135: ALEXANDRETTA (Fr.) (AD 1924–1938) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France (Sanjak Alexandretta). Formed in the territory of modern Turkey. Separated from State of Aleppo (Fr.). The capital was Antioch. Converted to independent state Hatay
info_136: HATAY (AD 1938–1939) State, capitalist (Republic of Hatay). Formed in the territory of modern Turkey by proclaiming independence Alexandretta (Fr.). The capital was Antioch. Has become a part of Turkey
info_137: TRIPOLI (AD 1109–1291) State (County of Tripoli), feudal, monarchical. Formed by crusaders in the territory Seljuk Empire (territory of modern Lebanon). The capital was Tripoli. Conquered by Mamluk Sultanate of Egypt.
info_138: PALESTINE (zone of British occupation) (AD 1918–1922) Territory occupied by one of the victorious states in World War I (Great Britain). Formed as a result of the collapse of Ottoman Empire. The capital was Jerusalem. Transferred by the League of Nations to the Mandate Office of Great Britain (Palestine (Brit.))
info_139: PALESTINE (Brit.) (AD 1922–1948) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of Great Britain. Formed in the territory of modern Israel as a result of annexation to the territory of Palestine (zone of British occupation) south-western part of Syria. The capital was Jerusalem. It ceased to exist as a result of the proclamation of independence by the State of Israel (May 14, 1948)
info_140: KINGDOM OF JERUSALEM (AD 1099–1291) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed by crusaders in the territory of Seljuk Empire (territory of modern Lebanon). The capital was Jerusalem. Conquered by Mamluk Sultanate of Egypt.
info_141: GREATER LEBANON (Fr.) (AD 1920–1926) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France (State of Greater Lebanon). Formed in the territory of Syria (British-French occupation zone). The capital was Beirut. Converted in the mandate territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France Lebanon (Fr.)
info_142: LEBANON (Fr.) (AD 1926–1943) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France. Formed in the territory of modern Lebanon as a result of transformation Greater Lebanon (Fr.). The capital was Beirut. November 22, 1943 proclaimed the independent Lebanese Republic
info_143: LEBANON (AD 1943–) State, capitalist (Lebanese Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Lebanon in the mandate territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of France Lebanon (Fr.). The capital was Beirut.
info_144: AMMON (1350–732 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Was in the territory of modern Jordan. Formed by Ammonites. The capital was Rabbath Ammon . Conquered by Assyria
info_145: MOAB (1100–860 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Was in the territory of modern Jordan. Formed by moabites. Conquered by Kingdom of Israel.
info_146: EDOM (1100–732 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Jordan. Conquered by Assyria
info_147: NABATAEAN KINGDOM (169 BC – AD 106) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Jordan. Formed by Nabataeans in the territory of states: Egypt (Ptolemaic dynasty) and Seleucid Empire. The capital was Petra. Conquered by Roman Empire.
info_148: TRANSJORDAN (Brit.) (AD 1921–1923) Autonomous region (Emirate of Transjordan). Formed in the territory of Palestine (zone of British occupation) in the territory of modern Jordan. The capital was Amman. Become a part of the mandate territory Palestine (Brit.)
info_149: JORDAN (AD 1946–) State, capitalist (The Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan). Formed in the territory of modern Jordan on May 25, 1946 in the mandate territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of Britain Palestine (Brit.). The capital is Amman
info_150: ISRAEL (AD 1948–) State, capitalist (State of Israel). Formed in the territory of modern Israel on May 14, 1948 in the mandate territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of Britain Palestine (Brit.). The capital is Jerusalem
info_151: CYNOPOLIS (4000–3500 BC) City State (nome), slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by the ancient Egyptians in the territory of modern Egypt. Became part of Upper Egypt.
info_152: LETOPOLIS (4000–3500 BC) City State (nome), slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by the ancient Egyptians in the territory of modern Egypt. Became part of Lower Egypt.
info_153: MEMPHIS (4000–3500 BC) City State (nome), slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by the ancient Egyptians in the territory of modern Egypt. Became part of Lower Egypt.
info_154: NEKHEN (4000–3500 BC) City State (nome), slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by the ancient Egyptians in the territory of modern Egypt. Became part of Upper Egypt.
info_155: ON (4000–3500 BC) City State (nome), slave-owning, monarchical.Formed by the ancient Egyptians in the territory of modern Egypt. Became part of Lower Egypt.
info_156: PELUSIUM (4000–3500 BC) City State (nome), slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by the ancient Egyptians in the territory of modern Egypt. Became part of Lower Egypt.
info_157: SAIS (4000–3500 BC) City State (nome), slave-owning, monarchical.Formed by the ancient Egyptians in the territory of modern Egypt. Became part of Lower Egypt.
info_158: SEBENNYTOS (4000–3500 BC) City State (nome), slave-owning, monarchical.Formed by the ancient Egyptians in the territory of modern Egypt. Became part of Lower Egypt.
info_159: Syowt (4000–3500 BC) City State (nome), slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by the ancient Egyptians in the territory of modern Egypt. Became part of Upper Egypt.
info_160: THEBES (4000–3500 BC) City State (nome), slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by the ancient Egyptians in the territory of modern Egypt. Became part of Upper Egypt.
info_161: UPPER EGYPT (3500–3000 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Egypt as a result of the unification of 22 primitive states (nomas). The capital was Hierakonpolis. Included in the composition of Ancient Egypt.
info_162: LOWER EGYPT (3500–3000 BC.) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Egypt as a result of the unification of 16 primitive states (nomas). The capital was Buto. Included in the composition of Ancient Egypt.
info_163: EGYPT (Brit.) (AD 1914–1922) State (Sultanate of Egypt) under the protectorate of Great Britain. Formed in the territory of modern Egypt as a result of the occupation by Britain of part of the territory of Ottoman Empire. The capital was Cairo. In 1922 the independent Kingdom of Egypt was proclaimed
info_164: EGYPT (AD 1922–1958),(1971–) State, capitalist (AD 1922–1953 — Kingdom of Egypt, AD 1953–1958 — Republic of Egypt). (Formed in the territory of modern Egypt as a result of the proclamation of independence from Great Britain by the Sultanate of Egypt. United with Syria having formed the state of the United Arab Republic (UAR); In 1961 Syria withdrew from UAR}. {Converted in Arab Republic of Egypt). The capital is Cairo
info_165: LEPTIS MAGNA (1100–600 BC) City State, colony, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Phoenicians in the territory of modern Libya. Conquered by Carthage.
info_166: CYRENE (640–305 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Libya. Conquered by Ptolemaic Kingdom.
info_167: CARTHAGE (825–146 BC) State, slave-owning. Originated in the territory of modern Tunisia Destroyed by Roman Republic in the 3 Punic War. The most outstanding commander Hannibal (end 247-183 BC).
info_168: WESTERN ROMAN EMPIRE(AD 395–476) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of the section Roman Empire. The capital was Rome. It ceased to exist as a result of the seizure of power by the leader of the Germans, Odoacer, who created in the territory of modern Italy the Kingdom of Odoacer.
info_169: VANDAL KINGDOM(AD 439–534) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Tunisia in the process of disintegration of Western Roman Empire. The capital was Carthage. Conquered by Byzantine Empire.
info_170: AGHLABID DYNASTY (AD 800–909) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Tunisia as a result of the collapse of Abbasid Caliphate. The capital was Kairouan. As a result of the state overturn Converted by to Fatimid Caliphate.
info_171: ALMOHAD CALIPHATE (AD 1121–1269) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco in part of the territory of State of Almoravides. The capitals were Marrakech, Seville. As a result of the collapse formed State of Marinids.
info_172: HAFSID CALIPHATE (AD 1237–1574) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Tunisia in part of the territory Almohad Caliphate. The capital was Tunisia. Conquered by Ottoman Empire.
info_173: TRIPOLITANIA (it.) (AD 1911–1934) colony of Italy. Formed as a result of the occupation of Italy part of Ottoman Empire in the territory of modern Libya. The capital was Tripoli. Become a part of colony Libya (it.)
info_174: CYRENAICA (it.) (AD 1912–1934) colony of Italy. Formed as a result of the occupation of Italy part of Ottoman Empire in the territory of modern Libya. The capital was Bengazi. Become a part of colony Libya (it.)
info_175: FEZZAN (it.) (AD 1912–1934) colony of Italy. Formed as a result of the occupation of Italy part of Ottoman Empire in the territory of modern Libya. The capital was Sabha. Become a part of colony Libya (it.)
info_176: LIBYA (it.) (AD 1934–1943) colony of Italy. Formed in the territory of modern Libya as a result of merger Tripolitania (it.), Cyrenaica (it.) and Fezzan (it.). The capital was Tripoli. Fell under the administration of England (Tripolitania and Cyrenaica) and France (Fezzan)
info_177: TRIPOLITANIA (Brit.) (AD 1943–1951) Territory under the management of Great Britain. Formed in the territory of modern Libya as a result of the occupation by Britain of a part of the territory Libya (it.). The capital was Tripoli. Become a part of the proclaimed December 24, 1951 independent state Libya
info_178: CYRENAICA (Brit.) (AD 1943–1951) Territory under the management of Great Britain. Formed in the territory of modern Libya as a result of the occupation by Britain of a part of the territory Libya (it.). The capital was Bengazi. Become a part of the proclaimed December 24, 1951 independent state Libya
info_179: FEZZAN (Fr.) (AD 1943–1951) Territory under the management of France. Formed in the territory of modern Libya as a result of the occupation by France of a part of the territory Libya (it.). The capital was Sabha. Become a part of the proclaimed December 24, 1951 independent state Libya
info_180: LIBYA (AD 1951–) State, capitalist (AD 1951–1963 — United Kingdom Libya, AD 1963–1969 — Kingdom Libya, AD 1969–1977 — Libyan Arab Republic, 1977–2011 — The People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya), from 2012 — State of Libya. Formed in the territory of modern Libya as a result of merger Tripolitania (Brit.), Cyrenaica (Brit.) and Fezzan (Fr.). The capital is Tripoli.
info_181: ALGERIA (Fr.) (AD 1830–1962) Association of French departments (Algeria, Constantine, Oran). Formed in the territory of modern Algeria as a result of the conquest of Algeria (Ottoman), in 1848 included in the composition of France. In 1962, the independent Algerian Republic was proclaimed
info_182: SOUTHERN TERRITORIES (Fr.) (AD 1902–1957) Territory under the management of France. Formed in the territory of modern Algeria as a result of the separation of the Saharan oases from the French departments in Algiers (Fr.). Become a part of Algeria (Fr.)
info_183: UTICA (1100–825 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Phoenicians in the territory of modern Tunisia Conquered by Carthage.
info_184: NUMIDIA (201–46 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Algeria by combining the Numidian tribes. The capitals were Cirta, Bulla Regia. Conquered by Roman Republic.
info_185: RUSTAMID KINGDOM (AD 761–909) State, feudal theocratic (Khawarij) Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Algeria as a result of the unification of the Berber tribes. The capital was Tahert. Conquered by Fatimid Caliphate.
info_186: HAMMADID DYNASTY (AD 1044–1152) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Algeria as a result of separation from Fatimid Caliphate. The capitals were Beni Hammad, Béjaïa. Conquered by Almohad Caliphate.
info_187: STATE OF ALMORAVIDES (AD 1040–1147) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Mauritania as a result of the unification of the Berber tribes. The capitals were Aghmat (1040-1062), Marrakesh (1062-1147). Conquered by Almohad Caliphate.
info_188: ZAYYANID DYNASTY (AD 1235–1556) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Algeria as a result of a detachment from Almohad Caliphate. The capital was Tlemcen. Conquered by Ottoman Empire.
info_189: ORAN (Spain) (AD 1509–1708) Owning Spain. Formed in the territory of modern Algeria as a result of the conquest of Spain by the fortress Oran of Zayyanid dynasty. Conquered by Ottoman Empire
info_190: Tunisia (Ottoman) (AD 1705–1881) State, vassal Ottoman Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Tunisia as a result of separation from Ottoman Empire. The capital was Tunisia. Passed under the protectorate of France — Tunisia (Fr.)
info_191: TUNISIA (Fr.) (AD 1705–1956) State under the protectorate of France. Formed in the territory of modern Tunisia as a result of France's establishment of a protectorate over Tunisia (Ottoman). The capital was Tunisia. March 20, 1956 proclaimed an independent Kingdom of Tunisia
info_192: TUNISIA (AD 1956–) State, capitalist (AD 1956–1957 — Kingdom of Tunisia, from 1957— Tunis Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Tunisia as a result of the proclamation of independence from France Tunisia (Fr.) on March 20, 1956/ The capital is Tunisia.
info_193: ALGERIA (Ottoman) (AD 1711–1848) State, vassal of Ottoman Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Algeria as a result of separation from Ottoman Empire. The capital was Algeria. Conquered by France — Algeria (Fr.)
info_194: EMIRATE ALGERIA (AD 1834–1847) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Algeria as a result of detachment from Algeria (Ottoman). The capital was Mascar. Conquered by France and annexed to Algeria (Fr.).
info_195: ALGERIA (AD 1962–) State, capitalist (Algerian People's Democratic Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Algeria as a result of the proclamation of independence from France France Algeria (Fr.). The capital is Algeria
info_196: MAURETANIA (110 BC – AD 40) State, slave-owning. Originated in the territory of modern Algeria. Conquered by Roman Empire
info_197: IDRISID STATE (AD 788–916) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of separation from Abbasid Caliphate. The capital was Fez. Conquered by Fatimid Caliphate.
info_198: STATE OF MAGRAVIDS (AD 976–1070) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of separation from Fatimid Caliphate. The capital was Fez. Conquered by State of Almoravides.
info_199: STATE OF MARINIDS (AD 1269–1420) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of the collapse of Almohad Caliphate. The capital was Fez. As a result of the state overturn converted to Wattasid sultanate
info_200: CEUTA (Port.) (AD 1415–1580) Possession of Portugal. Formed as a result of Portugal's conquest of the city of Ceuta from the State of Marinids. Conquered by Spain (Ceuta (Spain)
info_201: CEUTA (Spain) (AD 1518–1912),(1956–) Owning Spain. (Formed in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the conquest of Spain city of Ceuta (Port.). Has become a part of Spanish protectorate in Morocco),(Out of Spanish protectorate in Morocco, Included in the composition of Spain, since 1995 - Autonomous city of Ceuta
info_202: MELILLA (Spain) (AD 1497–1912),(1956–) Owning Spain. (Formed in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the conquest of Spain city of Melilla from State of Marinids. Has become a part of Spanish protectorate in Morocco),(Out of Spanish protectorate in Morocco, Included in the composition of Spain, since 1995 - Autonomous city of Melilla
info_203: SAADIAN EMPIRE (AD 1509–1659) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of separation from Wattasid sultanate. The capital was Marrakesh. as a result of the collapse of Formed by Alawite dynasty
info_204: ALAWITE DYNASTY (AD 1659–1666) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of the collapse of Saadian empire. The capital was Marrakesh. Converted by to Morocco Sultanate
info_205: MOROCCO SULTANATE (AD 1666-1912) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of transformation Alawite dynasty. The capitals were Fez, Rabat. As a result of the wars with France and Spain divided on Morocco (Fr.), Spanish protectorate in Morocco and Tangier International Zone
info_206: TANGIER (Port.) (AD 1471–1662) Possession of Portugal. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of the conquest of Portugal part of the territory of Wattasid sultanate. Transferred to England (see. Tangier (Engl.)
info_207: TANGIER (Engl.) (AD 1662–1684) Possession of England. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of the transfer of Portugal Tangier (Port.) to England. Transferred to Morocco Sultanate
info_208: TANGIER INTERNATIONAL ZONE (AD 1912–1940),(1945–1956) Area under international management. (Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of the section Morocco Sultanate. Included in the composition Spanish protectorate in Morocco),(Is separated from the composition Spanish protectorate in Morocco. Included in the composition independent Morocco)
info_209: IFNI (Spain) (AD 1860–1969) Possession of Spain. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of the conquest of Spain part of the territory of Morocco Sultanate. The capital was Sidi Ifni. Transferred to Morocco
info_210: SPANISH PROTECTORATE IN MOROCCO (AD 1912–1956) Possession of Spain. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of partition of the territory Morocco Sultanate between France and Spain. The capital was Tétouan. Included in the independent Morocco
info_211: MOROCCO (Fr.) (AD 1912–1956) Possession of France. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of partition of the territory Morocco Sultanate between France and Spain. The capital was Rabat. Included in the independent Morocco
info_213: RIF REPUBLIC (AD 1921–1926) State, capitalist (Confederal Republic of the Tribes of the Rif). Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of the proclamation of the independence of the tribes of the Rif, here is the chapter with Abd al-Karim the territory of Spanish protectorate in Morocco. Included in the composition of Spanish protectorate in Morocco
info_214: CALIPHATE OF CÓRDOBA (AD 929-1031) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Spain as a result of transformation of Emirate of Córdoba. The capital was Córdoba. Disintegrated into separate emirates (taifa).
info_215: WATTASID SULTANATE (AD 1420–1549) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Morocco as a result of the state overturn in State of Marinids. The capital was Fez. Conquered by Saadian empire
info_216: EMIRATE OF CÓRDOBA (AD 756-929),(1031–1070) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. (Formed in the territory of modern Spain as a result of separation from Abbasid Caliphate. Converted to Caliphate of Córdoba),(Recreated as a result of decay Caliphate of Córdoba. Conquered by Taifa of Seville). The capital was Córdoba.
info_217: GADES (1100–600 BC) City State, colony, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Phoenicians in the territory of modern Spain. Conquered by Carthage. Now in its place is the city of Cadiz
info_218: TARTESSOS (1100–600 BC) State, slave-owning. Originated in the territory of modern Spain. Conquered by Carthage.
info_219: KINGDOM OF THE SUEBI (AD 409–585) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Portugal in the process of decay Western Roman Empire. The capitals were Braga, Porto, Merida. Conquered by Kingdom of Toledo.
info_220: VISIGOTHIC KINGDOM (AD 418–580) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern France in the process of decay Western Roman Empire. The capital was Toulouse. Converted to Kingdom of Toledo
info_221: KINGDOM OF TOLEDO (AD 580–711) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of transformation of Visigothic Kingdom (transfer of the capital to Toledo). The capital was Toledo. Conquered by Umayyad Caliphate
info_222: ASTURIAS (AD 718–924) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Asturias). Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of separation from Arab caliphate. The capital was Oviedo. Renamed to Kingdom of León
info_223: FRANKISH EMPIRE (AD 481–843) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Germany in the process of decay Western Roman Empire and the conquest by the Franks of the Roman province of Gaul. The capital was Aachen. It is divided into three states: Kingdom of the West Franks, Kingdom of Middle Francia and Kingdom of the East Franks
info_224: KINGDOM OF THE WEST FRANKS (AD 843–987) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern France as a result of the section Frankish Empire. The capital was Paris. Renamed to France
info_225: KINGDOM OF PAMPLONA (AD 824–1004) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Pamplona). Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of separation from Frankish Empire. The capital was Pamplona. Renamed to Kingdom of Navarre
info_226: LEÓN (AD 924–1037),(1065–1072),(1157–1230) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of León). (Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of renaming Kingdom of Asturias. It united with Castile, forming the Crown of Castile and León),(Restored as a result of separation from Castile. It united with Castile, forming the Crown of Castile and León), Restored as a result of separation from Castile. It united with Castile, forming the Crown of Castile and León). The capital was León.
info_227: FRANCE (AD 987–1940),(1944–) State, capitalist (French Republic). (Formed in the territory of modern France as a result of renaming Kingdom of the West Franks. As a result, the defeat in World War II was occupied by Germany and Italy, part of the territory was created by the French State (Vichy France), part of the territory annexed to Germany), (Restored as a result of the victory of the anti-Hitler coalition over Germany.) The capital is Paris.
info_228: COUNTY OF BARCELONA (AD 988–1152) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of separation from France. The capital was Barcelona. Has become a part of Kingdom of Aragon
info_229: KINGDOM OF NAVARRE (AD 1004–1076),(1134–1512) State, feudal, monarchical . (Formed in the territory of modern Spain as a result of renaming Kingdom of Pamplona. Attached to Kingdom of Aragon),(Separated from Kingdom of Aragon. Shared between France and Kingdom of Aragon). The capital was Pamplona.
info_230: TAIFA OF MÁLAGA (AD 1010-1057) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Málaga. Shared between Taifa of Seville and Taifa of Granada
info_231: TAIFA OF GRANADA (AD 1012-1090),(1238–1492) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. (Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba . Conquered by State of Almoravides),(Recreated as a result of decay Almohad Caliphate. Conquered by Spain) The capital was Granada.
info_232: TAIFA OF ZARAGOZA (AD 1018-1142) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Zaragoza. Conquered by Kingdom of Aragon
info_233: TAIFA OF ALBARRACÍN (AD 1012-1104) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Albarracín. Conquered by State of Almoravides
info_234: TAIFA OF ALPUENTE (AD 1012-1103) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Alpuente. Conquered by State of Almoravides
info_235: TAIFA OF DÉNIA (AD 1010-1091) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Dénia. Conquered by State of Almoravides
info_236: TAIFA OF MURCIA (AD 1031-1078),(1223–1243) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. (Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. Conquered by Taifa of Seville),(Recreated as a result of decay Almohad Caliphate. Conquered by Kingdom of Aragon) The capital was Murcia
info_237: TAIFA OF CARMONA (AD 1023-1069) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Carmona. Conquered by Taifa of Seville
info_238: TAIFA OF SALTÉS AND HUELVA (AD 1023-1051) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Saltés. Conquered by Taifa of Seville
info_239: TAIFA OF SILVES (AD 1023-1063) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Silves. Conquered by Taifa of Seville
info_240: TAIFA OF VALENCIA (AD 1021-1102) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Valencia. Conquered by State of Almoravides
info_241: TAIFA OF SEVILLE (AD 1023-1091) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Seville, from 1070 — Córdoba. Conquered by State of Almoravides
info_242: TAIFA OF BADAJOZ (AD 1022-1094) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Badajoz. Conquered by State of Almoravides
info_243: TAIFA OF TOLEDO (AD 1029-1085) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Toledo. Conquered by Crown of Castile and León
info_244: TAIFA OF ALMERÍA (AD 1012-1091) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the collapse of Caliphate of Córdoba. The capital was Almería. Conquered by State of Almoravides
info_245: TAIFA OF MAJORCA (AD 1076-1116) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Spain (Balearic Islands) as a result of separation from Taifa of Dénia. The capital was Palma de Mallorca. Conquered by State of Almoravides
info_246: KINGDOM OF CASTILE (AD 1035–1037),(1065–1072),(1157–1230) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of separation from Kingdom of León. United with Kingdom of León, forming Crown of Castile and León),(Resumed as a result of separation from Kingdom of León. United with Kingdom of León, forming Crown of Castile and León),(Resumed as a result of separation from Kingdom of León. United with Kingdom of León, forming Crown of Castile and León). The capitals were Burgos, Toledo.
info_247: KINGDOM OF ARAGON (AD 1035–1516) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of separation from Kingdom of Navarre. United with Crown of Castile and León, forming Spain. The capital was Zaragoza.
info_248: CROWN OF CASTILE AND LEÓN (AD 1037–1065),(1072–1157),(1230–1516) State, feudal, monarchical . (Originated in the territory of modern Spain as a result of merger Kingdom of Castile and Kingdom of León. Separated into Kingdom of Castile and Kingdom of León),(Resumed as a result of merger Kingdom of Castile and Kingdom of León. Separated into Kingdom of Castile and Kingdom of León),(Resumed as a result of merger Kingdom of Castile and Kingdom of León. United with Kingdom of Aragon, forming Spain). The capitals were Burgos, Toledo.
info_249: PORTUGAL (AD 1143–1581),(1640–) State, capitalist (Portuguese Republic). (Formed in the territory of modern Portugal as a result of separation from Crown of Castile and León. Has become a part of Spain),(Separated from Spain). The capitals were Coimbra (up to 1256), Lisbon.
info_250: KINGDOM OF MAJORCA (AD 1262-1342) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Spain (Balearic Islands) as a result of separation from Kingdom of Aragon. The capital was Palma de Mallorca. Has become a part ofKingdom of Aragon
info_251: ANDORRA (AD 1278–) State, capitalist (Principality of Andorra). Formed in the territory of modern Andorra as a result of separation from France. The capital is Andorra la Vella
info_252: SPAIN (AD 1516–) State, capitalist. Formed in the territory of modern Spain as a result of merger Crown of Castile and León and Kingdom of Aragon. The capital is Madrid
info_253: GIBRALTAR (Brit.) (AD 1713–) Possession of Great Britain. Formed in the territory of modern Gibraltar (Brit.) as a result of Britain's rejection of the territory of Gibraltar from Spain. The capital is Gibraltar.
info_254: MENORCA (Brit.) (AD 1708–1782),(1798–1802) Possession of Great Britain. (Formed in the territory of modern Spain as a result of the Great Britain's tearing away of the island of Menorca from Spain. Returned to Spain),(Detached from Spain. Returned to Spain). The capital was Mahon.
info_255: MASSALIA (600–49 BC) City State, colony, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern France. Conquered by Roman Republic. Now in its place is the city of Marseille
info_256: GALLIC EMPIRE (AD 260-274) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern France as a result of separation from Roman Empire. The capital was Colonia Agrippina. Has become a part of Roman Empire.
info_257: KINGDOM OF THE BURGUNDIANS (AD 443-533) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Switzerland as a result of separation from Western Roman Empire. The capital was Geneva. Conquered by Frankish Empire.
info_258: KINGDOM OF SOISSONS (AD 476-486) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern France as a result of the collapse of Western Roman Empire. The capital was Noviodunum (modern-day Soissons). Conquered by Frankish Empire.
info_259: KINGDOM OF THE OSTROGOTHS (AD 493–553) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy in the process of decay Western Roman Empire. The capital was Ravenna. Conquered by Byzantine Empire
info_260: KINGDOM OF THE LOMBARDS (AD 568–774) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as result of the conquest by the Lombards areas of the Byzantine Empire. The capital was Pavia. Conquered by Frankish Empire
info_261: KINGDOM OF MIDDLE FRANCIA (AD 843–855) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the section Frankish Empire. The capital was Aachen. Separated between Kingdom of the West Franks, Kingdom of the East Franks and Lorraine
info_262: KINGDOM OF THE EAST FRANKS (AD 843–919) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the section Frankish Empire. The capital was Regensburg. Renamed to German Kingdom
info_263: LORRAINE (AD 855–870),(895–911) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Lorraine). (Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the section Kingdom of Middle Francia. Separated between Kingdom of the West Franks and Kingdom of the East Franks),(Reconstituted. Attached to Kingdom of the West Franks). The capital was cy.
info_264: BRITTANY (AD 845–1491) State, feudal, monarchical (Duchy of Brittany, 851–913 — kingdom). Formed in the territory of modern France as a result of separation from Kingdom of the West Franks, in 913 the Normans came to power. The capital was Rennes. Has become a part of France
info_265: KINGDOM OF ITALY (AD 875–961) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Kingdom of the East Franks. The capital was Pavia. Has become a part of German Kingdom
info_266: LOWER BURGUNDY (AD 879–933) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Lower Burgundy). Originated in the territory of modern France as a result of renaming Kingdom of Provence. The capital was Arles. United with Upper Burgundy into a single state — Kingdom of Arles
info_267: UPPER BURGUNDY (AD 888–933) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Upper Burgundy). Originated in the territory of modern Switzerland as a result of separation from Kingdom of the East Franks. The capital was Besancon. United with Lower Burgundy into a single state — Kingdom of Arles
info_268: KINGDOM OF ARLES (AD 933–1032) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern France as a result of merger Lower Burgundy and Upper Burgundy. The capital was Arles. Has become a part of Holy Roman Empire
info_269: GERMAN KINGDOM (AD 919–962) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of renaming Kingdom of the East Franks. The capital was Regensburg. Converted to Holy Roman Empire
info_270: HOLY ROMAN EMPIRE (AD 962–1232/1806) State, feudal, monarchical (Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation). Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the adoption of the title of Emperor by Otto I, the King of the German Kingdom. As a real state existed before AD 1232, it broke up into separate, virtually independent principalities. Officially, it was liquidated in 1806 during the Napoleonic wars
info_271: REPUBLIC OF PISA (AD 1003–1406) State, feudal, oligarchic republic. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Pisa. Conquered by Republic of Florence
info_272: ENGLAND (AD 927–1014),(1042–1707) State, monarchical (Kingdom of England). (Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom as a result of merger the king of Wessex by Ethelsten of seven kingdoms: Wessex, Sussex, Essex, Kent, Northumbria, East England and Mercia. Conquered by Denmark),(Re-created. United with Scotland, forming United Kingdom). The capital was London.
info_273: REPUBLIC OF GENOA(AD 1005–1797) State, feudal, oligarchic republic. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Genoa. Included by Napoleon in Ligurian Republic
info_274: MONACO (AD 1297–1793),(1814–) State, monarchical (Principality of Monaco). Originated in the territory of modern Monaco as a result of separation from Republic of Genoa. Joining to France.),(Separated from France). The capital was Monaco
info_275: PAPAL STATES(AD 752–1798),(1799–1809),(1815–1870) State, monarchical, theocratic. (Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Kingdom of the Lombards. Converted to Roman Republic),(Resumed. Shared between France and Kingdom of Italy (Napoleonic)), (Resumed. Joining to Italy). The capital was Rome
info_276: DUCHY OF BURGUNDY (AD 1363–1477) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern France as a result of separation from France. The capital was Dijon. Shared between France and Holy Roman Empire
info_277: PRINCIPALITY OF ORANGE (AD 1530–1713) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern France (as the county of France existed with 1163) as a result of separation from Papal States and transition under the rule of the Nassau dynasty. Was part of Holy Roman Empire. The capital was Orange. Joining to France
info_278: DUCHY OF SAVOY (AD 1416–1720) State, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Turin (up to 1653 — Chambéry ). Converted to Kingdom of Sardinia
info_279: SPANISH NETHERLANDS(AD 1581–1713) State, monarchical. Possession of Spain. Originated in the territory of modern Belgium as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Brussels. Converted to Austrian Netherlands
info_280: AUSTRIAN NETHERLANDS (AD 1713–1794) State, monarchical. Possession of Austrian Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Belgium as a result of the transfer of power in the Spanish Netherlands to the Austrian Habsburgs. The capital was Brussels. Joining to France
info_281: KINGDOM OF SARDINIA (AD 1720–1861) State, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of transformation of Duchy of Savoy and the annexation of the island of Sardinia. The capital was Turin (de jure - Cagliari). Has become a part of United Italy
info_282: SWITZERLAND (AD 1291–1798),(1803–) State, capitalist (Swiss Confederation, before 1848 - the Swiss Union). (Originated in the territory of modern Switzerland as a result of unification of the three cantons: Uri, Schwyz and Unterwalden in Holy Roman Empire (independence proclaimed in 1648). Converted to Helvetic Republic as a result of the Napoleonic wars),(Re-created). The capital is Berne
info_283: GERMANY (AD 1871–1945),(1949–) State, capitalist (up to 1943 - German Empire, since 1949 - Federal Republic of Germany). (Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the unification around German states of Prussia. It is divided into zones of occupation by the victorious countries in World War II: the USSR, the USA, United Kingdom, France), (Re-created in the territory of zones of occupation of the United States, United Kingdom and France). The capitals were Berlin (in 1949–1990 — Bonn).
info_284: ITALY (AD 1861–) State, capitalist. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of association around Kingdom of Sardinia of the Italian states. The capital is Rome.
info_285: FRANCE (zone of German occupation) (AD 1940–1944) Territory of modern France, temporarily occupied by Germany in World War II
info_286: FRANCE (zone of Italian occupation) (AD 1940–1944) Territory of modern France, temporarily occupied by Italy in World War II
info_287: FRENCH STATE (Vichy France) (AD 1940–1944) Formed in the territory of modern France. France's collaborative regime during its occupation by Nazi Germany. The capital was Vichy
info_288: VEII (1000–396 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Etruscans in the territory of modern Italy. Was a member of the Union of 12 city-states of Etruria. Destroyed by Roman Republic
info_289: VOLSINII (1000–280 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Etruscans in the territory of modern Italy. Was a member of the Union of 12 city-states of Etruria. Destroyed by Roman Republic
info_290: CLUSIUM (1000–280 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Etruscans in the territory of modern Italy. Was a member of the Union of 12 city-states of Etruria. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_291: MANTUA (600–218 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Etruscans in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_292: SPINA (600–218 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Etruscans in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_293: CERVETERI (1000–358 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Etruscans in the territory of modern Italy. Was a member of the Union of 12 city-states of Etruria. Destroyed by Roman Republic
info_294: MOTYA (900–305 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Phoenicians in the territory of modern Italy (Sicily). Conquered by Carthage.
info_295: ROME (754–509 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient latins in the territory of modern Italy. Converted to Roman Republic. The legendary founder and ruler - Romulus {754–716}
info_296: CUMAE (750–327 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic.
info_297: NAXOS (735–403 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy (Sicily). Destroyed by Syracuse. The first Greek colony in Sicily
info_298: SYRACUSE (733–241 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy (Sicily). Conquered by Roman Republic. The homeland of Archimedes {287–212 BC}
info_299: ZANCLE (730–493 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy (Sicily). Renamed to Messana
info_300: CATĂNA (729–241 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy (Sicily). Conquered by Roman Republic. At present - the city of Catania
info_301: SYBARIS (720–510 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy. Destroyed by Crotone. The nascent meaning of the word 'sybarite' came from the legend of the love of the inhabitants of the colony to luxury
info_302: CROTONE (708–264 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic.
info_303: TARENTO (706–264 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic. Currently - the city Taranto
info_304: NORA (700–535 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Phoenicians in the territory of modern Italy (Sardinia). Conquered by Carthage
info_305: NAPLES (700–327 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic.
info_306: GELA (690–280 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy (Sicily). Destroyed by Syracuse.
info_307: LOCRI (680–264 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_308: HIMERA (648–408 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy (Sicily). Destroyed by Carthage
info_309: SELINUNTE (628–409 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy (Sicily). Destroyed by Carthage
info_310: CAPUA (600–327 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Etruscans in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic. In 74 BC in the city of Capua Spartacus organized a conspiracy of gladiators.
info_311: TARQUINIA (1000–280 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by the Etruscans in the territory of modern Italy. Was a member of the Union of 12 city-states of Etruria. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_312: VELIA (648–327BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic. The city became famous for its philosophers: Parmenides and Zeno
info_313: MESSANA (493–241 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Italy (Sicily) as a result of renaming City State Zancle. Conquered by Roman Republic. At the present time - the city of Messina
info_314: ETRURIA (750–280 BC) The Union of 12 city-states. Formed in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic
