info_315: PROVENCE (AD 855–879) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Provence). Originated in the territory of modern France as a result of the section Kingdom of Middle Francia. The capital was Arles. Renamed to Kingdom of Lower Burgundy.
info_316: KINGDOM OF ODOACER(AD 476–493) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of the seizure of power in the Western Roman Empire by the Germanic leader Odoacer and proclaiming him king of Italy (formally has become a part of Byzantine Empire). The capital was Rome. Conquered by Ostrogothic Kingdom.
info_317: DUCHY OF BENEVENTO (AD 774–1081) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Kingdom of the Lombards. Joining to Papal States. The capital was Benevento
info_318: SAN MARINO (AD 301–) State, capitalist (Republic of San Marino). Formed in the territory of modern San Marino Saint Marino, who fled from Dalmatia (in present-day Croatia) from religious persecution, separated from Roman Empire. The capital is San Marino
info_319: REPUBLIC OF VENICE (AD 697–1797) State, feudal, oligarchic republic. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. The capital was Venice. It is divided between Austrian Empire, Cisalpine Republic and France
info_320: EMIRATE OF SICILY (AD 965-1091) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Fatimid Caliphate. The capital was Balarme (Palermo). Conquered by the Normans forming the Sicily County
info_321: SICILY COUNTY (AD 1071-1130) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of the conquest of the Normans of part of Emirate of Sicily. The capital was Balarme (Palermo). As a result of merger County of Apulia and Calabria and Sicily County formed Kingdom of Apulia and Sicily
info_322: SALERNO (AD 849–1078) State, feudal, monarchical (Principality of Salerno). Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Duchy of Benevento. Joining to County of Apulia and Calabria. The capital was Salerno
info_323: PRINCIPALITY OF CAPUA (AD 862–1130) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Principality of Salerno. Joining to Kingdom of Apulia and Sicily. The capital was Capua
info_324: TRENT (AD 1027–1803) State, feudal, theocratic (Bishopric of Trent). Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). Joining to Austrian Empire. The capital was Trent
info_325: APULIA AND CALABRIA (AD 1042–1130) State, feudal, monarchical (County of Apulia and Calabria). Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. The capital was Salerno. As a result of merger County of Apulia and Calabria and Sicily County formed Kingdom of Apulia and Sicily
info_326: DUCHY OF NAPLES (AD 1084–1144) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire (in the Byzantine Empire existed from 840) . The capital was Naples. Joining to Kingdom of Apulia and Sicily
info_327: APULIA AND SICILY (AD 1130–1282) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Apulia and Sicily). Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of merger County of Apulia and Calabria and Sicily County. The capital was Balarme (Palermo). After the separation of the Kingdom of Naples, Renamed to the Kingdom of Sicily
info_328: KINGDOM OF SICILY (AD 1282–1816) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of renaming Kingdom of Apulia and Sicily after the separation of the Kingdom of Naples. (In 1302-1416 was also called Kingdom of Trinacria). The capital was Palermo. United with Kingdom of Naples, forming Kingdom of the Two Sicilies
info_329: REPUBLIC OF FLORENCE (AD 1115–1532) State, feudal, oligarchic republic. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Florence. Converted to Duchy of Florence
info_330: SALUZZO (AD 1142–1548) State, feudal, monarchical. (Marquisate of Saluzzo). Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Saluzzo. Conquered by France
info_331: MONTFERRAT (AD 1232–1708) State, feudal, monarchical. (March of Montferrat, from 1574 — Duchy of Montferrat). Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Casale Monferrato. Joined to Duchy of Savoy
info_332: KINGDOM OF NAPLES (AD 1282 – 1799, January),(1799, July – 1816) State, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Kingdom of Apulia and Sicily. Converted to Parthenopean Republic),(Resumed. United with Kingdom of Sicily, forming Kingdom of the Two Sicilies). The capital was Naples.
info_333: ASTI (AD 1140–1372) State, feudal, monarchical. (County of Asti). Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Asti. Has become a part of France
info_334: DUCHY OF MILAN (AD 1395–1796) State, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Milan. Included in Transpadane Republic
info_335: DUCHY OF MANTUA (AD 1433–1745),(1791–1796) State, monarchical (up to 1530 — March). (Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). Joining to Duchy of Milan), (Separated from Duchy of Milan. Included in Transpadane Republic). The capital was Mantua.
info_336: DUCHY OF MODENA (AD 1452–1796),(1815–1859) State, monarchical (Duchy of Modena and Reggio). (Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). Included in Cispadane Republic ),(Resumed after abolition Kingdom of Italy (Napoleonic). Has become a part of United Provinces of Central Italy). The capital was Modena
info_337: FERRARA (AD 1471–1598) State, feudal, monarchical (Duchy of Ferrara). Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Duchy of Modena. The capital was Ferrara. Has become a part of Papal States
info_338: LUCCA (AD 1160–1342),(1369–1805) State, feudal, oligarchic republic (Republic of Lucca). (Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). Joining to Republic of Pisa), (Separated from Republic of Pisa. Converted to Principality of Lucca and Piombino). The capital was Lucca.
info_339: REPUBLIC OF SIENA (AD 1143–1555) State, feudal, oligarchic republic. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Siena. Has become a part of Duchy of Florence
info_340: ARCHDUCHY OF AUSTRIA (AD 1156–1251),(1278–1526) State, feudal, monarchical (up to 1453 — Duchy of Austria). (Originated in the territory of modern Austria as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). Conquered by Czechia),(Restored independence. Has become a part of the Habsburg Empire (as part of the Habsburg Empire, Austrian Empire and Austria-Hungary existed until 1918). The capital was Vienna.
info_341: PIOMBINO (AD 1399–1801) State, feudal, monarchical (from 1594 — Principality of Piombino). Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Republic of Pisa (formally was part of Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Piombino. Joining to Kingdom of Etruria
info_342: CISPADANE REPUBLIC (AD 1796–1797) State, vassal republic of France. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of Napoleon's victory. The capital was Bologna. Combined with Transpadane Republic in Cisalpine Republic
info_343: HABSBURG EMPIRE (AD 1526–1804) State, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Austria as a result of joining to Archduchy of Austria Czechia and Hungary. The capital was Vienna. Converted to Austrian Empire.
info_344: DUCHY OF FLORENCE (AD 1532–1569) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of the establishment of a monarchical system in the Republic of Florence. The capital was Florence. Converted to Grand Duchy of Tuscany
info_345: DUCHY OF PARMA (AD 1545–1801),(1815–1859) State, monarchical (Duchy of Parma, Piacenza and Guastalla ). (Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of separation from Duchy of Milan. Included in Cisalpine Republic), (Resumed after the end of the French occupation. Has become a part of United Provinces of Central Italy). The capital was Parma
info_346: GRAND DUCHY OF TUSCANY (AD 1569–1801),(1815–1859) State, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Italy as a result of renaming Duchy of Florence. Converted in Kingdom of Etruria), (Resumed after the end of the French occupation. Has become a part of United Provinces of Central Italy). The capital was Florence.
info_347: TRANSPADANE REPUBLIC (AD 1796–1797) State, vassal republic of France. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of Napoleon's victory. The capital was Milan. Combined with Cispadane Republic in Cisalpine Republic
info_348: CISALPINE REPUBLIC (AD 1797–1799),(1801–1802) State, vassal republic of France. (Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of merger Transpadane Republic and Cispadane Republic. Attached to Habsburg Empire), (Restored as a result of Napoleon's victory. Renamed to Italian Republic (Napoleonic)). The capital was Milan.
info_349: LIGURIAN REPUBLIC (AD 1797–1805) State, vassal republic of France. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of transformation of Republic of Genoa. The capital was Genoa. Joining to France
info_350: ROMAN REPUBLIC (NAPOLEONIC) (AD 1798–1799) State, vassal republic of France. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of the liquidation by Napoleon of the Papal States. Eliminated as a result of the restoration of the Papal States. The capital was Rome.
info_351: Parthenopean Republic (AD 1799, January–1799, July) State, vassal republic of France. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of the overthrow of the monarchy in the Kingdom of Naples. Eliminated as a result of the restoration of the monarchy in the Kingdom of Naples. The capital was Naples.
info_352: KINGDOM OF ETRURIA (AD 1801–1807) State, vassal kingdom of France. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of transformation of Grand Duchy of Tuscany. The capital was Florence. Joining to France
info_353: ITALIAN REPUBLIC (Napoleonic) (AD 1802–1805) State, vassal kingdom of France. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of renaming Cisalpine Republic. Converted to Kingdom of Italy (Napoleonic). The capital was Milan.
info_354: AUSTRIAN EMPIRE (AD 1804–1867) State, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Austria as a result of the renaming of the Habsburg Empire. The capital was Vienna. Converted to Austria-Hungary.
info_355: Lucca and Piombino (AD 1805–1815) State, vassal principality of France (Principality of Lucca and Piombino). Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of transformation of Republic of Lucca . The capital was Lucca. Converted to Duchy of Lucca
info_356: KINGDOM OF ITALY (Napoleonic) (AD 1805–1815) State, vassal kingdom of France. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of transformation of Italian Republic (Napoleonic). Eliminated by the Austrian Empire as a result of the defeat of Napoleon. In its place are formed Kingdom of Lombardy–Venetia (Austrian) and others states. The capital was Milan.
info_357: ILLYRIAN PROVINCES (Fr.) (AD 1809–1813) Autonomous region of France. Formed in the territory of modern Slovenia as a result of the concession of a part of the territory by the Austrian Empire to France. The capital was Ljubljana. Attached to Austrian Empire
info_358: DUCHY OF LUCCA (AD 1815–1847) State, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of the establishment of independence from France in the Principality of Lucca and Piombino. The capital was Lucca. Attached to Grand Duchy of Tuscany
info_359: KINGDOM OF LOMBARDY–VENETIA (Austrian) (AD 1815–1866) Possession of Austrian Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of the defeat of Napoleon and the liquidation of the Kingdom of Italy (Napoleonic). The capital was Milan (from 1859 — Venice). Attached to Austrian Empire
info_360: KINGDOM OF THE TWO SICILIES (AD 1816–1861) State, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of merger Kingdom of Naples and Kingdom of Sicily. The capital was Naples. Has become a part of united Italy
info_361: UNITED PROVINCES OF CENTRAL ITALY (AD 1859–1860) State education under management Kingdom of Sardinia. Formed in the territory of modern Italy as a result of merger Duchy of Modena, Duchy of Parma, Grand Duchy of Tuscany and parts of the territory of the Papal States. There were no capitals. Has become a part of Kingdom of Sardinia
info_362: AUSTRIA-HUNGARY (AD 1867–1918) State, monarchical (Austro-Hungarian Empire). Originated in the territory of modern Austria resulting in the renaming of Austrian Empire. The capital was Vienna. Disintegrated (several new states were formed on the territory of the former empire - Czechoslovakia, Poland, the Austrian Republic, Hungary, the rest of the regions were part of Romania, Yugoslavia and Italy.)
info_363: AUSTRIA (AD 1918–1938),(1945–) State, capitalist, republic (Austrian Republic). (Originated in the territory of modern Austria as a result of the collapse of Austria-Hungary. Joining to Germany (anschluss),(Released by Allied forces and restored independence). The capital is Vienna
info_364: FREE TERRITORY OF TRIESTE (AD 1947–1954) State formation, created in the territory of modern Italy by decision of the United Nations. The capital was Trieste. Shared between Italy and Yugoslavia
info_365: VATICAN (AD 1929–) State monarchical, theocratic. Originated in the territory of modern Vatican as a result of separation from Italy. The capital was legally absent, in fact Vatican
info_366: NEUCHÂTEL (AD 1648–1707),(1806–1815) State, monarchical (Principality of Neuchâtel). (Formed in the territory of modern Switzerland as a result of separation from Switzerland. Has become a part of Prussia),(As a result of the victory of Napoleonic troops returned independence. Has become a part of Switzerland). The capital was Neuchâtel.
info_367: PRUSSIA (AD 1701–1871) State, monarchical (Kingdom of Prussia). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of transformation of Electorate of Brandenburg-Prussia, which was part of the Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Berlin.
info_368: HELVETIC REPUBLIC (AD 1798–1803) State, capitalist. Formed in the territory of modern Switzerland as a result of transformation of Switzerland as a result of the Napoleonic wars. Converted to Switzerland. The capital was Berne
info_369: AVAR KHAGANATE (AD 562–623),(658–796) State, feudal. (Originated in the territory of modern Hungary as a result of the settlement of the nomadic tribes Avar of the territory of Byzantine Empire),(Conquered by Samo's Empire. Resumed as a result of the victory of the Avars over Samo's Empire. Destroyed by Frankish Empire)
info_370: SAMO'S EMPIRE (AD 623–658) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Czechia as a result of the conquest by the Slavs (Vends) of the Avarian Kaganate. Disintegrated as a result of defeat from Avars
info_371: CARANTANIA (AD 658–788) State, feudal, slavic (Principality of Carantania). Originated in the territory of modern Austria as a result of the collapse of Samo's Empire. Capital Karnburg. Conquered by Frankish Empire
info_372: DUCHY OF BAVARIA (AD 554–788) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of merger the Germanic tribes of the Bavarians. The capital was Regensburg. Conquered by Frankish Empire
info_373: GREAT MORAVIA (AD 833–906) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Czechia as a result of merger of the Slavic tribes. The capital was Veligrad. Disintegrated as a result of the defeat of the Hungarian tribes
info_374: HUNGARY (AD 1000–1526),(1918–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Hungary). (Originated in the territory of modern Hungary as a result of the invasion of Hungarian tribes and the formation of the Kingdom of Hungary. Conquered by Ottoman Empire, since 1687 as part of the Habsburg Empire),(Revived as a result of the collapse of Austria-Hungary, in 1949-1989-Hungarian People's Republic). The capitals were Esztergom (1000–1242), Buda (1242–1323,1350–1541), Vyšehrad (1323–1350), Budapest (from 1918)
info_375: CZECHIA (AD 1198–1526),(1993–) State, capitalist, republic (Czech Republic). (Originated in the territory of modern Czechia (Czech Kingdom, another name — Kingdom of Bohemia) as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). Has become a part of Habsburg Empire),(Revived as a result of the collapse of Czechoslovakia). The capital was Prague
info_376: Salzburg (AD 1278–1805) State, theocratic (Principality of Salzburg or Archbishopric of Salzburg, since 1803 — Grand Principality of Salzburg). Originated in the territory of modern Austria as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). Joining to Austrian Empire. The capital was Salzburg
info_377: KINGDOM OF BAVARIA (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of Holy Roman Empire and transformations to Electorate Bavaria. In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866-member of the German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Munich.
info_378: LIECHTENSTEIN (AD 1791–) State monarchical (Principality of Liechtenstein). Originated in the territory of modern Liechtenstein as a result of merger counties of Vaduz and Schellenberg and their separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in Holy Roman Empire). The capital is Vaduz
info_379: KINGDOM OF THURINGIA (AD 450–531) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of merger the Germanic tribes of Thuringia. Conquered by Frankish Empire
info_380: DUCHY OF SAXONY (AD 555–797) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of merger the Saxon tribes. Conquered by Frankish Empire
info_381: POLAND (AD 960–1569),(1916–1939),(1945–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Poland). (Originated in the territory of modern Poland as a result of merger Polish tribes and the formation of the Polish principality, since 1025 — Kingdom of Poland. United with Grand Duchy of Lithuania in the confederation Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth),(Revived as a result of recognition by Germany and Austria-Hungary of the independent Kingdom of Poland, since 1919 — Republic of Poland. Eliminated by Germany as a result of the occupation, in the territory of Poland The Governor General was created),(It was created as a result of the liberation from the German occupation by Soviet troops; in 1945-1989 - the Polish People's Republic). The capitals were Gniezno (up to 1320), Kraków (1320–1569), Warsaw
info_382: DENMARK (AD 935–1940),(1945–) State monarchical (Kingdom of Denmark). (Originated in the territory of modern Denmark as a result of the merger of individual tribal groups into one territorial state. Occupied by Germany),(Resumed as a result of the victory of the anti-Hitler coalition over Germany). The capital is Copenhagen
info_383: SCHLESWIG (AD 1058–1386),(1474–1863) State, feudal (Duchy of Schleswig). (Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of separation from Denmark. United with County of Holstein, forming County of Schleswig-Holstein),(Recreated as a result of the county division Schleswig-Holstein. Has become a part of Prussia). Repeatedly in the vassal dependency of Denmark and Holy Roman Empire.
info_384: HOLSTEIN (AD 1110–1386),(1474–1863) State, feudal (County (from 1474 Duchy) Holstein). (Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of separation from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in the Holy Roman Empire). United with Duchy of Schleswig, forming County of Schleswig-Holstein),(Recreated as a result of the county division Schleswig-Holstein as Duchy of Holstein. Has become a part of Prussia). Repeatedly in the vassal dependency of Denmark and Holy Roman Empire. The capital was Kiel
info_385: SCHLESWIG-HOLSTEIN (AD 1386–1474) State, feudal (County of Schleswig-Holstein). Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of merger Duchy of Schleswig and County of Holstein. Repeatedly in the vassal dependency of Denmark and Holy Roman Empire. The capital was Kiel
name_386: Republic of the Seven United Netherlands
info_386: REPUBLIC OF THE SEVEN UNITED NETHERLANDS (AD 1581–1795) State, republic. Formed in the territory of modern Netherlands as a result of the victory of the Netherlands bourgeois revolution and separation from Holy Roman Empire. Converted to Batavian Republic as a result of the Napoleonic wars. The capital was The Hague.
label_386: Republic of the Seven United Netherlands
info_387: SWEDISH POMERANIA (AD 1630–1815) State, monarchical. Possession of Sweden. Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the Swedish-Polish wars and secession from Holy Roman Empire (formally remained in the Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Stettin (up to 1720), Greifswald (from 1720). Has become a part of Prussia
info_388: BREMEN-VERDEN (Swedish) (AD 1648–1715) State, monarchical (Duchy of Bremen and Principality of Verden). Possession of Sweden. Originated in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the Danish-Swedish wars and separation fromHoly Roman Empire (formally remained in the Holy Roman Empire). The capital was Stade. Has become a part of Holy Roman Empire
info_389: BADEN (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Grand Duchy of Baden). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire and transformation into Electorate Baden. In 1806–1813 — member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866 - a member of the German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Karlsruhe
info_390: BERG (AD 1806–1813) State, monarchical (Grand Duchy of Berg). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire and accession to Duchy of Berg Duchy of Cleves. Member of the Rhine Union. Has become a part of Prussia. The capital was Düsseldorf.
info_391: HESSE (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Grand Duchy of Hesse, from 1816 — Grand Duchy of Hesse and by Rhine). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire and transformation into Landgraviate of Hesse-Darmstadt. In 1806-1813 member of the Rhenish Union, 1815-1866 — member of the German Confederation, 1867-1871 — partially a member of the North German Confederation (Upper Hesse). Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Darmstadt
info_392: ASCHAFFENBURG(AD 1806–1810) State, monarchical (Principality of Aschaffenburg). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire. member of the Rhenish Union. Has become a part of Grand Duchy of Frankfurt. The capital was Aschaffenburg.
info_393: KINGDOM OF SAXONY (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire and transformation into Electorate of Saxony. In 1806-1813 - a member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866-a member of the German Union, in 1867-1871-a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Dresden
info_394: WÜRTTEMBERG (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Kingdom of Württemberg). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire and transformation into Electorate of Württemberg. In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866-member of the German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Stuttgart
info_395: WÜRZBURG (AD 1806–1814) State, monarchical (Grand Duchy of Würzburg). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1805). In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union. Has become a part of Kingdom of Bavaria. The capital was Würzburg
info_396: ANHALT-BERNBURG (AD 1806–1863) State, monarchical (Duchy of Anhalt-Bernburg). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1803 as a result of transformation of Principality of Anhalt-Bernburg). In 1807-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1863-member of the German Union. Has become a part of united Duchy of Anhalt. The capital was Bernburg
info_397: ANHALT-DESSAU (AD 1806–1863) State, monarchical (Duchy of Anhalt-Dessau, for 1807 — Principality of Anhalt-Dessau). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire. In 1807-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1863-member of the German Union. Has become a part of united Duchy of Anhalt. The capital was Dessau
info_398: ANHALT-KÖTHEN (AD 1806–1847) State, monarchical (Duchy of Anhalt-Köthen, for 1807 — Principality of Anhalt-Köthen). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire and transformation into The Principality Anhalt-Köthen. In 1807-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1847-member of the German Union. Has become a part of Duchy of Anhalt-Dessau. The capital was Köthen
info_399: ARENBERG (AD 1806–1810) State, monarchical (Duchy of Arenberg). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1645 as a result of transformation of County of Arenberg). Member of the Rhine Union. Attached to France (in 1814 shared between Hanover and Prussia). The capital was Arenberg
info_400: HOHENZOLLERN-HECHINGEN (AD 1806–1850) State, monarchical (Principality of Hohenzollern-Hechingen). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1623 as a result of transformation of County of Hohenzollern-Hechingen). In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1850 - member of the German Union. Has become a part of Prussia. The capital was Hechingen
info_401: HOHENZOLLERN-SIGMARINGEN (AD 1806–1850) State, monarchical (Principality of Hohenzollern-Sigmaringen). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1623 as a result of transformation of County of Hohenzollern-Sigmaringen). In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1850 - member of the German Union. Has become a part of Prussia. The capital was Sigmaringen
info_402: ISENBURG (AD 1806–1814) State, monarchical (Principality of Isenburg). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire. Member of the Rhine Union. Shared between Hesse and Hesse-Kassel. The capital was Isenburg
info_403: LEYEN (AD 1806–1814) State, monarchical (Principality of Leyen). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire. Member of the Rhine Union. Became part of Austrian Empire. The capital was Hohengeroldseck
info_404: LIPPE-DETMOLD (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Principality of Lippe-Detmold). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1789 as a result of transformation of County of Lippe-Detmold). In 1807-1813 - a member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866 - a member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Detmold
info_405: MECKLENBURG-SCHWERIN (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Grand Duchy (up to 1815 — Duchy) of Mecklenburg-Schwerin). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1348). In 1808-1813 - a member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866 - a member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Schwerin
info_406: MECKLENBURG-STRELITZ (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Grand Duchy (up to 1815 — Duchy) Mecklenburg-Strelitz). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1701). In 1808-1813 - a member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866 - a member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Neustrelitz
info_407: NASSAU (AD 1806–1866) State, monarchical (Duchy of Nassau). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire and the unification of principalities Nassau-Usingen and Nassau-Weilburg. In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866-member of the German Union. Has become a part of Prussia. The capitals were Weilburg, Wiesbaden (from 1816)
info_408: OLDENBURG (AD 1806–1810),(1814–1871) State, monarchical (Grand Duchy (up to 1829 — Duchy) Oldenburg). (Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1773). Joining to France),(Re-created. Has become a part of united Germany). In 1808-1813 - a member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866 - a member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. The capital was Oldenburg
info_409: REUSS (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Principality of Reuss). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (consisted of four parts: Principalities of Reuss-Ebersdorf, Reuss-Greiz, Reuss-Lobenstein, Reuss-Schleiz; in 1848 transformed into two principalities: Reuss Junior Line and Reuss Elder Line ). In 1807-1813 - a member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866 - a member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany). The capital was Gera
info_410: SALM (AD 1806–1810) State, monarchical (Principality of Salm). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1802). Member of the Rhine Union. Joined to France (in 1814 joined to Prussia). The capital was Bocholt
info_411: SAXE-COBURG-SAALFELD (AD 1806–1826) State, monarchical (Duchy of Saxe-Coburg-Saalfeld). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1699). In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1826 - a member of the German Union. United with Duchy of Saxe-Gotha-Altenburg in Duchy of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha. The capital was Coburg
info_412: SAXE-GOTHA-ALTENBURG (AD 1806–1826) State, monarchical (Duchy of Saxe-Gotha-Altenburg). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1680). In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1826 - a member of the German Union. United with Duchy of Saxe-Coburg-Saalfeld in Duchy of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha. The capital was Gotha
info_413: SAXE-HILDBURGHAUSEN (AD 1806–1826) State, monarchical (Duchy of Saxe-Hildburghausen). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1680). In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1826 - a member of the German Union. Joining to Duchy of Saxe-Meiningen . The capital was Hildburghausen
info_414: SAXE-MEININGEN (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Duchy of Saxe-Meiningen). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1680). In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866 - member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Meiningen
info_415: SAXE-WEIMAR (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Duchy of Saxe-Weimar; until 1809 was divided into two duchies Saxe-Weimar and Saxe-Eisenach). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1572). In 1806-1813 - member of the Rhine Union, in 1815-1866 - member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Weimar
info_416: SCHAUMBURG-LIPPE (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Principality of Schaumburg-Lippe; until 1807 — County of Schaumburg-Lippe). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1643). In 1807–1813 — member of the Rhine Union, 1815–1866 — member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Bückeburg
info_417: SCHWARZBURG-RUDOLSTADT (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical Principality of Schwarzburg-Rudolstadt). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1710 as a result of transformation of County of Schwarzburg-Rudolstadt). In 1807–1813 — Member of the Rhine Union, 1815–1866 — member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Rudolstadt
info_418: SCHWARZBURG-SONDERSHAUSEN (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical Principality of Schwarzburg-Sondershausen). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1699 as a result of transformation of County of Schwarzburg-Sondershausen). In 1807–1813 — Member of the Rhine Union, 1815–1866 — member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Sondershausen
info_419: WALDECK (AD 1806–1871) State, monarchical (Principality of Waldeck). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1712). In 1807–1813 — Member of the Rhine Union, 1815–1866 — member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Arolsen
info_420: HAMBURG (AD 1806–1807),(1814–1871) City State (Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg). (Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1510). Joining to France),(Re-created. Has become a part of united Germany). In 1815–1866 — member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. The capital was Hamburg
info_421: BREMEN (AD 1806–1807),(1814–1871) City State (Free and Hanseatic City of Bremen). (Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1715). Joining to France),(Re-created. Has become a part of united Germany). In 1815–1866 — member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. The capital was Bremen
info_422: LÜBECK (AD 1806–1807),(1814–1871) City State (Free and Hanseatic City of Lübeck). (Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of liquidation of the Holy Roman Empire (as a part Holy Roman Empire formed in 1226). Joining to France),(Re-created. Has become a part of united Germany). In 1815–1866 — member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. The capital was Lübeck
info_423: WESTPHALIA (AD 1807–1813) State, monarchical (Kingdom of Westphalia). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of separation from Prussia. Member of the Rhine Union. Separated between Prussia and Electorate of Hesse-Kassel. The capital was Kassel
info_424: KINGDOM OF THE NETHERLANDS (AD 1806–1810) State, monarchical . Formed in the territory of modern Netherlands as a result of transformation of Batavian Republic. Joining to France. The capital was The Hague
info_425: GRAND DUCHY OF FRANKFURT (AD 1810–1813) State, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of transformation of Principality of Aschaffenburg and the accession to it of a number of territories occupied by France. Separated between Free City of Frankfurt and Bavaria. The capital was Aschaffenburg
info_426: HESSE-KASSEL (AD 1813–1866) State, monarchical (Electorate of Hesse-Kassel). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the section of Kingdom of Westphalia (in the Holy Roman Empire existed in 1803-1806). In 1815–1866 — member of the German Union. Has become a part of Prussia. The capital was Kassel
info_427: FREE CITY OF FRANKFURT (AD 1813–1866) City State. Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the section Grand Duchy of Frankfurt (in the Holy Roman Empire existed in 1803-1806). In 1815–1866 — member of the German Union. Has become a part of Prussia. The capital was Frankfurt
info_428: HANOVER (AD 1814–1866) State, monarchical (Kingdom of Hanover). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the defeat of Napoleon in the territory of former Electorate of Hanover (Was part of Holy Roman Empire), included a part of the territory of Prussia and the occupied areas of France. In 1815–1866 — member of the German Union. Has become a part of Prussia. The capital was Hanover
info_429: BRAUNSCHWEIG (AD 1815–1871) State, monarchical (Duchy of Braunschweig). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of separation from Hanover. Member of the German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Braunschweig
info_430: SAXE-COBURG AND GOTHA (AD 1826–1871) State, monarchical (Duchy of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of merger duchies Saxe-Coburg-Saalfeld and Saxe-Gotha-Altenburg. In 1826–1866 — member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capitals were Coburg, Gotha
info_431: ANHALT (AD 1863–1871) State, monarchical (Duchy of Anhalt). Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of merger duchies Anhalt-Bernburg and Anhalt-Dessau. In 1863–1866 — member of the German Union, in 1867-1871 - a member of the North German Union. Has become a part of united Germany. The capital was Dessau
info_432: TERRITORY OF THE SAAR BASIN (AD 1920–1935) Territory under a League of Nations mandate. Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of separation from Germany after the defeat of Germany in World War I. Become a part of Germany. The capital was Saarbrücken
info_433: SOVIET OCCUPATION ZONE OF GERMANY (AD 1945–1949) Formed in the territory of modern Germany. Part of the territory of Germany, occupied by the USSR as a result of Germany's defeat in the World War II. In the territory of zone proclaimed the German Democratic Republic. Headquarters of the occupation troops — Berlin.
info_434: BRITISH OCCUPATION ZONE OF GERMANY (AD 1945–1949) Formed in the territory of modern Germany. Part of the territory of Germany, occupied by United Kingdom as a result of Germany's defeat in the World War II. In the territory of British, French and American occupation zones proclaimed Federal Republic of Germany. Headquarters of the occupation troops — Bad Oeynhausen.
info_435: FRENCH OCCUPATION ZONE OF GERMANY (AD 1945–1949) Formed in the territory of modern Germany. Part of the territory of Germany, occupied by France as a result of Germany's defeat in the World War II. In the territory of British, French and American occupation zones proclaimed Federal Republic of Germany. Headquarters of the occupation troops — Baden Baden.
info_436: AMERICAN OCCUPATION ZONE OF GERMANY (AD 1945–1949) Formed in the territory of modern Germany. Part of the territory of Germany, occupied by USA as a result of Germany's defeat in the World War II. In the territory of British, French and American occupation zones proclaimed Federal Republic of Germany. Headquarters of the occupation troops — Frankfurt am Main.
info_437: SAAR (Fr.) (AD 1945–1956) Protectorate of France. Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the occupation of the territory of France as a result of the defeat of Germany in World War II. Became part of Germany. The capital was Saarbrücken
info_438: SOVIET OCCUPATION SECTOR OF BERLIN (AD 1945–1949) Formed in the territory of modern Germany. art of the territory of Berlin, occupied by the USSR as a result of Germany's defeat in the World War II. Become a part of German Democratic Republic.
info_439: BRITISH OCCUPATION SECTOR OF BERLIN (AD 1945–1949) Formed in the territory of modern Germany. Part of the territory of Berlin, occupied by United Kingdom as a result of Germany's defeat in the World War II.In the territory of the British, French and American occupation sectors of Berlin, a special political entity was created - West Berlin
info_440: FRENCH OCCUPATION SECTOR OF BERLIN (AD 1945–1949) Formed in the territory of modern Germany. Part of the territory of Berlin, occupied by France as a result of Germany's defeat in the World War II.In the territory of the British, French and American occupation sectors of Berlin, a special political entity was created - West Berlin
info_441: AMERICAN OCCUPATION SECTOR OF BERLIN (AD 1945–1949) Formed in the territory of modern Germany. Part of the territory of Berlin, occupied by USA as a result of Germany's defeat in the World War II.In the territory of the British, French and American occupation sectors of Berlin, a special political entity was created - West Berlin
info_442: GERMAN DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC (GDR) (AD 1949–1990) State, socialist. Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of the proclamation of the German Democratic Republic in the territory of Soviet occupation zone of Germany and Soviet Occupation Sector of Berlin. Has become a part of Germany. The capital was East Berlin
info_443: WEST BERLIN (AD 1949–1990) Special political entity. Formed in the territory of modern Germany as a result of merger British, French and American occupation sectors of Berlin. Has become a part of Germany
info_444: PRINCE-BISHOPRIC OF LIÈGE (AD 980–1795) State, theocratic. Originated in the territory of modern Belgium as part of Holy Roman Empire. Joining to France. The capital was Liège.
info_445: LUXEMBOURG (AD 1384–1443),(1477–1581),(1866–1914),(1918–1940),(1944–) State, capitalist. (Originated in the territory of modern Luxembourg as part of Holy Roman Empire as a result of transformation of County of Luxembourg (originated in 963) in the duchy. Joining to Duchy of Burgundy),(Re-created. Has become a part of Spanish Netherlands),(Separated from Netherlands (Grand Duchy of Luxembourg, as part of Netherlands existed since 1815. Occupied by Germany),(Resumed. Occupied by Germany (from 1941 Included in the composition of Germany)),(Resumed). The capital was Luxembourg
info_446: NETHERLANDS (AD 1815–1940),(1944–) State, capitalist (Kingdom of Netherlands). (Originated in the territory of modern Netherlands as a result of liberation Lower Lands (approximately consisting of the current Belgium and the Netherlands) from the French occupation. Occupied by Germany),(Resumed as a result of the victory of the anti-Hitler coalition over Germany). The capital was Amsterdam
info_447: BELGIUM (AD 1830–1914),(1918–1940),(1944–) State, capitalist (Kingdom of Belgium). (Originated in the territory of modern Belgium as a result of separation from Netherlands. Occupied by Germany),(Resumed. Occupied by Germany),(Resumed). The capital was Brussels
info_448: BATAVIAN REPUBLIC (AD 1795–1806) State, monarchical . Formed in the territory of modern Netherlands as a result of the Napoleonic wars and transformation into Republic of the Seven United Netherlands. Converted to Kingdom of Holland. The capital was The Hague
info_449: SWEDEN {AD 970–1397),(1523–) State monarchical (Kingdom of Sweden). (Originated in the territory of modern Sweden as a result as a result of the union of the Swedes and Geats tribes by the Yngling dynasty. United with Denmark),(Out of Denmark). The capitals were Uppsala (up to 1634), Stockholm (from 1634)
info_450: KIEVAN RUS' (AD 862–1240) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of merger of the East Slavic tribes under the rule of the princes of the Rurik dynasty. Disintegrated into separate principalities. The capital was Kiev.
info_451: PRINCIPALITY OF HALYCH (AD 1140–1199) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Kievan Rus' (as part of Kievan Rus' existed since 1084). United with Principality of Volhynia in Principality of Galicia–Volhynia. The capital was Halych
info_452: PRINCIPALITY OF POLOTSK (AD 1044–1307) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Belarus as a result of separation from Kievan Rus' (as part of Kievan Rus' existed since 981). Has become a part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania. The capital was Polotsk
info_453: PRINCIPALITY OF VOLHYNIA (AD 1154–1199) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Kievan Rus' (as part of Kievan Rus' existed since 988). United with Principality of Halych in Principality of Galicia–Volhynia. The capital was Volodymyr-Volynskyi
info_454: GRAND DUCHY OF LITHUANIA (AD 1236–1569) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Lithuania as a result of merger of the Lithuanian lands by Prince Mindaugas. United with Poland in confederation Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth. The capital was Vilnius
info_455: TEUTONIC ORDER (AD 1224–1525) State, feudal, theocratic. As a state originated in the territory of modern Poland as a result of the conquest of part of the Polish lands by the knights of the Teutonic Order (was founded in 1190). Converted to Duchy of Prussia as part of Holy Roman Empire. The capitals were Marienburg, from 1466 — Königsberg
info_456: PRINCIPALITY OF GALICIA–VOLHYNIA (AD 1199–1240) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of merger Principalitiy of Halych and Principalitiy of Volhynia. It fell under the Tatar-Mongol yoke. The capitals were Volodymyr-Volynskyi (1199–1205), Halych (1238–1240)
info_457: POLISH–LITHUANIAN COMMONWEALTH (AD 1569–1795) State, feudal, monarchical, confederation. Originated in the territory of modern Poland as a result of merger Kingdom of Poland and Grand Duchy of Lithuania. Separated between Prussia, Habsburg Empire and the Russian Empire. The capitals were Kraków (up to 1596), Warsaw
info_458: DUCHY OF WARSAW (AD 1807–1815) State, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Poland under the protectorate of Napoleonic France. Separated between Prussia, Austrian Empire and Russian Empire. The capital was Warsaw
info_459: REPUBLIC OF CRACOW (AD 1815–1846) State, republic. Formed in the territory of modern Poland under the direct patronage Russian Empire, Austrian Empire and Prussia after the partition of the Duchy of Warsaw. Joining to Austrian Empire. The capital was Cracow
info_460: CZECHOSLOVAKIA (AD 1918–1939),(1945–1992) State, socialist (from 1945), republic. (Formed in the territory of modern Czechia and Slovakia as a result of the collapse of Austria-Hungary (Czechoslovak Republic). It ceased to exist as a result of the occupation of Czechia by Germany (in the occupied territory of the formed Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia) and the proclamation of the independence of Slovakia),(It was re-created as a result of the liberation from the German occupation by Soviet troops; in 1960–1989 — Czechoslovak Socialist Republic. It broke up in the Czech Republic and Slovakia). The capital was Prague
info_461: RUSSIAN REPUBLIC (AD 1917, February - 1917, October) State, capitalist. Formed in the territory of modern Russia as a result of liquidation of the monarchy in Russian Empire as a result of the February revolution. Converted to Soviet Russia (RSFSR) As a result of the state overturn (October Revolution). The capital was Petrograd
info_462: FREE CITY OF DANZIG (AD 1920–1939) City State, republic. Formed in the territory of modern Poland as a result of separation from Germany in accordance with the Versailles Peace Treaty under the protectorate of the League of Nations. Joined to Germany. The capital was Danzig (modern Gdańsk)
info_463: UNION OF SOVIET SOCIALIST REPUBLICS (USSR) (1922–1991) State, socialist. Formed in the territory of modern Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Georgia, Armenia and Azerbaijan through the unification of the RSFSR, the Ukrainian SSR (Ukraine), the BSSR (Belarus), and the ZFSFR (Transcaucasian Socialist Federative Soviet Republic). Break up into 15 independent states. The capital was Moscow
info_464: CZECH DUCHY (AD 895–950) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Czechia as a result of separation from Great Moravia. Has become a part of German Kingdom. The capital was Prague
info_465: PRINCIPALITY OF NITRA (AD 796–833) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Slovakia after the destruction of the Avar Khaganate by Frankish Empire. Has become a part of Great Moravia. The capital was Nitra
info_466: SLOVAK REPUBLIC (First) (AD 1939–1945) State, republic, a satellite of fascist Germany. Formed in the territory of modern Slovakia as a result of the section Czechoslovakia. Has become a part of Czechoslovakia. The capital was Bratislava
info_467: SLOVAKIA (AD 1993–) State, capitalist, republic (Slovak Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Slovakia as a result of the collapse of Czechoslovakia. The capital was Bratislava
info_468: BALATON PRINCIPALITY (AD 839–876) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Hungary as a result of separation from Frankish Empire. Has become a part of Great Moravia. The capital was Mosaburg
info_469: FIRST BULGARIAN EMPIRE (AD 681–1018) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Bulgaria as a result of the conquest of Proto-Bulgarian tribes led by Khan Asparukh of the territory of Byzantine Empire. Conquered by Byzantine Empire. The capitals were Pliska (681–893) Preslav (893–972), Skopje (972–992), Ohrid (992–1018)
info_470: EASTERN HUNGARIAN KINGDOM (AD 1526–1571) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Romania as a result of the conquest of the Kingdom of Hungary by the Ottoman Empire. Converted to Principality of Transylvania
info_471: TRANSYLVANIA (AD 1571–1699) State, feudal, vassal of the Ottoman Empire (Principality of Transylvania). Originated in the territory of modern Romania as a result of transformation of Eastern Hungarian Kingdom. Joining to Habsburg Empire. The capitals were Alba Iulia (1571–1692), Cibinium (1692–1711)
info_472: KINGDOM OF CROATIA (AD 845–1102) State, feudal, monarchical (up to 925 — Principality of Croatia). Originated in the territory of modern Croatia as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. United with Hungary. The capital was Biograd na Moru
name_473: Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes
info_473: KINGDOM OF SERBS, CROATS AND SLOVENES (AD 1918–1929) State, capitalist, monarchical. Formed as a result of the collapse of Austria-Hungary and Ottoman Empire in the territory of modern Serbia, Croatia, Slovenia, Montenegro, Macedonia, Bosnia and Herzegovina. Renamed to Yugoslavia. The capital was Belgrade
label_473: Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes
info_474: YUGOSLAVIA (AD 1929–1941),(1945–2003) State, socialist (from 1945), republic (from 1945). (Formed in the territory of modern Serbia, Croatia, Slovenia, Montenegro, Macedonia, Bosnia and Herzegovina as a result of renaming Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes (up to 1941 — Kingdom of Yugoslavia). It ceased to exist as a result of the occupation by Germany and Italy and the proclamation in the territory of modern Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina of the Independent State of Croatia),(Re-Created as a result of liberation from German and Italian occupation (from 1945 — Democratic Federal Yugoslavia, from 1946 — Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia (FPRY), from 1963 — Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (SFRY), from 1992 — State Union of Yugoslavia. Renamed to Serbia and Montenegro). The capital was Belgrade
info_475: SLOVENIA (AD 1991–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Slovenia). Formed in the territory of modern Slovenia as a result of the withdrawal from Yugoslavia. The capital was Ljubljana
info_476: KNOSSOS (Minoan) (1900–1450 BC) City State. Originated during the Minoan civilization on the territory of the island of Crete (modern Greece). Destroyed by the Achaeans
info_477: PHAISTOS (Minoan) (1900–1750 BC) City State. Originated during the Minoan civilization on the territory of the island of Crete (modern Greece). Conquered by Knossos
info_478: MALIA (1900–1750 BC) City State. Originated during the Minoan civilization on the territory of the island of Crete (modern Greece). Conquered by Knossos. (Malia — the modern name of the City State, real name is unknown)
info_479: ZAKROS (1900–1750 BC) City State. Originated during the Minoan civilization on the territory of the island of Crete (modern Greece). Conquered by Knossos. (Zakros — the modern name of the City State, real name is unknown)
info_480: MYCENAE (1700–1200 BC) City State. Originated during the Mycenaean civilization in the territory of modern Greece. Destroyed by Destroyed by nomads called "Sea Peoples"
info_481: PYLOS (1700–1200 BC) City State. Originated during the Mycenaean civilization in the territory of modern Greece. Destroyed by nomads called "Sea Peoples"
info_482: TIRYNS (1700–1200 BC) City State. Originated during the Mycenaean civilization in the territory of modern Greece. Destroyed by nomads called "Sea Peoples"
info_483: ARGOS (1100–338 BC),(280–229 BC),(147–146 BC) City State. (Originated in the territory of modern Greece after the capture of the Peloponnese Peninsula by the Dorians. Conquered by Macedonia (ancient kingdom)),(Out of Macedonia (ancient kingdom). Became part of Achaean League), (Out of Achaean League. Became part of Roman Republic)
info_484: SPARTA (1050–331 BC),(280–195 BC),(147–146 BC) City State, slave-owning aristocratic republic (from 884 BC actually turned into a state). (Originated in the territory of modern Greece after the capture of the Peloponnese Peninsula by the Dorians. Conquered by Macedonia (ancient kingdom)),(Out of Macedonia (ancient kingdom). Became part of Achaean League),(Out of Achaean League. Became part of Roman Republic)
info_485: ATHENS (1050–338 BC),(280–146 BC) State, slave-owning, aristocratic republic (from 477 BC after the creation 1 st Athenian Sea Union actually turned into a state). (Originated in the territory of modern Greece after the capture of the Peloponnese Peninsula by the Dorians. Conquered by Macedonia (ancient kingdom)),(Out of Macedonia (ancient kingdom). Became part of Roman Republic)
info_486: KNOSSOS (Dorians) (900–67 BC) City State. Originated on the territory of the island of Crete (modern Greece) after the settlement of the island by the Dorians. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_487: PHAISTOS (Dorians) (900–67 BC) City State. Originated on the territory of the island of Crete (modern Greece) after the settlement of the island by the Dorians. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_488: GORTYN (900–67 BC) City State. Originated on the territory of the island of Crete (modern Greece) after the settlement of the island by the Dorians. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_489: KYDONIA (900–67 BC) City State. Originated on the territory of the island of Crete (modern Greece) after the settlement of the island by the Dorians. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_490: CORINTH (747–338 BC),(280–243 BC),(147–146 BC) City State. (Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Conquered by Macedonia (ancient kingdom)),(Out of Macedonia (ancient kingdom). Became part of Achaean League), (Out of Achaean League. Became part of Roman Republic)
info_491: CHALCIS (700–338 BC),(280–146 BC) City State. (Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Conquered by Macedonia (ancient kingdom)),(Out of Macedonia (ancient kingdom). Became part of Roman Republic)
info_492: ERETRIA (700–338 BC),(280–146 BC) City State. (Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Conquered by Macedonia (ancient kingdom)),(Out of Macedonia (ancient kingdom). Became part of Roman Republic)
info_493: MEGARA (650–338 BC),(307–243 BC) City State. (Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Conquered by Macedonia (ancient kingdom)),(Out of Macedonia (ancient kingdom). Became part of Achaean League)
info_494: KERKYRA (650–342 BC) City State, greek colony. Originated in the territory of the island of Corfu (modern Greece). Conquered by Macedonia (ancient kingdom)
info_495: BOEOTIAN LEAGUE (600–457 BC),(447–394 BC),(375–338 BC),(280–245 BC} ,{224–146 BC) Federation of ancient Greek cities (policies). (Formed as an association of 14 citiesin the territory of modern Greece (Thebes, Orchomenus, Thespiae and others). Conquered by Athens),(Separated from Athens. Separated into separate City States),(Reconstituted. Conquered by Macedonia (ancient kingdom)),(Out of Macedonia (ancient kingdom). Become a part of Aetolian League),(Out of Aetolian League. Dissolved, become a part of Roman Republic). Capital was Thebes
info_496: THEBES (394–375 BC) City State. Originated in the territory of modern Greece after the dissolution of the Boeotian League. Became part of Boeotian League
info_497: AETOLIAN LEAGUE (366–338 BC),(280–146 BC) Federation of ancient Greek cities (policies). (Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Conquered Macedonia (ancient kingdom)),(Out of Macedonia (ancient kingdom). Dissolved, become a part of Roman Republic)
capital_498: Passaron (330-295 BC), Ambracia (295-224 BC), Phoenice (224-167 BC)
info_498: EPIRUS (330–167 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Greece as a result of separation from Macedonia (ancient kingdom). Conquered by Roman Republic. The capital was Passaron (330-295 BC), Ambracia (295-224 BC), Phoenice (224-167 BC). The most distinguished ruler: Pyrrhus (king of Epirus in 306–301 and 297–272 BC and Macedonia (ancient kingdom) in 288–284 and 273–272 BC) — "Pyrrhic victory"
info_499: ACHAEAN LEAGUE (280–146 BC) Federation of ancient Greek cities (policies). Originated in the territory of modern Greece as a result of separation fromMacedonia (ancient kingdom). Dissolved, become a part of Roman Republic
info_500: EMIRATE OF CRETE (AD 826-961) State, the feudal theocratic Arab-Muslim. Originated on the territory of the island of Crete (modern Greece) as a result of the conquest of the island by the Arabs and separation from Byzantine Empire. Conquered by Normans, forming County of Sicily
info_501: KINGDOM OF THESSALONICA (AD 1204–1224) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Formed by the Crusaders as a result of the Four Crusade on a part of the territory of Byzantine Empire. The capital was Thessalonica. Conquered by Despotate of Epirus
info_502: DESPOTATE OF EPIRUS (AD 1204–1348),(1371–1479) (State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Greece as a result of the collapse of Byzantine Empire after Four Crusade. Conquered by Serbian Empire),(Out of Serbian Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Empire). The capital was Arta.
info_503: DUCHY OF ATHENS (AD 1205–1458) State, feudal, monarchical (vassal of Kingdom of Thessalonica, from 1224 — Principality of Achaea). Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Formed by the Crusaders as a result of the Four Crusade on a part of the territory of Byzantine Empire, Separated from Kingdom of Thessalonica. The capital was Athens. Conquered by Ottoman Empire
info_504: PRINCIPALITY OF ACHAEA (AD 1205–1432) State, feudal, monarchical (up to 1224 vassal of Kingdom of Thessalonica). Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Formed by the Crusaders as a result of the Four Crusade on a part of the territory of Byzantine Empire, Separated from Kingdom of Thessalonica. The capitals were Andravida (1205–1249), Mystras (1249–1262). Conquered by Byzantine Empire
info_505: SECOND BULGARIAN EMPIRE (AD 1185–1371) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Bulgaria as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. The capital was Tarnovo. It broke up into Tsardom of Vidin, Tarnovo kingdom and Despotate of Dobruja
info_506: DUCHY OF THE ARCHIPELAGO (AD 1207–1579) State, feudal, monarchical (vassal of Latin Empire). Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Formed by Republic of Venice as a result of the Four Crusade on a part of the territory of Latin Empire. The capital was Naxos. Conquered by Ottoman Empire
info_507: ORDER OF MALTA (AD 1308–1522),(1530–1798) State, feudal, theocratic (Sovereign Military Hospitaller Order of Saint John of Jerusalem, of Rhodes and of Malta). (As the state was formed on the island of Rhodes (territory of modern Greece) as a result of the conquest of the Knights of the Malta Order of the island of Rhodes (the Order was founded in 1048). Rhodes Island is conquered by the Ottoman Empire, the Knights of the Order of Malta are expelled from the island). (The state is restored on the island of Malta. Conquered by France, the Knights of the Order of Malta are expelled from the island. After the expulsion from Malta and the refusal of the Russian Emperor Alexander I to patronize the Order in its sovereign possession, only the territory of the embassy in Rome remained)
info_508: SERBIAN EMPIRE (AD 1346–1371) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Serbia as a result of merger of the Serbian principalities around the Kingdom of Raska. The capitals were Prizren, Skopje. Broken up into a number of states, including Moravian Serbia
info_509: DESPOTATE OF THE MOREA (AD 1453–1460) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Greece. Formed as a result of the fall of Byzantine Empire (as part of Byzantine Empire existed as a province since 1308). The capital was Mystras. Conquered by Ottoman Empire
info_510: SEPTINSULAR REPUBLIC (AD 1800–1807) The Greek state, protectorate Ottoman Empire (actually protectorate Russian Empire). Formed in the territory of modern Greece as a result of the liberation of the Ionian Islands by the Russian squadron. Has become a part of France, since 1809 — part of Illyrian Provinces (Fr.)).
info_511: UNITED KINGDOM (AD 1707–) State capitalist, monarchical (United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland). Formed in the territory of modern United Kingdom as a result of merger England with Scotland. The capital is London.
name_512: United States of the Ionian Islands (Brit.)
info_512: UNITED STATES OF THE IONIAN ISLANDS (Brit.) (AD 1815–1864) State greece, protectorate United Kingdom. Formed in the territory of modern Greece as a result of the liberation of the Ionian Islands from the French occupation. The capital was Corfu. Has become a part of Greece.
label_512: United States of the Ionian Islands (Brit.)
info_513: GREECE (AD 1830–1941),(1944–) State capitalist (Hellenic Republic, up to 1973 - Kingdom of Greece). (Formed in the territory of modern Greece as a result of separation from Ottoman Empire. Occupied by Germany, Italy, Bulgaria),(Exempt from occupation.) The capital is Athens
info_514: BULGARIA (AD 1908–) State, capitalist, republic (up to 1946 — monarchy) (Republic of Bulgaria; in 1946–1990 — People's Republic of Bulgaria). Originated in the territory of modern Bulgaria as a result of the exit from Ottoman Empire (from 1879 — principality with broad autonomy as part of Ottoman Empire). The capital is Sofia
info_515: WESTERN THRACE (AD 1947–1954) Territory under the control of the Entente countries, created in the territory of modern Greece. Formed as a result of the separation of part of the historical and geographical region of Western Thrace from Bulgaria by the decision of the Neuysk Treaty. Transferred to Greece
info_516: ITALIAN ISLANDS OF THE AEGEAN (AD 1912–1947) colony of Italy. Formed as a result of the occupation of Italy part of the islands owned by Ottoman Empire (now the territory of modern Greece). The capital was Rhodes. Become a part of Greece
info_517: ALASHIYA (1900–1300 BC) State, slave-owning. Originated during the Minoan civilization in the territory of modern Cyprus. Conquered by Hittite Empire
info_518: AMATHUS (669–570 BC) City State, Greek. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient). The legendary founder of the city is Kinir, the father of Adonis and the founder of the cult of Aphrodite on the island, who named the city in honor of his late mother Amathus (Amateus)
info_519: IDALIUM (669–570 BC) City State, Greek. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient)
info_520: KITION (669–570 BC) City State, Greco-Phoenician. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient)
info_521: CHYTRI (669–570 BC) City State, Greek. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient)
info_522: KOURION (669–570 BC) City State, Greek. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient)
info_523: LAPITHOS (669–570 BC) City State, Greco-Phoenician. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient)
info_524: LEDRA (669–570 BC) City State, Greek. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient)
info_525: MARION (669–570 BC) City State, Greek. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient)
info_526: PATHOS (669–570 BC) City State, Greek. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient). According to mythology, the city of Paphos is the birthplace of the Greek goddess of love Aphrodite
info_527: SALAMIS (669–570 BC) City State, Greek. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient).According to the Greek tradition, the city was founded after the Trojan War by the son of Telamon, archer Teucer
info_528: SOLI (669–570 BC) City State, Greek. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient)
info_529: TAMASSOS (669–570 BC) City State, Greek. Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence from Assyria. Conquered by Egypt (Ancient)
info_530: Empire of Cyprus (AD 1185–1191) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Cyprus. Formed as a result of the seizure of power on the island of Cyprus, part of the Byzantine Empire, Isaac Comnenos, who proclaimed himself emperor. The capital was Nicosia. Conquered by king of England Richard the Lionheart during the 3rd Crusade
info_531: KINGDOM OF CYPRUS (AD 1292–1489) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed by the crusaders in the territory of modern Cyprus, as a result of receiving as a gift of the island the king of the Jerusalem kingdom Guy de Lusig from king of England Richard the Lionheart
info_532: CYPRUS (Brit.) (AD 1878–1960) Possession of United Kingdom (Crown Colony from 1925). Formed as a result of Britain's rejection of the territory of modern Cyprus from Ottoman Empire. The capital was Nicosia. August 16, 1960 proclaimed independent Cyprus
info_533: CYPRUS (AD 1960–) State, capitalist (republic Cyprus). Formed in the territory of modern Cyprus as a result of the proclamation of independence in the British colony Cyprus (Brit.). The capital is Nicosia.
info_534: TURKISH REPUBLIC OF NORTHERN CYPRUS (AD 1974–) Self-proclaimed State (recognized only by Turkey), capitalist (up to 1983 — Turkish Federated State of Cyprus). Formed in part of the territory of modern Cyprus, occupied by Turkey. The capital was North Nicosia (Turkish sector of Nicosia).
info_535: MALETH (1000–480 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical phoenician colony. Founded by the Phoenicians on the island of Malta. Conquered by Carthage. Modern city Mdina
info_536: MILETHA (700–480 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical greek colony. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Malta. Conquered by Carthage
info_537: MALTA (Brit.) (AD 1800–1964) Possession of United Kingdom (Crown Colony from 1814). Formed in the territory of modern Malta as a result of the British reconquest of islands from France. The capital was Valletta. Independence from United Kingdom proclaimed
info_538: MALTA (AD 1964–) State, capitalist (Republic of Malta from 1974). Formed in the territory of modern Malta as a result of the proclamation of independence in the British colony Malta Malta (Brit.). The capital is Valletta
info_539: MESEMBRIA (510–71 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical, greek colony. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Bulgaria. Conquered by Roman Republic. Currently - the city of Nesebar
info_540: APOLLONIA PONTICA (610–71 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical, greek colony. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Bulgaria. Conquered by Roman Republic. Currently - the city of Sozopol
info_541: DACIAN KINGDOM (82 BC–AD 106) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Romania as a result of the unification of the Geto-Dacian tribes. Conquered by Roman Empire. The capital was Sarmizegetusa
info_542: TSARDOM OF VIDIN (AD 1371–1396) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Bulgaria as a result of the collapse of Second Bulgarian Empire. The capital was Vidin. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik
info_543: TSARDOM OF TARNOVO (AD 1371–1393) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Bulgaria as a result of the collapse of Second Bulgarian Empire. The capital was Tarnovo. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik
info_544: DESPOTATE OF DOBRUJA (AD 1371–1395) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Bulgaria as a result of the collapse of Second Bulgarian Empire. The capital was Kaliakra. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik
info_545: ROMANIA (AD 1862–) State, capitalist, republic (up to 1947 — monarchy, Kingdom (up to 1881 — Principality) Romania) (in 1946–1989 — Socialist Republic of Romania, up to 1965 — Romanian People's Republic of). Originated in the territory of modern Romania as a result of transformation of United Principalities of Moldavia and Wallachia in Kingdom of Romania. The capital is Bucharest
info_546: HISTRIA (657–71 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical, greek colony. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Romania. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_547: GOLDEN HORDE (AD 1240–1481) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Russia in the process of the collapse of the Mongol Empire into a number of independent states. The capital was Sarai Batu. Separated into separate khanates
info_548: PRINCIPALITY OF WALLACHIA (AD 1330–1415),(1856–1859) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Romania as a result of separation from Hungary. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Beylik),(Re-created as an independent principality. United with the Principality of Moldova in United Principalities of Moldavia and Wallachia). The capitals were Câmpulung, Curtea de Argeș, Bucharest.
info_549: PRINCIPALITY OF MOLDOVA (AD 1359–1456),(1856–1859) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Romania as a result of separation from Hungary. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire),(Re-created as an independent principality. United with the Principality of Wallachia in United Principalities of Moldavia and Wallachia). The capitals were Siret (1359–1385), Suceava (from 1385–1456), Iași (from 1856)
info_550: WALLACHIA (Ottoman) (AD 1415–1829) State, vassal Ottoman Empire (up to 1453 — Ottoman Beylik). Formed in the territory of modern Romania as a result of the entry of the Principality of Wallachia into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Beylik. The capitals were Curtea de Argeș, Targovishte (1430–1660), Bucharest (from 1660). Converted to Wallachia (Russian) — protectorate Russian Empire
info_551: MOLDOVA (Ottoman) (AD 1456–1829) State, vassal Ottoman Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Romania as a result of the entry of the Principality of Moldova into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire. The capitals were Suceava (from 1456–1572), Iași (from 1572). Converted to Moldova (Russian) — protectorate Russian Empire
info_552: WALLACHIA (Russian) (AD 1829–1856) State, protectorate Russian Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Romania as a result of the entry of the Wallachia (Ottoman) from Ottoman dependence and establishment of a protectorate Russian Empire. The capital was Bucharest. Resumed as an independent Principality of Wallachia
info_553: MOLDOVA (Russian) (AD 1829–1856) State, protectorate Russian Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Romania as a result of the entry of the Moldova (Ottoman) from Ottoman dependence and establishment of a protectorate Russian Empire. The capital was Iași. Resumed as an independent Principality of Moldova
info_554: WALLACHIA AND MOLDOVA (AD 1859–1862) State, capitalist, monarchy (United Principalities of Moldavia and Wallachia, up to 1878 — vassal of the Ottoman Empire). Originated in the territory of modern Romania as a result of merger Principalities Wallachia and Moldova. Converted to Principality of Romania. The capital was Iași
info_555: RAŠKA (AD 825–917),(1170–1346) State, feudal, monarchical (up to 1217 — principality, from 1217 — kingdom). (Originated in the territory of modern Serbia as a result of separation from First Bulgarian Empire. Has become a part of First Bulgarian Empire),(Separated from Byzantine Empire. Has become a part of Serbian Empire). The capital was Ras
info_556: LORDSHIP OF PRILEP (AD 1371–1395) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Macedonia as a result of the collapse of Serbian Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik. The capital was Prilep
info_557: PRINCIPALITY OF VELBUŽD (AD 1371–1395) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Macedonia as a result of the collapse of Serbian Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik. The capital was Velbužd (currently — Kyustendil)
info_558: DISTRICT OF BRANKOVIĆ (AD 1371–1402) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Serbia as a result of the collapse of Serbian Empire. Has become a part of Serbian Despotate. The capital was Vučitrn
info_559: MORAVIAN SERBIA (AD 1371–1402) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Serbia as a result of the collapse of Serbian Empire. Has become a part of Serbian Despotate. The capital was Kruševac
info_560: KINGDOM OF SERBIA (AD 1878–1918) State, capitalist, monarchical (up to 1882 — principality; as part of Ottoman Empire existed since 1817). Formed as a result of separation from Ottoman Empire in the territory of modern Serbia. Has become a part of Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes. The capital was Belgrade
info_561: MACEDONIA (AD 1991–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Macedonia). Formed in the territory of modern Macedonia as a result of the withdrawal from Yugoslavia. Renamed North Macedonia (Republic of North Macedonia) in 2019. The capital is Skopje
info_562: ZACHLUMIA (AD 850–917) State, feudal, monarchical (principality). Originated in the territory of modern Bosnia and Herzegovina as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. Has become a part of First Bulgarian Empire
info_563: PAGANIA (AD 850–917) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Bosnia and Herzegovina as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. Has become a part of Kingdom of Croatia
info_564: TRAVUNIJA (AD 850–917) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Montenegro as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. Has become a part of First Bulgarian Empire. The capital was Trebinje
info_565: REPUBLIC OF RAGUSA (AD 1358–1808) State, feudal, republic. Originated in the territory of modern Croatia as a result of separation from Republic of Venice. Conquered by France. The capital was Ragusa (Dubrovnik)
info_566: BOSNIA (AD 1377–1463) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Bosnia and Herzegovina as a result of separation from Hungary. Conquered by Ottoman Empire. The capital was Visoko
info_567: INDEPENDENT STATE OF CROATIA (AD 1941–1945) State, republic, satellite of Nazi Germany. Formed in the territory of modern Croatia with the support of the countries of the Nazi bloc and their allies after the occupation of the rest of Yugoslavia. Has become a part of Yugoslavia. The capital was Zagreb
info_568: CROATIA (AD 1991–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Croatia). Formed in the territory of modern Croatia as a result of the withdrawal from Yugoslavia. The capital was Zagreb
info_569: EPIDAMNOS (627–167 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical, greek colony. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Albania. Conquered by Roman Republic (renamed to Dyrrachium). Currently - the city Durrës. In Dyrrachium long lived in exile Cicero
info_570: APOLLONIA (ILLYRIA) (588–148 BC) City State, slave-owning,oligarchic republic, greek colony. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Albania. Conquered by Roman Republic
info_571: DUKLJA (AD 850–917),(1018–1170) State, feudal, monarchical (principality, from 1053 — kingdom). (Originated in the territory of modern Montenegro as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. Has become a part of First Bulgarian Empire),(Out of First Bulgarian Empire. Conquered by Grand Principality of Serbia). The capital was Bar
info_572: ALBANIA (it.) (AD 1939–1943) colony (protectorate) Italy. Formed in the territory of modern Albania as a result of the occupation of Albania by Italy. Occupied by Germany. The capital was Tirana
