info_573: PRINCIPALITY OF ARBANON (AD 1190–1254) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Albania as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. Has become a part of Despotate of Epirus. The capital was Kruja
info_574: LORDSHIP OF BERAT (AD 1371–1444) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Albania as a result of the collapse of Serbian Empire. Has become a part of League of Lezhë. The capital was Berat
info_575: PRINCIPALITY OF VALONA (AD 1367–1417) State, feudal, monarchical (Principality of Valona and Kanina). Originated in the territory of modern Albania as a result of separation from Serbian Empire. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik. The capital was Vlorë
info_576: PRINCIPALITY OF ALBANIA (AD 1368–1444) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Albania as a result of separation from Kingdom of Naples. Has become a part of League of Lezhë. The capital was Durrës
info_577: PRINCIPALITY OF ZETA (AD 1356–1402) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Montenegro as a result of separation from Serbian Empire. Has become a part of Serbian Despotate. The capital was Podgorica
info_578: PRINCIPALITY OF GJIROKASTËR (AD 1367–1417) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Albania as a result of separation from Epirus despot. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik. The capital was Gjirokastër
info_579: PRINCIPALITY OF KASTRIOTI (AD 1389–1444) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Albania as a result of separation from Principality of Zeta. Has become a part of League of Lezhë. The capital was Kruja
info_580: PRINCIPALITY OF DUKAGJINI (AD 1389–1444) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Albania as a result of separation from Principality of Zeta. Has become a part of League of Lezhë. The capital was Lezhë
info_581: SERBIAN DESPOTATE (AD 1402–1459) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Serbia as a result of merger Moravian Serbia, District of Branković and Principality of Zeta. Conquered by Ottoman Beylik. The capitals were Smederevo , Belgrade
info_582: PRINCIPALITY OF ARIANITI(AD 1432–1444) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Albania as a result of separation from Lordship of Berat. Has become a part of League of Lezhë. The capital was Berat
info_583: LEAGUE OF LEZHË (AD 1444–1479) Confederation of Albanian principalities. Originated in the territory of modern Albania as a result of merger Principality of Arianiti, Principality of Dukagjini, Principality of Kastrioti, Principality of Albania, Lordship of Berat. Conquered Ottoman Empire. The capital was Lezhë
info_584: ALBANIA (AD 1912–1914),(1920–1939),(1944–) State capitalist republic Albania; in 1912–1914 — State Albania, in 1928–1939 — Kingdom of Albania, in 1946–1976 — People's Republic of Albania, in 1976–1991 — People's Socialist Republic of Albania). (Formed in the territory of modern Albania as a result of separation from Ottoman Empire. Occupied by Italy, Austria-Hungary and France),(Independence is proclaimed again. Occupied by Italy and converted to Albania (it.), from 1943 Occupied by Germany),(Exempt from occupation) The capital is Tirana
info_585: HERZEGOVINA (AD 1448–1482) State, feudal, monarchical (Duchy of Herzegovina). Originated in the territory of modern Bosnia and Herzegovina as a result of separation from Bosnia. Conquered by Ottoman Empire. The capital was Mostar
info_586: KINGDOM OF MONTENEGRO (AD 1852–1918) State, capitalist, monarchical (up to 1910 — principality). Formed as a result of separation from Ottoman Empire in the territory of modern Montenegro. Has become a part of Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes. The capital was Cetinje
info_587: BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA (AD 1991–) State, capitalist, republic. Formed in the territory of modern Bosnia and Herzegovina as a result of the withdrawal from Yugoslavia. The capital was Sarajevo
info_588: SERBIA AND MONTENEGRO (AD 2003–2006) State, capitalist, republic. Formed in the territory of modern Serbia and Montenegro as a result of renaming Yugoslavia. Broken into Serbia and Montenegro. The capital was Belgrade
info_589: SERBIA (AD 2006–) State, capitalist, republic. Formed in the territory of modern Serbia as a result of the collapse of Serbia and Montenegro. The capital is Belgrade
info_590: MONTENEGRO (AD 2006–) State, capitalist, republic. Formed in the territory of modern Montenegro as a result of the collapse of Serbia and Montenegro. The capital is Podgorica
info_591: KOSOVO (AD 2008–) Partially recognized State, capitalist (Republic of Kosovo). Formed in the territory of modern Serbia as a result of separation from Serbia. The capital was Pristina.
info_592: DYFED (AD 410–920) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Dyfed). Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom as a result of the separation of the territory of Southwestern Wales, populated by Celts, from Western Roman Empire. Capital not specified. United with Seisyllwg in Deheubarth.
info_593: DUMNONIA (AD 410–710) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom as a result of the separation of the territory of the peninsula Cornwall, populated by Celts, from Western Roman Empire. The capital was Isca Dumnoniorum (actually Exeter). Conquered by Wessex.
info_594: POWYS (AD 410–854) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Powys). Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom as a result of the separation of the territory of the eastern part of Wales, populated by Cornovii, from Western Roman Empire. The capitals were Pengwern, Mathrafal. Has become a part of Gwynedd.
info_595: CEREDIGION (AD 424–680) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Ceredigion). Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Wales) as a result of the division of Cunedda's possessions between his sons. Capital not specified. Renamed to Seisyllwg.
info_596: GWYNEDD (AD 440–1216) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Gwynedd). Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom (Wales) the leader of the Celtic tribe of the Votadini Cunedda. The capitals were Deganwy, Aberffraw, Garth Celyn. Converted to Principality of Wales
info_597: STRATHCLYDE (AD 410–889) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Strathclyde). Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in the south of Scotland) the leader of the Britons tribe Ceretic Guletic. The capital was Dumbarton. Has become a part of Scotland.
info_598: RHEGED (AD 450–638) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated by Britons in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Scotland). The capital was Carlisle. Conquered by Northumbria.
info_599: KENT (AD 450–871) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Kent). Originated by Jutes in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in southeast England). Capital not specified. Joining to Wessex.
info_600: ELMET (AD 460–616) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Scotland) as a result of separation from Rheged. Capital not specified. Joining to Northumbria.
info_601: GODODDIN (AD 470–638) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated by Britons in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in the south of Scotland). The capitals were Traprain Law, Din Eidyn (actually Edinburgh). Conquered by Northumbria.
info_602: SUSSEX (AD 477–825) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Sussex). Originated by Saxons in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in southeast England). The capital was Selsey. Joining to Wessex.
info_603: BRYCHEINIOG (AD 450–1091) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Brycheiniog). Originated by Irish settlers in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Wales). The capital was Talgarth. Conquered by England
info_604: GWENT (AD 500–942) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Gwent). Originated by Celts in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Wales). The capitals were Caerwent, Porth-is-Coed. United with Glywysing in Morgannwg.
info_605: WESSEX (AD 519–927) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Wessex). Originated by Saxons in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in England). The capital was Winchester. After the final unification by King Wessex of Athelstan, seven kingdoms: Wessex, Sussex, Essex, Kent, Northumbria, Kingdom of East Anglia and Mercia converted to England
info_606: MERCIA (AD 527–918) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Mercia). Originated by Anglo-Saxons in the territory of modern United Kingdom (England). The capitals was Tamworth. Joining to Wessex.
info_607: ESSEX (AD 527–825) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Essex). Originated by Anglo-Saxons in the territory of modern United Kingdom (England). The capital was London. Joining to Wessex.
info_608: BERNICIA (AD 547–616) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Bernicia). Originated by Angles in the territory of modern United Kingdom (Southeastern Scotland and Northeast England). Capital not specified. United with Deira in Northumbria.
info_609: KINGDOM OF EAST ANGLIA (AD 550–870) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated by Angles in the territory of modern United Kingdom (England). Capital not specified. Conquered by Danish Vikings, forming Danelaw
info_610: DEIRA (AD 559–616) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Deira). Originated by Angles in the territory of modern United Kingdom (Northeast England). Capital not specified. United with Bernicia in Northumbria.
info_611: GLYWYSING (AD 450–942) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Glywysing). Originated by Celts in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Wales). Capital not specified. United with Gwent in Morgannwg.
info_612: DÁL RIATA (AD 580–843) State, feudal, monarchical. Founded by the Irish in the territory of the modern United Kingdom (the west coast of Scotland and the north of Ireland). Capital not specified. United with Kingdom of Picts in Scotland.
info_613: KINGDOM OF PICTS (AD 580–843) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated by Picts in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Scotland). Capital not specified. United with Dál Riata in Scotland.
info_614: NORTHUMBRIA (AD 616–878) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom (Southeastern Scotland and Northeast England) as a result of merger Bernicia and Deira. The capitals were Bamburgh, York. Joining to England.
info_615: ERGYNG (AD 616–755) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Wales) as a result of separation from Gwent. The capital was Ariconium. Has become a part of Gwent.
info_616: SEISYLLWG (AD 680–920) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Wales) as a result of renaming Ceredigion. Capital not specified. United with Dyfed in Deheubarth.
info_617: SCOTLAND (AD 843–1296),(1328–1707) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Scotland). (Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom as a result of merger Kingdom of Picts and Dál Riata. Joining to England),(Separated from England. United with England, forming United Kingdom). The capitals were Scone (up to 1492), Edinburgh (from 1492)
info_618: DANELAW (AD 870–954) Territory, which is distinguished by special legal and social systems (Danish law), formed as a result of the conquest of the Danish Vikings in the territory of the modern United Kingdom (in the northeastern part of England). Attached to England
info_619: NORWAY (AD 872–1028),(1035–1319),(1363–1397),(1905–1940),(1945–) State monarchical (Kingdom of Norway). (Originated in the territory of modern Norway as a result of merger separate Norwegian regions into a single state. Conquered by Denmark),(Re-created. United with Sweden),(Separated from Sweden. United with Denmark),(Re-created. Occupied by Germany),(Resumed as a result of the victory of the anti-Hitler coalition over Germany). The capital is Oslo
info_620: DEHEUBARTH (AD 920–1197) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Wales) as a result of merger Dyfed and Seisyllwga. Capital not specified. Has become a part of Gwynedd
info_621: MORGANNWG (AD 942–1091) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Wales) as a result of merger Gwent and Glywysing. Capital not specified. Conquered by England
info_622: CORNWALL (AD 1014–1066) State, feudal, monarchical (Kingdom of Cornwall ). Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom as a result of separation from England after her conquest of Denmark. Capital not specified. Joining to England.
info_623: KINGDOM OF THE ISLES (AD 1079–1266) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom as a result of separation from Scotland Isle of Man, Hebrides, Shetland and Orkney Islands. Capital not specified. Joining to Scotland
capital_624: moved from the Volga region to Pannonia and back
info_624: HUNNIC EMPIRE (AD 350–469) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of the invasion of Eastern Europe by Asian tribes of Huns. The capital moved from the Volga region to Pannonia and back. Disintegrated under the onslaught of Germanic tribes
info_625: WALES (AD 1216–1542) State, feudal, monarchical (Principality of Wales). Originated in the territory of modern United Kingdom (in Wales) as a result of transformation of Kingdom of Gwynedd. The capitals were Abergwyngregyn. Union with England
info_626: KINGDOM OF IRELAND (AD 1541–1801) State, feudal, monarchical (the head of state was the King of England). Originated in the territory of modern Ireland was a result of the proclamation of the English lordship of Ireland by the kingdom. The capital was Dublin. Union with United Kingdom
info_627: IRELAND (AD 1919–) State, capitalist (Irish Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Ireland as a result of separation from United Kingdom. The capital is Dublin.
info_628: Iceland (AD 930–1262),(1918–) State, capitalist (Icelandic Republic, in 1918-1944 — Kingdom of Iceland). (Originated in the territory of modern Iceland by settlers from Norway. Joining to Norway),(Separated from Denmark as Kingdom of Iceland in personal union with Denmark, from 1944 — Icelandic Republic). The capital is Reykjavik
info_629: NOVGOROD REPUBLIC (AD 1136–1259) State, feudal, republic. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Kievan Rus'. It fell under the Tatar-Mongol yoke. The capital was Novgorod
info_630: DUCHY OF MOSCOW (AD 1480–1547) State, feudal, monarchical (Grand Duchy of Moscow). Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of getting rid of the Tatar-Mongol yoke. Converted to Tsardom of Russia as a result of the coronation of the Grand Duke of Moscow Ivan IV the Terrible by the Tsar. The capital was Moscow
info_631: TSARDOM OF RUSSIA (AD 1547–1721) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of transformation as a result of the coronation of the Grand Duke of Moscow Ivan IV the Terrible by the Tsar. Converted into a Russian empire by Peter I. The capital was Moscow
info_632: FINLAND (AD 1917–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Finland). Originated in the territory of modern Finland as a result of separation from Soviet Russia (independence proclaimed on December 6, 1917). The capital was Helsinki
info_633: PRINCIPALITY OF KOKNESE (AD 1180–1207) State, feudal, monarchical, apanage principality (vassal of the Principality of Polotsk). Originated by the Slavs in the territory of modern Latvia. The capital was Koknese. Conquered by Livonian Brothers of the Sword
info_634: BISHOPRIC OF LIVONIA (AD 1186–1201) State, feudal, theocratic, submitted to the Pope. Originated by the Crusaders in the territory of modern Latvia. The capital was Ikšķile. Renamed to Bishopric of Riga
info_635: ARCHBISHOPRIC OF RIGA (AD 1201–1561) State, feudal, theocratic, submitted to the Pope (up to 1255 — Bishopric of Riga, from 1207 — part of Principality Terra Mariana, from 1435 part of Livonian Confederation (part of Holy Roman Empire)). Originated in the territory of modern Latvia as a result of renaming Bishopric of Livonia. The capital was Riga. Conquered by Grand Duchy of Lithuania
info_636: PRINCIPALITY OF JERSIKA (AD 1190–1209) State, feudal, monarchical, apanage principality (vassal of the Principality of Polotsk, from 1209 — Archbishopric of Riga). Originated in the territory of modern Latvia as a result of separation from the Principality of Polotsk. The capital was Jersika. Conquered by Livonian Brothers of the Sword
info_637: LIVONIAN BROTHERS OF THE SWORD (AD 1207–1237) State, feudal, theocratic. Originated in the territory of modern Latvia as a result of conquest of a part of the Latvian lands during the Northern kosovye campaigns by the Knights of the Order of the swordsmen (established in 1202). Was part of Principality Terra Mariana (part of Holy Roman Empire). Has become a part of Teutonic Order (under the name Livonian Order). The capital was Riga.
info_638: DUCHY OF ESTONIA (Denmark) (AD 1219–1227),(1238–1346) State, monarchical. Possession of Denmark. (Originated in the territory of modern Estonia as a result of the colonization of Northern Estonia by the Danes. Conquered by Livonian Brothers of the Sword),(Re-created. Has become a part of Teutonic Order). The capital was Reval.
info_639: BISHOPRIC OF DORPAT (AD 1224–1558) State, feudal, theocratic (as part of Principality Terra Mariana, from 1435 part of Livonian Confederation (part of Holy Roman Empire)). Originated in the territory of modern Estonia as a result of conquests by Order of the swordsmen. The capital was Dorpat (actually Tartu). Conquered by Tsardom of Russia
info_640: BISHOPRIC OF ÖSEL–WIEK (AD 1228–1560) State, feudal, theocratic (as part of Principality Terra Mariana, from 1435as part of Livonian Confederation ( part of Holy Roman Empire)). Originated in the territory of modern Estonia as a result of separation from Order of the swordsmen. The capitals were Leal (up to 1251), Perona (1251–1265), Hapsal (1265–1381), Arensburg (actually Kuressaar). Transferred to Possession of Denmark
info_641: BISHOPRIC OF COURLAND (AD 1234–1562) State, feudal, theocratic (as part of Principality Terra Mariana, in 1435–1561 part of Livonian Confederation (part of Holy Roman Empire)). Originated in the territory of modern Estonia as a result of separation from Order of the swordsmen. The capital was Pilten. Transferred to Possession of Denmark
info_642: LIVONIAN ORDER (AD 1435–1561) State, feudal, theocratic. Originated in the territory of modern Latvia as a result of separation from Teutonic Order. Was part of Livonian Confederation (established in 1435). Conquered by Grand Duchy of Lithuania. The capital was Walk.
info_643: ESTONIA UNDER SWEDISH RULE (AD 1561–1721) State, monarchical (Duchy of Estonia). Possession of Sweden. Originated in the territory of modern Estonia as a result of the conquest of part of the Livonian Order by the Swedes. Conquered by Russian Empire. The capital was Reval.
info_644: SWEDISH LIVONIA (AD 1629–1721) State, monarchical. Possession of Sweden. Originated in the territory of modern Latvia as a result of the conquest of part of the territory of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth by the Swedes. Conquered by Russian Empire. The capital was Riga.
info_645: LATVIAN SSR (AD 1918–1920) State, socialist. (Latvian Socialist Soviet Republic). Formed as a result of the liberation of the territory modern Latvia from the German occupation and the recognition of independence by Soviet Russia. The capital was Riga. It ceased to exist as a result of the liberation of the territory from the Red Army by Republic of Latvia (independence proclaimed on November 18, 1918)
name_646: Commune of the Working People of Estonia
info_646: COMMUNE OF THE WORKING PEOPLE OF ESTONIA (AD 1918–1919) State, socialist. Formed as a result of the liberation of the territory modern Estonia from the German occupation and the recognition of independence by Soviet Russia. The capital was Narva. It ceased to exist as a result of the liberation of the territory from the Red Army by the Republic of Estonia
label_646: Commune of the Working People of Estonia
info_647: LITHUANIAN SSR (AD 1918–1919, February) State, socialist. (Lithuanian Soviet Socialist Republic). Formed as a result of the liberation of most of the territory modern Lithuania from the German occupation and the recognition of independence by Soviet Russia. The capital was Vilnius. United with the SSR of Byelorussia in the Lithuanian–Byelorussian SSR
info_648: ESTONIA (AD 1919–1940),(1991–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Estonia). (Originated in the territory of modern Estonia as a result of separation from Soviet Russia and the termination of the existence of Commune of the Working People of Estonia),(Has become a part of USSR. Out of USSR). The capital was Tallinn
info_649: LITHUANIAN–BYELORUSSIAN SSR (AD 1919, February – 1919, August) State, socialist. (Lithuanian–Byelorussian Soviet Socialist Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Lithuania and Belarus as a result of merger Lithuanian SSR and SSR of Byelorussia. The capitals were Vilnius (up to April), Minsk (from April). Shared between Lithuania, Poland and SSR of Byelorussia
info_650: KLAIPĖDA REGION (AD 1919–1923) Territory under the control of the League of Nations. Created in accordance with the Versailles Peace Treaty in the territory of modern Lithuania after the defeat of Germany in World War I. Attached to Lithuania. The capital was Klaipėda
info_651: LITHUANIA (AD 1919–1940),(1991–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Lithuania). (Originated in the territory of modern Lithuania as a result of separation from Soviet Russia (independence proclaimed on February 16, 1918) and the termination of the existence of the Lithuanian–Byelorussian SSR),(Has become a part of USSR. Out of USSR). The capitals are Kaunas (up to 1940), Vilnius (from 1991)
info_652: LATVIA (AD 1920–1940),(1991–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Latvia). (Originated in the territory of modern Latvia as a result of separation from Soviet Russia (independence proclaimed on November 18, 1918) and the termination of the existence of the Latvian SSR),(Has become a part of USSR. Out of USSR). The capital is Riga
info_653: PRINCIPALITY OF CHERNIGOV (AD 1097–1240) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Kievan Rus' (as part of Kievan Rus' existed since 1024). It fell under the Tatar-Mongol yoke. The capital was Chernigov
info_654: PRINCIPALITY OF VITEBSK (AD 1101–1320) State, feudal, slavic, apanage principality. Originated in the territory of modern Belarus as a result of separation from Principality of Polotsk. Has become a part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania (part of which existed before 1508). The capital was Vitebsk
info_655: PRINCIPALITY OF GORODEN' (AD 1101–1241) State, feudal, slavic, apanage principality. Originated in the territory of modern Belarus as a result of separation from Principality of Polotsk. Has become a part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania. The capital was Grodno
info_656: PRINCIPALITY OF MINSK (AD 1101–1326) State, feudal, slavic, apanage principality. Originated in the territory of modern Belarus as a result of separation from Principality of Polotsk. Has become a part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania. The capital was Minsk
info_657: PRINCIPALITY OF SMOLENSK (AD 1127–1240) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Kievan Rus' (as part of Kievan Rus' existed since 1010). It fell under the Tatar-Mongol yoke. The capital was Smolensk
info_658: PRINCIPALITY OF TUROV AND PINSK (AD 1162–1240) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Kievan Rus' (as part of Kievan Rus' existed since 980). It fell under the Tatar-Mongol yoke. The capital was Turov
info_659: PRINCIPALITY OF KIEV (yoke) (AD 1240–1362) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of the final disintegration of Kievan Rus' (as part of Kievan Rus' existed since 1132) and the fall of Principality of Kiev under the Tatar-Mongolian yoke. Has become a part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania (as part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania existed for 1471). The capital was Kiev
info_660: SSR OF BYELORUSSIA(AD 1919, January –1919, February),(1919, August – 1922) State, socialist. (Soviet Socialist Republic of Belarus). (Formed in the territory of modern Belarus as a result of liberation from German occupation and recognition of independence by Soviet Russia. United with Lithuanian SSR in the Lithuanian–Byelorussian SSR}.{Reconstituted. Become a part of USSR). The capital was Minsk.
info_661: BELARUS (AD 1991–) State, republic (Republic of Belarus). Originated in the territory of modern Belarus as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital is Minsk
info_662: CRIMEAN KHANATE (AD 1441–1478),(1774–1783) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine in the process of the collapse of Golden Horde into a number of independent states. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire),(Re-created as an independent Khanate. Joining to Russian Empire) The capital was Bakhchisaray.
info_663: UKRAINIAN PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC (AD 1918, January – 1918, March),(1918, November – 1920) State. (Formed in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Soviet Russia (as part of Russian Republic formed in June 1917). Occupied by Germany),(Exempt from occupation. Has become a part of Ukrainian SSR). The capital was Kiev.
info_664: UKRAINIAN SSR(AD 1919, March – 1922) State, socialist. (Ukrainian Socialist Soviet Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Soviet Russia. The capital was Kharkiv. Become a part of USSR
info_665: MOLDOVA (AD 1991–) State, republic (Republic of Moldova). Originated in the territory of modern Moldova as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital is Chișinău
info_666: PRIDNESTROVIE (AD 1991–) Self-proclaimed unrecognized state, republic (Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic). Formed on the territory of modern Moldova. The capital is — Tiraspol
info_667: TYRAS (600–108 BC),(63 BC – AD 275) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks, people from Miletus in the territory of modern Ukraine. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus), (Returned independence. Destroyed by the Goths). Was in the territory of modern Bilhorod-Dnistrovskyi
info_668: OLBIA (647–108 BC),(63 BC – AD 370) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. (Founded by ancient Greeks, people from Miletus in the territory of modern Ukraine. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus), (Returned independence. Destroyed by Huns)
info_669: CHERSONESUS (529–108 BC),(63 BC – AD 370) City State, slave-owning, monarchical (from the beginning of our era — oligarchic republic). (Formed by the ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Ukraine. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus} , {Returned independence. Destroyed by Huns). Was in the territory of modern Sevastopol
info_670: FEODOSIA (550–355 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks, people from Miletus in the territory of modern Ukraine. Became part of Bosporan Kingdom
info_671: PANTICAPAEUM (600–480 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks, people from Miletus in the territory of modern Ukraine. Became part of Bosporan Kingdom, becoming its capital. Was in the territory of modern Kerch
info_672: SCYTHIAN KINGDOM (585–108 BC),(63 BC – AD 250) State, slave-owning, monarchical. (Formed by Scythian tribes in the territory of modern Ukraine. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus), (Returned independence. Destroyed by Goths). The capital was Scythian Neapolis (from 130 BC)
info_673: BOSPORAN KINGDOM (480–108 BC),(63 BC – AD 370) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of merger of Greek city-states on the Kerch and Taman peninsulas. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus), (Returned independence. Destroyed by Huns). The capital was Panticapaeum
info_674: OLD GREAT BULGARIA (AD 632–671) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as of result of merger of Bulgarian tribes. It ceased to exist as a result of the onslaught of the Khazars (the Bulgarian hordes migrated beyond the Danube). The capital was Phanagoria
info_675: KHAZAR KHAGANATE (AD 650– 969) State, slave-owning, monarchical, ruling religion - Judaism. Originated in the territory of modern Russia by the Khazar tribes, separated from the Western Turkic Khaganate. Has ceased to exist independently as a result of defeat in the war with Kievan Rus'. The capitals were Samandar, Atil
info_676: THEODORO (AD 1204–1240),(1441–1475) State, feudal, christian, monarchical (Principality of Theodoro). (Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. Conquered by Golden Horde),(Recreated as a result of decay Golden Horde. Conquered by Ottoman Empire). The capital was Mangup (Theodoro)
info_677: PRINCIPALITY OF PEREYASLAVL (AD 1054–1240) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Kievan Rus'. Conquered by Golden Horde. The capital was Pereyaslavl
info_678: PRINCIPALITY OF NOVGOROD-SEVERSK(AD 1097–1240) State, feudal, slavic. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Kievan Rus'. It fell under the Tatar-Mongol yoke. The capital was Novgorod-Seversk
info_679: CAFFA (Genoese) (AD 1266–1475) City State, colony Republic of Genoa. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Golden Horde. Conquered by Ottoman Empire. Modern city Feodosia
info_680: VOSPORO (Genoese) (AD 1318–1475) City State, colony Republic of Genoa. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Golden Horde. Conquered by Ottoman Empire. Modern city Kerch
info_681: CEMBALO (Genoese) (AD 1357–1475) City State, colony Republic of Genoa. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Golden Horde. Conquered by Ottoman Empire. The modern district of Sevastopol Balaklava
info_682: SOLDAIA (Genoese) (AD 1365–1475) City State, colony Republic of Genoa. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of separation from Golden Horde. Conquered by Ottoman Empire. Modern city Sudak
info_683: CRIMEAN KHANATE (Ottoman) (AD 1478–1774) State, vassal Ottoman Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of hitting the Crimean Khanate in vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire. The capital was Bakhchisaray. Re-created as an independent Khanate
info_684: PRINCIPALITY OF GALICIA–VOLHYNIA (yoke) (AD 1240–1392) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Formed in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of falling Galicia-Volyn principality under the Tatar-Mongolian yoke. The capitals were Halych (1240–1245), Lviv (1272–1349), Lutsk (1349–1387), Volodymyr-Volynsky (1387–1392). Separated between Poland and Grand Duchy of Lithuania.
info_685: PRINCIPALITY OF CHERNIGOV (yoke) (AD 1240–1356) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Formed in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of the Chernigov princedom falling under the Tatar-Mongolian yoke. Has become a part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania (as part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania Principality of Chernigov existed up to 1401). The capital was Chernigov
info_686: PRINCIPALITY OF SMOLENSK (yoke) (AD 1240–1404) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Formed in the territory of modern Russia as a result of the Smolensk princedom falling under the Tatar-Mongolian yoke. Has become a part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania. The capital was Smolensk
info_687: PRINCIPALITY OF TUROV AND PINSK (yoke) (AD 1240–1330) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Formed in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of falling of Principality of Turov and Pinsk under the Tatar-Mongolian yoke. Has become a part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania. The capital was Turov
info_688: PRINCIPALITY OF NOVGOROD-SEVERSK (yoke) (AD 1240–1362) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Formed in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of falling Principality of Novgorod-Seversk under the Tatar-Mongolian yoke. Has become a part of Grand Duchy of Lithuania. The capital was Novgorod-Seversk
info_689: COSSACK HETMANATE (AD 1649–1654) State, feudal, ukrainian; republic with elements of the monarchy (the official name is Zaporizhian Host)). Occurred in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of the uprising led by Bogdan Khmelnitsky and separation from the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth. Joining to Russian kingdom (as part of Russian Empire Cossack Hetmanate existed until 1764). The capitals were Chyhyryn, Baturyn, Hlukhiv
info_690: WEST UKRAINIAN PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC (AD 1918, November – 1919, January) State, Self-proclaimed. Formed in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of the collapse of Austria-Hungary. Has become a part of Ukrainian People's Republic. The capitals were Lviv, Ternopil, Stanislaviv.
info_691: UKRAINE (AD 1991–) State, republic. Originated in the territory of modern Ukraine as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital is Kiev
info_692: HERMONASSA (500–480 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks, natives of the island of Lesbos in the territory of modern Russia. Became part of Bosporan Kingdom
info_693: PHANAGORIA (543–480 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks, natives of Teos in the territory of modern Russia. Became part of Bosporan Kingdom
info_694: TURKIC KHAGANATE (AD 552–603) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kyrgyzstan Tribes of the Turks as a result of the conquest of power in the Rouran Khaganate. Broken into Western Turkic Khaganate and Eastern Turkic Khaganate. The capital was Ötüken
info_695: WESTERN TURKIC KHAGANATE (AD 603–704) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kyrgyzstan as a result of the collapse of Turkic Khaganate. After the seizure of power by the tribes of the Türgesh, it ceased to exist and was transformed into the Türgesh Khaganate. The capital was Suyab
info_696: ASTRAKHAN KHANATE (AD 1460–1556) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Russia in the process of the collapse of Golden Horde into a number of independent states. Joining to Tsardom of Russia. The capital was Xacitarxan.
info_697: NOVGOROD REPUBLIC (yoke) (AD 1259–1478) State, feudal, republic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Formed in the territory of modern Russia as a result of falling Novgorod Republic under the Tatar-Mongolian yoke. Affiliated to Principality of Moscow (yoke). The capital was Novgorod
info_698: PRINCIPALITY OF VLADIMIR (AD 1157–1240) State, feudal, slavic (Principality of Vladimir-Suzdal, Grand Duchy of Vladimir). Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Kievan Rus'. It fell under the Tatar-Mongol yoke. The capital was Vladimir
info_699: PRINCIPALITY OF VLADIMIR (yoke) (AD 1240–1364) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Formed in the territory of modern Russia as a result of falling Principality of Vladimir under the Tatar-Mongolian yoke. Joining to Principality of Moscow (yoke). The capital was Vladimir
info_700: PRINCIPALITY OF TVER (yoke) (AD 1247–1480) State, feudal, slavic (Grand Duchy of Tver). Vassal of Golden Horde. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Principality of Vladimir (yoke). The Tatar-Mongol yoke got rid of by becoming an independent Principality of Tver. The capital was Tver
info_701: PRINCIPALITY OF TVER (AD 1480–1485) State, feudal, slavic (Grand Duchy of Tver). Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of getting rid of the Tatar-Mongol yoke. Joining to Principality of Moscow. The capital was Tver
info_702: PRINCIPALITY OF MOSCOW (yoke) (AD 1263–1480) State, feudal, monarchical (from 1363 — Grand Duchy of Moscow). Vassal of Golden Horde. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Principality of Vladimir (yoke). The Tatar-Mongol yoke got rid of, becoming an independent Principality of Moscow. The capital was Moscow
info_703: PRINCIPALITY OF RYAZAN (AD 1129–1240),(AD 1480–1521) State, feudal, slavic (Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Principality of Chernigov. It fell under the Tatar-Mongol yoke),(Returned independence. Joining to Principality of Moscow). The capital was Ryazan
info_704: PRINCIPALITY OF RYAZAN(yoke) (AD 1240–1480) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Formed in the territory of modern Russia as a result of falling Principality of Ryazan under the Tatar-Mongolian yoke. Returned independence. The capital was Ryazan
info_705: KUBAN PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC (AD 1918, January – 1920, March) Non-Soviet state. Formed in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Soviet Russia. Has become a part of Soviet Russia. The capital was Yekaterinodar.
info_706: RUSSIA (AD 1991–) State, republic (Russian Federation). Formed as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital is Moscow
info_707: PRINCIPALITY OF DMITROV (yoke) (AD 1280–1364) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Principality of Vladimir (yoke). Joining to Principality of Moscow. The capital was Dmitrov
info_708: PRINCIPALITY OF NIZHNY NOVGOROD-SUZDAL (yoke) (AD 1341–1425) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Principality of Vladimir (yoke). Joining to Principality of Moscow. The capital was Nizhny Novgorod
info_709: PRINCIPALITY OF ROSTOV (yoke) (AD 1364–1474) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Principality of Vladimir (yoke). Joining to Principality of Moscow. The capital was Rostov
info_710: Principality of Yaroslavl (yoke) (AD 1364–1463) State, feudal, slavic. Vassal of Golden Horde. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Principality of Vladimir (yoke). Joining to Principality of Moscow. The capital was Yaroslavl
info_711: CAUCASIAN ALBANIA (400 BC – AD 461) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan. Formed by Caucasian Albanians. The capital was Kabalak. Has become a part of Sasanian Empire.
info_712: DERBENT EMIRATE (AD 869–1071),(1157–1240) State, feudal theocratic, muslim. (Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of the collapse of Abbasid Caliphate. Conquered by Seljuk Empire),(Recreated as a result of decay Seljuk Empire. Conquered by Mongols and included in the composition of Golden Horde). The capital was Derbent.
info_713: ALANIA (AD 900–1240) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Russia. Formed by Alans. The capital was Maghas. Conquered by Mongols and included in the composition of Golden Horde
info_714: AVAR KHANATE (AD 1100–1240) State, feudal theocratic, muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Russia. Formed by Avars. Conquered by Mongols and included in the composition of Golden Horde. The capital was Khunzah.
info_715: SAMOS (700–520 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by the ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Greece (Samos Island). Conquered by Achaemenid Empire. City of Samos exists to the present.
info_716: METAPONTUM (600–272 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Formed by the ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Italy. Conquered by Roman Republic.
info_717: STATE OF SHIRVANSHAH (AD 869–1071),(1157–1231),(1353–1538) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of the collapse of Abbasid Caliphate. Conquered by Seljuk Empire),(Recreated as a result of decay Seljuk Empire. Conquered by Mongol Empire),(Recreated as a result of decay Ilkhanate. Conquered by Safavid Empire). The capital was Shamakhi.
info_718: DERBENT KHANATE (AD 1747–1806) State, feudal, muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of the collapse of Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital was Derbent.
info_719: CAUCASIAN IMAMATE (AD 1829–1859) State, theocratic, muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of merger of the Mountain Peoples of Chechnya and Dagestan during the Caucasian War. Conquered by Russian Empire. The capitals not specified.
info_720: NORTH CAUCASIAN EMIRATE (AD 1919, September – 1920, March) State, monarchical, muslim under the protectorate of Ottoman Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Soviet Russia. Has become a part of Soviet Russia. The capital was Vedeno.
info_721: PSKOV REPUBLIC (AD 1348–1510) State, feudal, republic. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Novgorod Republic (yoke). Joining to Principality of Moscow. The capital was Pskov
info_722: VOLGA BULGARIA (AD 800–1240) State, feudal, monarchical, muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Russia Bulgarian tribes who came from Great Bulgaria. Conquered by Golden Horde. The capital was Bolghar
info_723: KHANATE OF KAZAN (AD 1438–1552) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Russia in the process of the collapse of Golden Horde into a number of independent states. Joining to Tsardom of Russia. The capital was Kazan
info_724: NOGAI HORDE (AD 1440–1555) State, feudal, monarchical, nomadic. Originated in the territory of modern Russia in the process of the collapse of Golden Horde into a number of independent states. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Tsardom of Russia. The capital was Saray-Jük
info_725: KHANATE OF TYUMEN (AD 1468–1495) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Russia in the process of the collapse of Golden Horde into a number of independent states. Converted to Khanate of Sibir. The capital was Chimgi-Tura
info_726: KHANATE OF SIBIR (AD 1495–1555),(1572–1598) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of transformation of Khanate of Tyumen. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Tsardom of Russia.),(Restored independence. Conquered by Tsardom of Russia). The capital was Qashliq
info_727: KHANATE OF SIBIR (Russian) (AD 1555–1572) State, vassal Tsardom of Russia. Formed in the territory of modern Russia as a result of hitting Khanate of Sibir in vassal dependence on Tsardom of Russia. Restored independence. The capital was Qashliq
info_728: NOGAI HORDE (Russian) (AD 1555–1634) State, vassal Tsardom of Russia. Formed in the territory of modern Russia as a result of hitting Nogai Horde in vassal dependence on Tsardom of Russia. Joining to Tsardom of Russia. The capital was Saray-Jük
info_729: ROURAN KHAGANATE (AD 402–552) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Mongolia as a result of merger Mongolian nomadic tribes. Converted in Turkic Khaganate as a result of the conquest by the Turks
info_730: EASTERN TURKIC KHAGANATE (AD 603–630) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Mongolia as a result of the collapse of Turkic Khaganate. Conquered by Tang dynasty. The capital was Ordu-Baliq
info_731: GÖKTÜRK KHAGANATE (AD 682–745) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Mongolia as a result of the restoration of the independence of the former Eastern Turkic Khaganate and its separation from the Tang Empire. After the seizure of power by the Uygur tribes, it ceased to exist and was transformed into the Uyghur Khaganate. The capital was Ordu-Baliq
info_732: TANG EMPIRE (AD 618–907) State, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern China as a result of the change of dynasty in the Sui Empire. It fell apart into ten kingdoms. The capitals were Chang'an (618–904), Luoyang (904–907)
info_733: UYGHUR KHAGANATE (AD 745–847) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Mongolia as a result of the seizure of power by the Uighur tribes in the Göktürk Khaganate. Has ceased to exist and split into separate tribal alliances. The capital was Ordu Baliq
info_734: YUAN DYNASTY (AD 1271–1368) State, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Mongolia as a result of the establishment in Mongol Empire of power grandson of Genghis Khan Khan Khubilai. Converted to the Great Ming Empire as a result of the uprising of the Red Bandages. The capital was Khanbaliq
info_735: QING EMPIRE (AD 1636–1912) State, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern China as a result of the separation of Northeast China (Manchuria) from the Great Ming Empire. As a result of the revolution, the Republic of China was proclaimed. The capitals were Shengjing (1636–1644), Peking (1644–1912)
info_736: DZUNGAR KHANATE (AD 1635–1755) State, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern China as a result of merger Oirat tribes. Conquered by Qing Empire. The capital was Ghulja
info_737: JAPAN (660 BC –) State monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Japan the legendary Emperor Jimmu. The capital is Tokyo (from 1869)
info_738: REPUBLIC OF CHINA (AD 1912–1949) State, republic. Originated in the territory of modern PRC as a result of the overthrow of the monarchical system in the Qing Empire. After the defeat in the civil war, it relocated to the island of Taiwan (in the now partially recognized state – Taiwan), in the territory of mainland China in 1949 the People's Republic of China was proclaimed. Capital – Beijing
info_739: FAR EASTERN REPUBLIC (AD 1920–1922, November) Formally independent, democratic State. Formed in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Soviet Russia. Has become a part of Soviet Russia. The capitals were Verkhneudinsk; from 1920. October — Chita.
info_740: TUVAN PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC (AD 1921–1944) State, republic. Originated in the territory of modern Russia as a result of separation from Soviet Russia (in 1921–1926 - Tannu Tuva). Has become a part of USSR. The capital was Kyzyl
info_741: COLCHIS (1200–720 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical, legendary. Originated in the territory of modern Georgia. It is known from the ancient Greek legend of the Argonauts, who swam to Colchis for the Golden Fleece. It is considered the birthplace of the Amazons. Destroyed by tribes of Cimmerians and Scythians
info_742: DIAUEHI (1118–756 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Turkey as a result of merger tribes. Conquered by Urartu. The capital was Zua
info_743: KINGDOM OF COLCHIS (550–102 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of merger tribes of Colchians. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus
info_744: DIOSCURIAS (500–102 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks, people from Miletus in the territory of modern Georgia. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus. Located in the center of the present Sukhumi
info_745: PITYUS (500–102 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks in the territory of modern Georgia. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus. Located on the site of the current Pitsunda
info_746: PHASIS (500–102 BC) City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Founded by ancient Greeks, people from Miletus in the territory of modern Georgia. Conquered by Kingdom of Pontus
info_747: EGRISI (300–562 AD) State, slave-owning, monarchical, vassal of the Roman Empire, vassal of the Roman Empire, then the Eastern Roman Empire and Byzantine Empire. Originated in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of separation from The Roman Empire. Conquered by Byzantine Empire. The capital was Archaeopolis
info_748: KINGDOM OF KAKHETI (AD 637–1106),(1466–1555) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of separation from Sasanian Empire. Joining to Kingdom of Georgia), (Restored independence as a result of the collapse of Kingdom of Georgia. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Safavid Empire). The capitals were Gremi,Telavi
info_749: KINGDOM OF ABKHAZIA (786–1008 AD) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of separation from Byzantine Empire. Has become a part of Kingdom of Georgia. The capital was Anacopia (New Athos), from 806 — Kutaisi
info_750: HERETI (787–959 AD) State, feudal, monarchical, Georgian. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Abbasid Caliphate. Conquered by Kingdom of Kakheti. The capital was Shaki
info_751: EMIRATE OF TBILISI (736–1122 AD) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of separation from Umayyad Caliphate. Has become a part of Kingdom of Georgia. The capital was Tbilisi
info_752: KINGDOM OF LORI (AD 979–1118) State, Armenian feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Armenia as a result of separation from Bagratid Armenia. Has become a part of Kingdom of Georgia. The capitals were Lori (from 1065), Matsnaberd
info_753: KINGDOM OF KARTLI (AD 1466–1555) State, Georgian feudal, monarchical. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the collapse of Kingdom of Georgia. The capital was Tbilisi. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Safavid Empire
info_754: PRINCIPALITY OF GURIA (AD 1463–1555) State, feudal, monarchical. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the collapse of Kingdom of Georgia. The capital was Ozurgeti. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire
info_755: PRINCIPALITY OF ABKHAZIA (AD 1462–1555) State, feudal, monarchical. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the collapse of Kingdom of Georgia. The capital was Sukhumi. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire
info_756: KINGDOM OF IMERETI (AD 1466–1555) State, feudal, monarchical. The capital was Kutaisi. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the collapse of Kingdom of Georgia. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire
info_757: PRINCIPALITY OF GURIA (Ottoman) (AD 1555–1804) State, feudal, monarchical, vassal of the Ottoman Empire. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of falling of Principality of Guria into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire. The capital was Ozurgeti. Has become a part of Russian Empire
info_758: PRINCIPALITY OF ABKHAZIA (Ottoman) (AD 1555–1810) State, feudal, monarchical, vassal of the Ottoman Empire. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of falling of Principality of Abkhazia into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire. The capital was Sukhumi. Has become a part of Russian Empire
info_759: KINGDOM OF IMERETI (Ottoman) (AD 1555–1804) State, feudal, monarchical, vassal of the Ottoman Empire. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of falling of Kingdom of Imereti into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire. The capital was Kutaisi. Has become a part of Russian Empire
info_760: KINGDOM OF KARTLI (Pers.) (AD 1555–1590),(AD 1612–1724),(1735–1762) State, Georgian feudal, monarchical, vassal of Safavid Empire. (Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of falling of Kingdom of Kartli into a vassal dependence on Safavid Empire. Has become vassal dependent on Ottoman Empire),(Has become vassal dependent on Safavid Empire. Has become vassal dependent on Ottoman Empire),(Has become vassal dependent on Safavid Empire. United with Kingdom of Kakheti (Pers.), forming Kartli-Kingdom of Kakheti). The capital was Tbilisi.
info_761: KINGDOM OF KAKHETI (Pers.) (AD 1555–1590),(AD 1612–1724),(1735–1762) State, Georgian feudal, monarchical, vassal of Safavid Empire. (Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of falling of Kingdom of Kakheti into a vassal dependence on Safavid Empire. Has become vassal dependent on Ottoman Empire),(Has become vassal dependent on Safavid Empire. Has become vassal dependent on Ottoman Empire),(Has become vassal dependent on Safavid Empire. United with Kingdom of Kartli (Pers.), forming Kingdom of Kartli-Kakheti). The capitals were Gremi, Telavi.
info_762: PRINCIPALITY OF MINGRELIA (AD 1491–1555) State, feudal, monarchical. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of separation from Kingdom of Imereti. The capital was Zugdidi. Has fallen into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire
info_763: PRINCIPALITY OF MINGRELIA (Ottoman) (AD 1555–1803) State, feudal, monarchical , vassal of the Ottoman Empire. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of falling Principality of Mingrelia into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire. The capital was Zugdidi. Has become a part of Russian Empire
info_764: PRINCIPALITY OF SVANETI (AD 1491–1858) State, feudal, monarchical. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of separation from Kingdom of Imereti. Has become a part of Russian Empire
info_765: KINGDOM OF KARTLI (Ottoman) (AD 1590–1612),(AD 1724–1735) State, Georgian feudal, monarchical, vassal of the Ottoman Empire. (Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of falling Kingdom of Kartli (Pers.) into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire. Has become vassal dependent on Safavid Empire),(Has become vassal dependent on Ottoman Empire. Has become vassal dependent on Safavid Empire). The capital was Tbilisi.
info_766: KINGDOM OF KAKHETI (Ottoman) (AD 1590–1612),(AD 1724–1735) State, Georgian feudal, monarchical, vassal of the Ottoman Empire. (Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of falling Kingdom of Kakheti (Pers.) into a vassal dependence on Ottoman Empire. Has become vassal dependent on Safavid Empire),(Has become vassal dependent on Ottoman Empire. Has become vassal dependent onSafavid Empire). The capitals were Gremi, Telavi.
info_767: SAMTSKHE-SAATABAGO (Ottoman) (AD 1555–1590) State (principality), Georgian feudal, monarchical, vassal of the Ottoman Empire. The capital was Akhaltsikhe. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the division of Samtskhe-Saatabago into two domains. Has become a part of Ottoman Empire
info_768: SAMTSKHE-SAATABAGO(Pers.) (AD 1555–1590) State (principality), Georgian feudal, monarchical, vassal Safavid Empire. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the division of Samtskhe-Saatabago into two domains. The capital was Akhaltsikhe. Has become a part of Ottoman Empire
info_769: KINGDOM OF KARTLI-KAKHETI (Pers.) (AD 1762–1783) State, feudal, monarchical. Vassal of the Persia. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of merger Kingdom of Kartli (Pers.) and Kingdom of Kakheti (Pers.). The capitals were Telavi, Tbilisi. Passed under the protectorate Russian Empire
info_770: KINGDOM OF KARTLI-KAKHETI (Russian) (AD 1783–1801) State, feudal, monarchical. Protectorate of Russian Empire. Occurred in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the transition of the Kingdom of Kartli-Kakheti (Pers.) under the protectorate of Russian Empire after the conclusion of the Treaty of Georgievsk. The capitals were Telavi, Tbilisi. Joining to Russian Empire
info_771: DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF GEORGIA (AD 1918–1921) State, capitalist. Formed in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of separation from Soviet Russia. The capital was Tbilisi. After the introduction of Soviet troops and the proclamation of Soviet power converted to the Georgian SSR
info_772: GEORGIAN SSR (AD 1921–1922, March) State, socialist (Socialist Soviet Republic of Georgia). Formed in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the establishment of Soviet power in the Democratic Republic of Georgia. The capital was Tbilisi. Has become a part of Transcaucasian SFSR
info_773: TRANSCAUCASIAN SFSR (AD 1922, March–1922, December) State, federative, socialist (Transcaucasian Socialist Federative Soviet Republic (TSFSR)). Formed as a result of merger Azerbaijan SSR, Armenian SSR and Georgian SSR. The capital was Tbilisi. Has become a part of USSR
info_774: GEORGIA (AD 1991–) State, republic. Originated in the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital is Tbilisi
info_775: ABKHAZIA (AD 1994–) Self-proclaimed, partially recognized state, republic (Republic of Abkhazia). Formed in part of the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the separation from Georgia. After the Russian-Georgian war of 2008, Russia recognized the independence of Abkhazia. The capital is Sukhum
info_776: SOUTH OSSETIA (AD 1992–) Self-proclaimed, partially recognized state, republic (Republic of South Ossetia). Formed in part of the territory of modern Georgia as a result of the separation from Georgia. After the Russian-Georgian war of 2008, Russia recognized the independence of South Ossetia. The capital is Tskhinval
info_777: KINGDOM OF SYUNIK (AD 987–1170) State, Armenian feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Armenia as a result of separation from Bagratid Armenia. Conquered by Atabek Azerbaijan. The capital was Kapan
info_778: ATABEGS OF AZERBAIJAN (AD 1145–1225) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iran as a result of separation from Seljuk Empire. Conquered by Khwarezmid Empire. The capitals were Nakhchivan, Tabriz, Ardebil and Hamadan.
info_779: ERIVAN KHANATE (AD 1747–1828) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Armenia as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital is Yerevan.
info_780: NAKHICHEVAN KHANATE (AD 1747–1828) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital is Nakhichevan.
info_781: KARABAKH KHANATE (AD 1747–1805) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capitals were Bayat (1747—1751), Shahbulag (1751), Shusha (from 1751).
info_782: GANJA KHANATE(AD 1747–1804) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital was Ganja.
info_783: SHAMSHADIN SULTANAT (AD 1747–1801) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital was Shamkir.
info_784: QAZAX SULTANAT (AD 1747–1801) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital was Qazax.
info_785: FIRST REPUBLIC OF ARMENIA (AD 1918–1920) State, capitalist. Formed in the territory of modern Armenia as a result of separation from Soviet Russia. The capital was Yerevan. After the introduction of Soviet troops and the proclamation of Soviet power converted in SSR Armenia
info_786: SSR ARMENIA (AD 1920–1922, March) State, socialist (Socialist Soviet Republic of Armenia). Formed in the territory of modern Armenia as a result of the establishment of Soviet power in First Republic of Armenia. The capital was Yerevan. Has become a part of Transcaucasian SFSR
info_787: ARMENIA (AD 1991–) State, republic (Republic of Armenia). Originated in the territory of modern Armenia as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital is Yerevan
info_788: ATROPATENE (328 BC – AD 224) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iran as a result of separation from Macedonian Empire. The capital was Ganzak. Has become a part of Sasanian Empire
info_789: SAJID DYNASTY (AD 889–941) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the collapse of Abbasid Caliphate. The capitals were Maragha, Ardabil. Converted to Sallarid dynasty as a result of the conquest of power by the Sallarid dynasty.
info_790: SALLARID DYNASTY (AD 941–982) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the replacement of the Sajid dynasty by the Sallarid dynasty. The capital was Ardabil. Conquered by Rawadid dynasty.
info_791: RAWADID DYNASTY (AD 955–1071) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the collapse of Abbasid Caliphate. The capital was Tabriz. Conquered by Seljuk Empire.
info_792: EMIRATE OF GANJA (AD 951–1071) State, feudal theocratic, muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Sallarid dynasty. Conquered by Seljuk Empire. The capital was Ganja.
info_793: KHWAREZMID EMPIRE (AD 1097–1231) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of separation from Seljuk Empire. Conquered by Mongol Empire. The capitals were Gurganj (1097–1220), Samarkand (1212–1220), Ghazna (1220–1221), Delhi (1221–1225), Tabriz (1225–1231)
info_794: CHOBANIDS (AD 1335–1357) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the collapse of Ilkhanate. Conquered by Jalairid Sultanate. The capital was Tabriz
info_795: TIMURID EMPIRE (AD 1370–1526) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the seizure of power in Chagatai Khanate Timur. Converted to Mughal Empire. The capitals were Samarkand, Herat
info_796: SHAKI (AD 1353–1551) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of the collapse of Ilkhanate. Conquered by Safavid Empire. The capital was Shaki
info_797: TALYSH KHANATE (AD 1747–1813) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital was Lankaran.
info_798: SHIRVAN KHANATE (AD 1747–1805) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital was Shamakhy.
info_799: QUBA KHANATE (AD 1747–1806) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital was Quba.
info_800: BAKU KHANATE (AD 1747–1806) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital was Baku.
info_801: DJARO-BELOKANI COMMUNITIES (AD 1747–1803) State formation on the basis of blood relationship. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Kingdom of Kakheti (Pers.). Has become a part of Russian Empire.
info_802: ELISU SULTANATE (AD 1747–1804) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital was İlisu
info_803: AZERBAIJAN DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC (AD 1918–1920) State, capitalist. Formed in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Soviet Russia. The capital was Baku. After the introduction of Soviet troops and the proclamation of Soviet power converted to Azerbaijan SSR
info_804: AZERBAIJAN SSR (AD 1920–1922, March) State, socialist (Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of the establishment of Soviet power in Azerbaijan Democratic Republic. The capital was Baku. Has become a part of Transcaucasian SFSR
info_805: AZERBAIJAN (AD 1991–) State, republic (Azerbaijan Republic). Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital is Baku
info_806: REPUBLIC OF ARTSAKH (AD 1992–) Self-proclaimed, State, republic. Formed by part of the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Azerbaijan. The capital was Stepanakert
info_807: SHAKI KHANATE (AD 1747–1805) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Azerbaijan as a result of separation from Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capital was Shaki.
info_808: SOGDI (AD 700–550 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the formation of the state in Sogdians. The capital were Samarkand, Bukhara, Khujand, Kesh. Conquered by Achaemenid Empire.
info_809: GRECO-BACTRIAN KINGDOM (256–125 BC) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Afghanistan as a result of separation from Seleucid Empire. The capital was Bactra. Destroyed by nomadic tribes of Tochars, heirs of Greco-Bactrian kings founded the Indo-Greek Kingdom
info_810: WUSUN (177–7 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kyrgyzstan as a result of the resettlement of the nomadic Wusun tribe from Xinjiang (Eastern China) to Semirechie. It ceased to exist as a result of the resettlement of Wusun in the Aral Sea area.
info_811: HEPHTHALITE EMPIRE (AD 420–567) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Afghanistan as a result of the conquest of Hephthalites (White Huns) part of the territory of Sasanian Empire. Conquered by Sasanian Empire.
info_812: TURGESH KHAGANATE (AD 704–756) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kyrgyzstan as a result of the seizure of power by the tribes of the Turgesh in the Western Turkic Khaganate. The capital was Suyab. After the seizure of power by the tribes of Karluks ceased to exist and transformed into the Karluk yabghu.
info_813: KIMEK CONFEDERATION (AD 750–1035) State, slave-owning, monarchical.Originated in the territory of modern Kazakhstan as a result of the formation of the state among the nomadic Turkic Kimek tribes. The capitals were Khagan-Kimek, Imekia. Has ceased to exist under the onslaught of the Kipchak tribes.
info_814: KARLUK YABGHU (AD 756–940) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kyrgyzstan as a result of the seizure of power by the tribes of Karluks in the Turgesh Kaganate. The capitals were Suyab, Balasagun. Has become a part of Kara-Khanid Khanate
info_815: OGHUZ YABGU STATE (AD 756–1055) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kazakhstan as a result of the formation of the state in tribes of Oghuzes. The capital was Yangikent. Has ceased to exist under the onslaught of the Kipchak tribes and has become a part of the Cuman-Kipchak Confederation.
info_816: SAMANID EMPIRE (AD 819–999) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of separation from Abbasid Caliphate (formally up to 875 - emirate as part of Abbasid Caliphate). The capitals were Samarkand, Bukhara. Conquered by Kara-Khanid Khanate.
info_817: TAHIRID DYNASTY (AD 821–873) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of separation from Abbasid Caliphate (formally - emirate as part of Abbasid Caliphate). The capital was Nishapur. After the seizure of power, the Saffarid dynasty ceased to exist and was transformed into Saffarid dynasty.
info_818: KARA-KHANID KHANATE (AD 840–1040) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kyrgyzstan as a result of the collapse of Uyghur Khaganate, formed by Turkic tribes, yagma and chigili. The capitals were Balasagun, Kashgar. It was split into Western Kara-Khanid Khanate and Estern Kara-Khanid Khanate.
info_819: SAFFARID DYNASTY (AD 873–900) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Afghanistan as a result of the seizure of power by the Saffarid dynasty in Tahirid Dynasty (formally - emirate as part of Abbasid Caliphate). The capitals were Zaranj, Nishapur. Conquered by Samanid Empire.
info_820: KARLUK KHANATE (AD 960–1222) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Kazakhstan as a result of separation from Kara-Khanid Khanate. Vassal Kara-Khanid Khanate (up to 1130), Qara Khitai (1130–1200). The capitals were Koilik (960–1222), Almalyk (1200–1222). Conquered by Mongol Empire.
info_821: GHAZNAVID EMPIRE (AD 963–1186) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Afghanistan as a result of separation from Samanid Empire. The capitals were Ghazna (963–1151), Lahore (1151–1187). Conquered by Ghurid Sultanate.
info_822: CUMAN-KIPCHAK CONFEDERATION (AD 1035–1219) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kazakhstan as a result of the transfer of power in the Kimek confederation to the tribes of the Kipchaks. Conquered by Mongol Empire.
info_823: EASTERN KARA-KHANID KHANATE (AD 1040–1212) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the collapse of Kara-Khanid Khanate. From 1141 - vassal of Qara Khitai. The capital was Balasagun (1040–1134), Kashgar (from 1134). Conquered by Qara Khitai
info_824: WESTERN KARA-KHANID KHANATE (AD 1040–1212) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kyrgyzstan as a result of the collapse of Kara-Khanid Khanate. From 1089 — vassal Seljuk Empire. The capital was Samarkand. Conquered by Khwarezmid Empire.
info_825: QARA KHITAI (AD 1124–1218) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern China as a result of the fall of the Liao Empire. Originated Khitan prince Ye-lu Dashi. The capital was Balasagun (from 1134). Conquered by Mongol Empire.
info_826: CHAGATAI KHANATE (AD 1225–1370) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of separation from Mongol Empire. The capitals were Almalyk (1225–1266), Samarkand (1266–1370). It ceased to exist as a result of the seizure of power in Timur and formed Timurid Empire
info_827: MOGHULISTAN (AD 1347–1570) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of separation from Chagatai Khanate. In 1390-1416 - the vassal of Timurid Empire. The capitals were Almalyk (1346–1380, 1419–1570), Turpan (1380–1419). Conquered by Yarkent Khanate
info_828: UZBEK KHANATE (AD 1428–1480) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kazakhstan as a result of the collapse of Golden Horde. Conquered by Kazakh Khanate. The capitals were Chimgi-Tura, Orda-Bazaar (1428–1446), Syghanaq (1446–1468), Kazhi-Tarkhan (1468–1480)
info_829: KAZAKH KHANATE (AD 1465–1847) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Kazakhstan as a result of separation from Moghulistan. Has become a part of Russian Empire. The capitals were Chimgi-Tura, Orda-Bazaar (1465–1469,1511–1521), Syghanaq (1469–1511,1521–1599), Turkestan (1599–1847)
info_830: KHANATE OF KHIVA (AD 1512–1740),(1747–1873),(1917–1920) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the seizure by the nomadic Uzbek tribes of Khorezm and its separation from the Khanate of Bukhara. Conquered by Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah and installed the Persian protectorate - Khanate of Khiva (Pers.)),(Liberation from the Persian Protectorate. Establishment of the Russian protectorate — Khanate of Khiva (Russian)),(Exemption from the Russian protectorate. Converted to Khorezm People's Soviet Republic). The capital was Khiva
info_831: KHANATE OF KOKAND (AD 1709–1876) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of separation from Khanate of Bukhara. Joining to Russian Empire. The capital were Eski-Kurgan (1709–1732), Kokand (1732–1876)
info_832: KHANATE OF BUKHARA (Pers.) (AD 1740–1747) State, feudal, monarchical, vassal Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Occurred in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of conquests Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah and loss of independence Khanate of Bukhara. The capital was Bukhara. Returned independence
capital_833: Almaty (up to 1997), Astana (from 1997; from March 2019 to September 2022 was called Nur-Sultan)
info_833: KAZAKHSTAN (AD 1991–) State, republic (Republic of Kazakhstan). Originated in the territory of modern Kazakhstan as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capitals were Almaty (up to 1997), Astana (from 1997; from March 2019 to September 2022 was called Nur-Sultan)
info_834: KHWAREZM (700–550 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical (Kingdom of Khwarezm). Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the formation of the state among the Khorezmians. Conquered by Achaemenid Empire.
info_835: KUSHAN EMPIRE (AD 30–375) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the formation of the state among the Indo-Iranian Tocharians. The capital was Bactra. Conquered by Sasanian Empire and Gupta Empire
info_836: UZBEKISTAN (AD 1991–) State, republic (Republic of Uzbekistan). Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital was Tashkent
info_837: KHANATE OF KHIVA (Pers.) (AD 1740–1747) State, feudal, monarchical, vassal Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. Occurred in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of conquests Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah and loss of independence of Khanate of Khiva. The capital was Khiva. Returned independence
info_838: BUKHARA EMIRATE (AD 1785–1868),(1917–1920) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of transformation of Khanate of Bukhara. The establishment of the Russian protectorate — Bukhara Emirate (Russian)),(Exemption from the Russian protectorate. Converted to Bukharan People's Soviet Republic). The capital was Bukhara
info_839: BUKHARA EMIRATE (Russian) (AD 1868–1917) State, protectorate Russian Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the recognition by the Bukhara Emirate of dependence on Russian Empire. Returned independence
info_840: KHANATE OF KHIVA (Russian) (AD 1873–1917) State, protectorate Russian Empire. Formed in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the recognition by the Khanate of Khiva of dependence on Russian Empire. The capital was Khiva. Returned independence
info_841: BUKHARAN PSR (AD 1920–1924) State, socialist (Bukharan People's Soviet Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the overthrow of the monarchy and the establishment of Soviet power in Bukhara Emirate. The capital was Bukhara. Has become a part of USSR
info_842: KHOREZM PSR (AD 1920–1924) State, socialist (Khorezm People's Soviet Republic). Formed in the territory of modern Uzbekistan as a result of the overthrow of the monarchy and the establishment of Soviet power in Khanate of Khiva. The capital was Khiva. Has become a part of USSR
info_843: TURKMENISTAN (AD 1991–) State, republic. Originated in the territory of modern Turkmenistan as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital was Ashgabat
info_844: ZIYARID DYNASTY (AD 928–1043) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of separation from Samanid Empire. The capital was Gorgan. Conquered by Seljuk Empire
info_845: KURT DYNASTY (AD 1335–1381) State, feudal monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Afghanistan as a result of separation from Ilkhanate. The capital was Herat. Conquered by Timurid Empire
info_846: SARBADARS (AD 1337–1381) State, feudal. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of separation from Ilkhanate. The capital was Sabzevar. Conquered by Timurid Empire
info_847: DURRANI EMPIRE (AD 1747–1823) State, feudal monarchical. Formed in the territory of modern Afghanistan as a result of the collapse of Afsharid Persian Empire of Nadir Shah. The capitals were Kandahar (1747–1773), Kabul (1774–1823). Converted to Emirate of Afghanistan
info_848: KYRGYZSTAN (AD 1991–) State, republic (Kyrgyz Republic). Originated in the territory of modern Kyrgyzstan as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital was Bishkek
info_849: TAJIKISTAN (AD 1991–) State, republic (Republic of Tajikistan). Originated in the territory of modern Tajikistan as a result of the collapse of USSR. The capital was Dushanbe
info_850: DUTCH EAST INDIES (AD 1800–1806),(1816–1942),(1945–1949) colony Netherlands. (Formed as a result of the transfer of power in the territory of modern Indonesia from the Dutch East India Company to the Batavian Republic. Came under the control of France, then (since 1811) - under the control of Great Britain}, {Returned to the Netherlands. Occupied by Japan}, {Freed from the Japanese Occupation Transformed into the Republic of Indonesia, proclaimed in 1945, recognized by the Netherlands in 1949) Capital - Batavia.
info_851: URUK (2800–2315 BC),(2150–2110 BC) Sumerian City State, slave-owning, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Became part of Akkadian Empire), (Out of Akkadian Empire. Conquered by Ur)
info_852: LAGASH (2500–2315 BC),(2150–2110 BC) Sumerian City State, slave-owning, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Became part of Akkadian Empire), (Out of Akkadian Empire. Conquered by Ur)
info_853: UR (2500–2315 BC),(2150–2000 BC) Sumerian City State, slave-owning, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Became part of Akkadian Empire), (Out of Akkadian Empire. Conquered by Larsa). Mentioned in the Old Testament as Ur of the Chaldeans, the birthplace of the prophet Abraham
info_854: ESHNUNNA (2500–2315 BC),(2150–1770 BC) Sumerian City State, slave-owning, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Became part of Akkadian Empire), (Out of Akkadian Empire. Conquered by Babylonia)
info_855: ELAM (2700–539 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iran. Separated from Mitanni. The capital was Susa. Conquered by Achaemenid Empire
info_856: UMMA (2400–2315 BC),(2150–2000 BC) Sumerian City State, slave-owning, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Became part of Akkadian Empire), (Out of Akkadian Empire.Conquered by Larsa)
info_857: LARSA (2025–1763 BC) Sumerian City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iraq by Amorites. Conquered by Babylonia
info_858: ISIN (2017–1794 BC) Sumerian City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Conquered by Larsa
info_859: ASHUR (1970–1758 BC) Sumerian City State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Conquered by Babylonia. From 1400 BC — the capital of Assyria
info_860: CHARACENE (127 BC – AD 224) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Vassal of the Parthian Empire. Originated in the territory of modern Iraq. Formed as a result of the collapse of Seleucid Empire. The capital was Spasinu Charax. Conquered by Sasanian Empire.
info_861: STATE OF BUYID (AD 934–1055) State, feudal theocratic muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of separation from Abbasid Caliphate. The capital was Shiraz. Conquered by Seljuk Empire
info_862: BAGHDAD CALIPHATE (AD 1157–1258) State, feudal theocratic muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Iraq as a result of the collapse of Seljuk Empire and the restoration of the Abbasid dynasty. The capital was Baghdad. Conquered by Ilkhanate
