info_863: IRAQ (zone of British occupation) (AD 1918–1920) Territory occupied by Great Britain. Formed as a result of the collapse of Ottoman Empire in the territory of modern Iraq. The capital was Baghdad. Converted to Iraq (Brit.)
info_864: IRAQ (Brit.) (AD 1920–1932) The Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of United Kingdom. (from AD 1921 — Kingdom of Iraq). Formed in the territory of modern Iraq in zone of British occupation. The capital was Baghdad. In 1932, the independent Kingdom of Iraq was proclaimed
info_865: IRAQ (AD 1932–) State, capitalist (AD 1932–1958 — Kingdom of Iraq, from AD 1958 — Republic of Iraq,). Formed in the territory of modern Iraq in the Mandate Territory of the League of Nations under the leadership of United Kingdom Iraq (Brit.). The capital was Baghdad
info_866: MAURYA EMPIRE (322–185 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the seizure of power in da Empire by the Maurya dynasty. The capital was Pataliputra. Destroyed as a result of the seizure of power by the Shunga dynasty and the formation of Shunga Empire
info_867: BAVAND DYNASTY (AD 665–715) State, feudal muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the collapse of Sasanian Empire. The capitals were Sari, Amol. Conquered by Ilkhanate
info_868: STATE OF ALIDS (AD 864–900),(914–928) State, feudal muslim. (Formed in the territory of modern Iran as a result of separation from Tahirid Dynasty. Conquered by Samanid Empire), (Separated from Samanid Empire. Conquered by Ziyarid dynasty). The capital was Amol.
info_869: NIZARI ISMAILI STATE (AD 1090–1256) State, theocratic muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Iran as a result of separation from Seljuk Empire. The capital was Alamut. Conquered by Ilkhanate.
info_870: MUZAFFARIDS (AD 1335–1393) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the collapse of Ilkhanate. The capital was Shiraz. Conquered by Timurid Empire
info_871: STATE OF INDZUIDS (AD 1335–1357) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern Iran as a result of the collapse of Ilkhanate. Conquered by Muzaffarids. The capitals were Shiraz, Isfahan
info_872: BANDAR ABBAS (Port.) (AD 1506–1615) Possession of Portugal. Formed as a result of the conquest of part of the territory of Aq Qoyunlu by Portugal. Conquered by Safavid Empire
info_873: HORMUZ (Port.) (AD 1507–1622) Possession of Portugal. Formed as a result of the conquest of part of the territory of Aq Qoyunlu by Portugal. Conquered by Safavid Empire
info_874: MUGHAL EMPIRE (AD 1526–1857) State, feudal. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of transformation of Timurid Empire, moving to India. Conquered by United Kingdom and included in the composition of possession British East India Company in India. The capitals were Delhi, Lahore, Agra
info_875: IRAN (AD 1935–) State, republic (Islamic Republic of Iran; since 1979 — monarchy). Originated in the territory of modern Iran as a result of renaming Persia. The capital was Tehran
info_876: Emirate of Diriyah (AD 1744–1818) State, theocratic, muslim. The first Saudi State, Formed in the territory of modern Saudi Arabia Muhammad bin Saud. The capital was Diriyah. Destroyed by Ottoman Empire
info_877: EMIRATE OF NEJD (AD 1824–1891) State, theocratic, muslim. The second Saudi State, Re-created in the territory of modern Saudi Arabia. The capital was Riyadh. Conquered by Emirate of Jabal Shammar
info_878: EMIRATE OF JABAL SHAMMAR (AD 1836–1921) State, theocratic, muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Saudi Arabia as a result of separation from Emirate of Nejd. The capital was Ha'il. Has become a part of Sultanate of Nejd
info_879: EMIRATE OF NEJD AND HASA (AD 1902–1921) State, theocratic, muslim. The third Saudi State. Formed in the territory of modern Saudi Arabia as a result of separation from Emirate of Jabal Shammar. The capital was Riyadh. Has become a part of Sultanate of Nejd
info_880: IDRISID EMIRATE OF ASIR (AD 1910–1934) State, feudal, theocratic, muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Saudi Arabia as a result of separation from Ottoman Empire. The capital was Sabya. Separated between Saudi Arabia and Yemen
info_881: KINGDOM OF HEJAZ (AD 1910–1926) State, feudal, theocratic, muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Saudi Arabia as a result of separation from Ottoman Empire. The capital was Mecca. Has become a part of Kingdom of Hejaz and Nejd
info_882: SULTANATE OF NEJD (AD 1921–1926) State, theocratic, muslim. Formed in the territory of modern Saudi Arabia as a result of merger Emirate of Nejd and Hasa and Emirate of Jabal Shammar. The capital was Riyadh. Has become a part of Kingdom of Hejaz and Nejd
info_883: KINGDOM OF HEJAZ AND NEJD (AD 1926–1932) State, theocratic, muslim . Formed in the territory of modern Saudi Arabia as a result of merger Sultanate of Nejd and Kingdom of Hejaz. The capital was Riyadh. Converted to Saudi Arabia
info_884: SAUDI ARABIA (AD 1932–) State, theocratic, muslim (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia). Formed in the territory of modern Saudi Arabia as a result of transformation of Kingdom of Hejaz and Nejd. The capital is Riyadh
info_885: KUWAIT (Ottoman) (AD 1752–1899) State, feudal, theocratic, muslim (Sheikhdom of Kuwait), under the protectorate of Ottoman Empire. Originated in the territory of modern Kuwait as a result of separation from Ottoman Empire. The capital was Al Kuwait. Passed under the protectorate of United Kingdom.
info_886: KUWAIT (Brit.) (AD 1899–1961) State, feudal, monarchical (Sheikhdom of Kuwait), under the protectorate of United Kingdom. Originated in the territory of modern Kuwait as a result of the transition of the protectorate from Ottoman Empire to the United Kingdom. The capital was Al Kuwait. June 19, 1961 declared the independent State of Kuwait
info_887: KUWAIT (AD 1961–1990),(1991–) State, monarchical (State of Kuwait). (Originated in the territory of modern Kuwait as a result of the proclamation of independence from the United Kingdom. Occupied by Iraq), (During the military operation ('Desert Storm') released from occupation). The capital iss Al Kuwait
info_888: DILMUN (2800–605 BC) State, slave-owning. Originated in the territory of modern Bahrain. From 729 BC — vassal of Assyria. Conquered by Achaemenid Empire
info_889: QARMATIAN REPUBLIC (AD 899–1076) State, theocratic muslim. Formed by religious sect of the Qarmatians in the territory of modern Bahrain as a result of separation from Abbasid Caliphate. Conquered by Emirate of the Uyunids.
info_890: UYUNID DYNASTY (AD 1076–1253) State, muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Bahrain as as result of the conquest of Qarmatian Republic. Conquered by Usfurid dynasty.
info_891: USFURID DYNASTY(AD 1253–1320) State, muslim. Originated in the territory of modern Bahrain as result of the conquest of Uyunid dynasty. Conquered by Ilkhanate
info_892: BAHRAIN (Port.) (AD 1521–1602) Possession of Portugal. Formed in the territory of modern Bahrain as a result of the conquest of archipelago of Bahrain by Portugal. Conquered by Safavid Empire
info_893: BAHRAIN (AD 1783–1820),(1971–) State, monarchical (from 2002 — Kingdom of Bahrain). (Originated in the territory of modern Bahrain as a result of separation from Persia. In 1801–1813 — vassal of Emirate of Diriyah. Establishment of the protectorate of the United Kingdom — Bahrain (Brit.)),(Proclamation of independence from the United Kingdom). The capital iss Manama
info_894: BAHRAIN (Brit.) (AD 1820–1971) State, monarchical under the protectorate of United Kingdom. Originated in the territory of modern Bahrain as a result of the establishment of the United Kingdom protectorate over Bahrain. The capital was Manama. 15 August 1971 August 15, 1971 proclaimed the independent Emirate of Bahrain
info_895: QATAR (Port.) (AD 1517–1538) Possession of Portugal. Originated in the territory of modern Qatar as a result of his conquest by Portugal. Conquered by Ottoman Empire
info_896: QATAR (AD 1850–1868),(1971–) State, monarchical (from 1971 — State of Qatar). (Originated in the territory of modern Qatar as a result of separation from Emirate of Nejd. Establishment of the protectorate of the United Kingdom — Qatar (Brit.). In 1871–1914 — part of Ottoman Empire),(Proclamation of independence from the United Kingdom). The capital is Doha
info_897: QATAR (Brit.) (AD 1868–1871),(1914–1971) State, monarchical under the protectorate of United Kingdom. (Originated in the territory of modern Qatar as a result of the establishment of the United Kingdom protectorate over Qatar. Occupied by the Ottoman Empire),(The British protectorate was restored. September 3, 1971 proclaimed independent State of Qatar). The capital was Doha
info_898: OMAN (Port.) (AD 1508–1650) Possession of Portugal. Originated in the territory of modern Oman as a result of the conquest of its coast by Portugal. Conquered by Ottoman Empire. The capital was Muscat
info_899: TRUCIAL OMAN (Brit.) (AD 1820–1971) State, monarchical under the protectorate of United Kingdom (The Trucial States of the Coast of Oman ). Originated in the territory of modern United Arab Emirates as a result of the establishment of the United Kingdom protectorate over six sheikhs. December 2, 1971 proclaimed independent United Arab Emirates
info_900: UNITED ARAB EMIRATES (AD 1971–) State, monarchical. Federation of 7 Emirates. Originated in the territory of modern United Arab Emirates as a result of the proclamation of Trucial Oman independence from the United Kingdom. The capital is Abu Dhabi
info_901: MUSCAT AND OMAN (Brit.) (AD 1820–1970) State, muslim. (Sultanate of Muscat and Oman). Originated in the territory of modern Oman. The capital was Muscat. From 1891 under the protectorate of United Kingdom. In 1970, the independent Sultanate of Oman was proclaimed
info_902: OMAN (AD 1970–) State, muslim. (Sultanate of Oman). Originated in the territory of modern Oman as a result of the proclamation by the Sultanate of Muscat and Oman of independence from the United Kingdom. The capital was Muscat
info_903: SHEBA (1200–25 BC),(AD 100–270) State, slave-owning, monarchical (Kingdom of Sheba). (Originated in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of the resettlement of the tribes of the Sabaeans from northwestern Arabia. Conquered by Himyarite Kingdom),(Separated from Himyarite Kingdom). Conquered by Himyarite Kingdom). The capitals were Marib, Sana. The visit of the ruler of the Kingdom of Sheba Bilkis (Queen of Sheba) to King Solomon is described in the Bible
info_904: HADHRAMAUT (750 BC – AD 280) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Yemen. Conquered by Himyarite Kingdom. The capital was Shabwa.
info_905: KINGDOM OF AWSAN (750–650 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Yemen. Conquered by Sheba. The capital was Aden.
info_906: QATABAN (750–25 BC),(AD 100–160) State, slave-owning, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of the resettlement of the tribes of the Sabaeans from northwestern Arabia. Conquered by Himyarite Kingdom),(Separated from Himyarite Kingdom. Conquered by Hadhramaut). The capital was Timna.
info_907: MA'IN (750–100 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical (Kingdom of Ma'in). Originated in the territory of modern Yemen. Conquered by Sheba. The capitals were Yathill, Qarnawu.
info_908: HIMYARITE KINGDOM (110 BC – AD 525) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of merger the Himyarite tribes. Conquered by the Axumite Kingdom. From the 4th c. Judaism became the state religion. The capital was Zafar.
info_909: KINGDOM OF AKSUM (AD 100–940) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Ethiopia. Disintegrated. The capital was Aksum.
info_910: YEMEN (AD 897–1173),(AD 1229–1546),(AD 1635–1872),(1918–) State, muslim (up to 1962 imamat, then the kingdom, since 1962 republic). (Originated in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of separation from Abbasid Caliphate. Conquered by Ayyubid Sultanate),(Restored independence. Conquered by Ottoman Empire),(Restored independence. Conquered by Ottoman Empire),(Restored independence). The capital is Sana
info_911: SOCOTRA (Port.) (AD 1507–1511) Possession of Portugal. Originated in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of the conquest of the island of Socotra by Portugal. Portugal left the island.
info_912: ADEN (Port.) (AD 1516–1538),(1547–1548) Possession of Portugal. (Originated in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of the conquest of Aden by Portugal. Conquered by Ottoman Empire),(Conquered by Portugal. Conquered by Ottoman Empire) The capital was Aden
info_913: LAHEJ (AD 1728–1869) State, theocratic, muslim (Sultanate of Lahej ). Originated in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of separation from Yemen. The capital was Al Houta. Has become a part of Aden Protectorate (Brit.)
info_914: ADEN (Brit.) (AD 1839–1963) Possession of United Kingdom (up to 1937 — was part of British India, from 1937 — Crown Colony). Formed in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of Britain's rejection of the territory of Aden from Lahej. The capital was Aden. Has become a part of Federation of South Arabia (Brit.)
info_915: ADEN PROTECTORATE (Brit.) (AD 1869–1963) State under the protectorate of United Kingdom. Formed in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over the sultanates and sheikhs of South Arabia. The capital was Aden. Converted to Protectorate of South Arabia (Brit.)
info_916: FEDERATION OF SOUTH ARABIA (Brit.) (AD 1962–1967) State under the protectorate of United Kingdom. Formed in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of separation from Aden Protectorate (Brit.). The capital was Aden. Has become a part of People's Republic of Southern Yemen
info_917: PROTECTORATE OF SOUTH ARABIA (Brit.) (AD 1963–1967) State under the protectorate of United Kingdom. Formed in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of transformation of Aden Protectorate (Brit.). Has become a part of People's Republic of Southern Yemen
info_918: PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF SOUTHERN YEMEN (AD 1967–1970) State, socialist. Originated in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of the proclamation of independence from the United Kingdom by Federation of South Arabia (Brit.) and Protectorate of South Arabia (Brit.). The capital was Aden. Renamed to People's Democratic Republic of Yemen
info_919: PEOPLE'S DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF YEMEN (AD 1970–1990) State, socialist. Formed in the territory of modern Yemen as a result of renaming People's Republic of Southern Yemen. The capital was Aden. Joined to Yemen
info_920: GANDHĀRA (AD 700–515 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Pakistan as a result of the formation of the state among the Indian people of the Gandharas. The capital was Taxila. Conquered by Achaemenid Empire.
capital_921: Alexandria in the Caucasus, Sirkap, Sagala, Pushkalavati
info_921: INDO-GREEK KINGDOM (180 BC – AD 10) State, Hellenistic, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Afghanistan as a result of separation from Greco-Bactrian Kingdom. The capitals were Alexandria in the Caucasus, Sirkap, Sagala, Pushkalavati. Conquered by Indo-Scythian Kingdom
info_922: INDO-SCYTHIAN KINGDOM (85 BC – AD 400) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Afghanistan as a result of the conquest by the tribes of the Sakas part of Indo-Greek Kingdom. The capitals were Sigal, Taxila, Mathura. Conquered by Gupta Empire
info_923: INDO-PARTHIAN KINGDOM (20 BC – AD 30) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Pakistan as a result of separation from Parthian Empire. The capitals were Taxila, Kabul. Conquered by The Kushan kingdom
info_924: GHURID SULTANATE (AD 1148–1215) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Afghanistan as a result of separation from Ghaznavid Empire. The capitals were Ghazni, Lahore. Conquered by Khwarezmid Empire
info_925: AFGHANISTAN (AD 1823–) State (Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan; until 1926 - Emirate of Afghanistan, 1926-1973 - Kingdom of Afghanistan; 1973–2021 — Islamic Republic of Afghanistan). In 1879-1919 - British protectorate. Formed on the territory of Afghanistan as a result of conversion of the Durrani Empire in the Emirate of Afghanistan
info_926: MOHENJO-DARO (2600–1700 BC) City State Indus Valley civilization, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Pakistan. Destroyed by the tribes of the Aryans
info_927: HARAPPA (2600–1700 BC) City State Indus Valley civilization, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Pakistan. Destroyed by the tribes of the Aryans
info_928: GUPTA EMPIRE (AD 320–600) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the proclamation by the king of the representative of the Gupta dynasty Chandragupta I . The capital was Pataliputra. Disintegrated
info_929: RAI DYNASTY (AD 489–651) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Pakistan as a result of separation from Gupta Empire. The capital was Aror. Conquered by Umayyad Caliphate
info_930: SOOMRA DYNASTY (AD 1026–1351) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern Pakistan as a result of the separation of Sindh from Ghaznavid Empire and the establishment of the power of the Ismaili dynasty of the Soomra. The capital was Thatta. Conquered by Delhi Sultanate
info_931: DELHI SULTANATE (1206–1526),(1539–1555) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Ghurid Sultanate. Conquered by Mughal Empire), (Separated from Mughal Empire. Conquered by Mughal Empire). The capital was Delhi.
info_932: MARATHA EMPIRE (AD 1674–1818) State, feudal, monarchical, hindu. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Mughal Empire. The capitals were Raigad, Pune. Conquered by United Kingdom and included in the composition of possessions British East India Company in India
info_933: SIKH EMPIRE (AD 1799–1849) State, feudal, monarchical, hindu. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of transformation of Sikh Confederation. The capitals were Gujranwala (1799–1802), Lahore (1802–1849). Conquered by United Kingdom and included in the composition of possessions British East India Company in India
info_934: POSSESSIONS BRITISH EAST INDIA COMPANY (AD 1612–1858) Possession of United Kingdom. Formed in the territory of modern India as a result of conquests United Kingdom India. The capitals were Fort William (1757–1833), Calcutta (1833–1858). Transferred to the British India
info_935: BRITISH INDIA (AD 1858–1947) Possession of United Kingdom. Formed in the territory of modern India as a result, the liquidation of the British East India Company and the transfer of power directly to the United Kingdom. The capitals were Calcutta (1858–1911), Delhi (1911–1947). As a result of the proclamation of independence formed the states of India, Pakistan and Burma
info_936: PAKISTAN (AD 1947–) State, muslim. (Islamic Republic of Pakistan). Originated in the territory of modern Pakistan as a result of secession from British India and proclamation of independence from the United Kingdom (up to 1956 - dominion). The capitals - Karachi (1947–1958), Rawalpindi (1958–1962), Islamabad (from 1962)
info_937: KALIBANGAN (2600–1700 BC) City State Indus Valley civilization, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India. Destroyed by the tribes of the Aryans
info_938: LOTHAL (2600–1700 BC) City State Indus Valley civilization, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India. Destroyed by the tribes of the Aryans
info_939: KURU KINGDOM (1200–800 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the formation of the state of the Indo-Aryan tribe of Kshatriya. Conquered by Panchala Kingdom
info_940: PANCHALA KINGDOM (1100–600 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India. Has fallen into decay
info_941: KOSALA (1100–400 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India. Conquered by Magadha
info_942: VIDEHAS (850–500 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India. Has fallen into decay
info_943: MAGADHA (1200–345 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India. The capital was Rajagriha. Converted to da Empire
info_944: KALINGA (700–260 BC),(220 BC–AD 600) State, slave-owning, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern India. Conquered by Maurya Empire),(Separated from Maurya Empire. Has fallen into decay)
info_945: Nanda EMPIRE (345–322 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the beginning of the reign of the da dynasty in Magadha. The capital was Pataliputra. Converted to Maurya Empire
info_946: CHOLA EMPIRE (300 BC–AD 1279) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the beginning of the reign of the Tamil Chola dynasty. Conquered by Pandya
info_947: PANDYAN EMPIRE (300 BC–AD 1334) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the beginning of the reign of the Pandyan family. The capital was Madurai. Conquered by Madurai Sultanate
info_948: CHERA (300 BC–AD 1102) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the inauguration of the Tamil dynasty of Chera. The capital was Karuvur. Conquered by Chola empire
info_949: SATAVAHANA EMPIRE (230 BC–AD 220) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Maurya Empire The capital was Amaravati. Disintegrated
info_950: SHUNGA EMPIRE (185–75 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the seizure of power in the Maurya Empire by the Shung dynasty. The capitals were Pataliputra, Vidisha. Destroyed as a result of the seizure of power by the Kanva dynasty
info_951: KANVA DYNASTY (75–30 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the seizure of power in Shunga Empire dynasty of Kanva. The capitals were Pataliputra, Vidisha. Conquered by Satavahana Empire
info_952: WESTERN SATRAPS (AD 35–405) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Indo-Scythian Kingdom. The capitals were Ujjain, Barygaza. Conquered by Gupta Empire
info_953: VAKATAKA EMPIRE (AD 250–500) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the collapse of Satavahana Empire. The capital was Vatsagulma. Conquered by Vishnukundina
info_954: PALLAVA EMPIRE (AD 220–880) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the collapse of Satavahana Empire. The capital was Kanchipuram. Conquered by Chola empire
info_955: KADAMBA EMPIRE (AD 345–543) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Pallava Empire. The capital was Banavasi. Conquered by Chalukya Empire
info_956: KAMARUPA KINGDOM (AD 350–1140) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India. Ceased to exist
info_957: VISHNUKUNDINA (AD 420–624) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Wakataki. The capitals were Eluru, Amaravati. Conquered by Eastern Chalukyas
info_958: CHALUKYA EMPIRE (AD 543–753) State, slave-owning, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the conquest of Kadamba by the dynasty of Chalukya. The capital was Badami. Conquered by Rashtrakuta Empire
info_959: HARSHA (AD 606–647) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of conquests the ruler of Kannauj Harsha. The capital was Kannauj. Conquered by Gurjara-Pratihara
info_960: EASTERN CHALUKYAS (AD 624–1189) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the conquest of Vishnukundina by the Chalukya dynasty. The capital was Vengi. Ceased to exist
info_961: GURJARA-PRATIHARA (AD 647–1036) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the collapse of Harsha. The capital was Kannauj. Conquered by Ghaznavid Empire
info_962: PALA EMPIRE (AD 750–1174) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the arrival of the dynasty of Pala in Bengal. Conquered by Sena Empire
info_963: RASHTRAKUTA EMPIRE (AD 753–982) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the conquest of Chalukya by the Rashtrakuta dynasty. The capital was Manyakheta. Conquered by Western Chalukya Empire
info_964: WESTERN CHALUKYA EMPIRE (AD 973–1189) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Rashtrakuta Empire. The capitals were Manyakheta, Basavakalyan. Disintegrated
info_965: HOYSALA EMPIRE (AD 1026–1343) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Western Chalukya Empire. The capital was Halebidu. Conquered by Vijayanagara Empire
info_966: SENA EMPIRE (AD 1070–1230) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Pala Empire. The capital was Nabadwip. Conquered by Deva dynasty
info_967: KAKATIYA EMPIRE (AD 1083–1323) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Eastern Chalukyas and Western Chalukya Empire. The capital was Orugallu. Ceased to exist
info_968: YADAVA DYNASTY (AD 1189–1317) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India after the disintegration of Western Chalukya Empire. The capital was Devagiri. Conquered by Delhi Sultanate
info_969: DEVA DYNASTY (AD 1230–1300) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the change of dynasty in Sena Empire. The capital was Bikrampur. Conquered by Delhi Sultanate
info_970: REDDY DYNASTY (AD 1325–1448) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India after the collapse of Kakatiya Empire. The capital was Addanki. Conquered by Vijayanagara Empire
info_971: VIJAYANAGARA EMPIRE (AD 1336–1646) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the Hindu struggle with Delhi Sultanate. The capital was Vijayanagara. Ceased to exist
info_972: MADURAI SULTANATE (AD 1334–1378) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of the conquest of Pandyan Empire. The capital was Madurai. Conquered by Vijayanagara Empire
info_973: BAHMANI SULTANATE (AD 1347–1527) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Delhi Sultanate. The capitals were Gulbarga (up to 1425), Bidar (from 1425). Disintegrated on Deccan sultanates
info_974: JAUNPUR SULTANATE (AD 1399–1479) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Delhi Sultanate. The capital was Jaunpur. Conquered by Delhi Sultanate
info_975: MALWA SULTANATE (AD 1401–1531),(1537–1542),(1555–1562) State, feudal, monarchical. (Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Delhi Sultanate. Conquered by Gujarat Sultanate), (Separated from Gujarat Sultanate. Conquered by Delhi Sultanate), (Separated from Delhi Sultanate. Conquered by Mughal Empire). The capitals were Dhar, Mandu.
info_976: GUJARAT SULTANATE (AD 1407–1573) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Delhi Sultanate. The capitals were Anhilwad Patan (1407–1411), Ahmedabad (1411–1484, 1535–1573) , Muhammadabad (1484–1535). Conquered by Mughal Empire
info_977: BENGAL SULTANATE (AD 1352–1576) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Delhi Sultanate. The capitals were Lakhnauti and Sonargaon. Conquered by Mughal Empire
info_978: KHANDESH SULTANATE (AD 1399–1601) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Delhi Sultanate. The capitals were Thalner, Asirgarh, Burhanpur. Conquered by Mughal Empire
info_979: BIJAPUR SULTANATE (AD 1490–1686) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Bahmani Sultanate. The capital was Bijapur. Conquered by Mughal Empire
info_980: AHMADNAGAR SULTANATE (AD 1490–1636) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Bahmani Sultanate. The capitals were Ahmadnagar, Paranda, Aurangabad. Conquered by Mughal Empire
info_981: BERAR SULTANATE (AD 1490–1574) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Bahmani Sultanate. The capital was Ellichpur. Conquered by Ahmadnagar Sultanate
info_982: PORTUGUESE INDIA (AD 1505–1961) Possession of Portugal. Formed as a result of the founding of colonies in India by Portugal. The capitals were Cochin, Goa (from 1530). Has become a part of India
info_983: GOLCONDA SULTANATE (AD 1518–1687) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of separation from Bahmani Sultanate. The capitals were Golconda. Conquered by Mughal Empire
info_984: BIDAR SULTANATE (AD 1527–1619) State, feudal, monarchical. Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of transformation of Bahmani Sultanate. The capital was Bidar. Conquered by Bijapur Sultanate
name_985: Possessions of the Dutch East India Company
info_985: POSSESSIONS OF THE DUTCH EAST INDIA COMPANY (AD 1605–1798) Possession of Netherlands. Formed as a result of the founding of colonies in India by the Dutch East India Company. The capital was Cochin. Transmitted to the Netherlands
label_985: Possessions of the Dutch East India Company
info_986: DUTCH INDIA (AD 1798–1825) Possession of Netherlands. Formed as a result of the transfer of the Possessions of the Dutch East India Company in India to the Netherlands. The capital was Cochin. Has become a part of Possessions of British East India Company
info_987: DANISH INDIA (AD 1620–1869) Possession of Denmark. Formed as a result of the founding of colonies in India by the Danish East India Company. The capital was Fort Dansborg. Transmitted to United Kingdom
info_988: FRENCH INDIA (AD 1668–1956) Possession of France. Formed as a result of the founding of colonies in India by the French East India Company. The capital was Pondichéry. Has become a part of India
info_989: INDIA (AD 1947–) State capitalist (Republic of India). Originated in the territory of modern India as a result of secession from British India and the proclamation of independence from the United Kingdom (up to 1950 - the Indian Union). The capital is Delhi
info_990: NICOBAR ISLANDS (Austrian) (AD 1778–1783) Possession of Habsburg Empire. Formed as a result of the transition of the Nicobar Islands from Danish India to Habsburg Empire. Transmitted to Danish India
info_991: SPANISH FLORIDA (AD 1513–1763),(1783–1821) Colony of Spain (from 1535 it was a part of New Spain). (Formed in the territory of the modern US as a result of the discovery of Florida by H. Ponce de Leon and the announcement of its ownership of the Kingdom of Castile and Leon.Sold to Britain and became part of British America), (Returned to Spain.Submitted to the USA). The capital — St. Augustine
info_992: NEW FRANCE (AD 1534–1763) Colony of France. Formed in the territory of the modern Canada as a result of the journey of J. Cartier and the declaration of open lands by the possession of France. Conquered by United Kingdom and became part of British America. The capital - Quebec
info_993: FRENCH FLORIDA (AD 1562–1565) Colony of France. Formed in the territory of the modern USA as a result of the founding of settlements by the French Huguenots. Conquered by Spain and became part of the Spanish Florida. The capital — Fort Caroline
info_994: BRITISH AMERICA (AD 1607–1783) Colony of United Kingdom (to 1707 - England; the official name - British America and the British West Indies). Formed in the territory of the modern USA as a result of the founding of the settlement, Jamestown laid the foundation of the first English colony in North America, Virginia. After gaining independence, USA is transformed into British North America. The capital — London
info_995: NEW SPAIN (AD 1522–1821) Colony of Spain (from 1535 — Viceroyalty). Formed n the territory of the modern Mexico as a result of the campaigns of Er Cortes and the conquest of the empire of the Aztecs and the Maya State. Has ceased to exist as a result of defeat in the War of Independence of Mexico. The capital — Mexico City
info_996: NEWFOUNDLAND (Brit.) (AD 1610–1949) Colony of United Kingdom (from 1907 — dominion; in 1783–1907 in the British North America). Formed in the territory of the modern Canada as a result of the founding of English settlements on the island of Newfoundland. Included in Canada. The capital — St. John's
info_997: NEW NETHERLAND (AD 1614–1664),(1673–1674) Colony of the Netherland. (Formed in the territory of the modern USA as a result of the discovery of the expedition of the Dutch East India Company of Manhattan Island and its inclusion in the United Republic of the United Provinces. Transferred to England),(Recovered from England. Transferred to England). The capital — New Amsterdam (now New York)
info_998: NEW SWEDEN (AD 1638–1655) Colony of Sweden. Formed in the territory of the modern USA Formed in the territory of the modern USA as a result of the allocation of the New Netherlands territories to Swedish settlements. Passed to the New Netherlands. The capital — Fort Christina
info_999: CANADA (AD 1867–) State, capitalist. Formed in the territory of the modern Canada as a result of the adoption of the Constitutional Act and the proclamation of the dominion status in Canada (Brit.). The capital — Ottawa
info_1000: USA (AD 1783–) State, capitalist (United States of America). Formed in the territory of the modern USA as a result of the proclamation of thirteen colonies of independence by Britain (the Declaration of Independence was adopted on July 4, 1776). The capital — Washington
info_1001: FRENCH LOUISIANA (AD 1682-1762), (1800-1803) French colony (as part of New France). (Formed on the territory of USA as a result of the colonization of the region by France. Became part of New Spain), (Returned France. Given to the US). Capitals - Mobil (1702-1720), New Orleans (after 1723)
info_1002: QUEBEC (Brit.) (AD 1763-1791) a British colony (since 1783 as part of the British North America). Formed on the territory of Canada as a result of the transfer of New France territory UK. Divided between Upper Canada and Lower Canada. Capital - Quebec
info_1003: BRITISH NORTH AMERICA (AD 1783-1907) British possession. Formed on the territory of Canada as a result of the transformation of British America. Originally included a colony of Quebec, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Newfoundland, Rupert's Land. Ceased to exist, divided into Canada and Newfoundland. Capital - London
info_1004: UPPER CANADA (Brit.) (AD 1791-1841) a British colony (as a part of British North America). Founded on the territor of Canada as a result of partition of Quebec (Brit). Incorporated in Canada (Brit.). Capitals - Newark (1791-1797), Toronto (1797-1841)
info_1005: LOWER CANADA (Brit.) (AD 1791-1841) a British colony (as a part of British North America). Founded on the territor of Canada as a result of partition of Quebec (Brit). Incorporated in Canada (Brit.). Capital - Quebec
info_1006: CANADA (Brit.) (AD 1841-1867) a British colony (as a part of British North America). Founded on the territory. sovr. Canada's merger of Upper Canada and Lower Canada. Transformed into the Dominion of Canada. Capital - Kingston (1841-1843), Montreal (1843-1849), Toronto (1849-1852, 1859-1866), Quebec (1852-1856, 1859-1866), Ottawa (1866-1867)
info_1007: RUSSIAN AMERICA (AD 1799-1867) Ownership of the Russian Empire. The resulting base of the Russian-American Company of colonies on the territory of present-day Alaska, USA. Capital - Archangel. Sold USA
info_1008: HAWAII (AD 1810-1898) State (until 1984 - the Kingdom of Hawaii, from 1894 - Republic of Hawaii). Formed on the territory of US merger Hawaii King Kamehameha I. Islands became part of the United States (since 1959 - the state). Capital - Laayna (up to 1845), Honolulu (after 1845)
info_1009: MEXICO (AD 1821-) state (up to 1824 - an empire since 1824 - Republic). It was born on the territory of Mexico as a result of the defeat of Spain in the War of Independence of Mexico. Capital - Mexico City
info_1010: TEXAS (AD 1836-1845) State (Republic of Texas). It was born on the territory USA as a result of separation from Mexico. It became part of the United States. Capital - Washington-on-Brazos
info_1011: CONFEDERATE STATES OF AMERICA (AD 1861-1865) unrecognized states. It was born on the territory of USA on USA 13, following the withdrawal of the southern slave states from the United States. It became part of the United States. Capitals - Montgomery (1861), Richmond (1861-1865), Danville (1865)
info_1012: OLMEC CIVILIZATION (1500-500 BC) The first major civilization originated on the territory of Mexico. disappeared
info_1013: ZAPOTEC CIVILIZATION (700 BC - AD 1522) One of the oldest civilizations that arose on the territory of Mexico. Conquered Spain, it was a part of New Spain. Capitals - Monte Albán (700 BC - AD 700), Mitla (AD 700-1400), Zaachila-Yoo (AD 1400-1522)
info_1014: MAYA CIVILIZATION (AD 250–1697) One of the oldest civilizations, formed on the territory of Guatemala to 250 AD, and is a series of independent city-states. Conquered Spain (the last city-state Tayasal conquered in 1697), it became part of New Spain
capital_1015: Cerro de la Estrella, then Tollan
info_1015: TOLTEC STATE (AD 800-1150) State, slave, monarchical. It was born on the territory Mexico invasion from the north of the Toltec tribe. Capitals - Cerro de la Estrella, then Tollan (Tula modern). Destroyed by the invasion of other tribes
info_1016: AZTEC EMPIRE (AD 1325-1522) State, slave, monarchical. It was born on the territory of Mexico, through the merger of the Aztec tribes. The capital - Tenochtitlan. It conquered Spain in 1521, became part of New Spain
info_1017: MOSQUITO KINGDOM (Brit.) (AD 1638–1787) State under British protectorate. Formed on the territory of Nicaragua as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over the Miskito Indians. Capital — Sandy Bay. Became a part of New Spain
info_1018: PERU (Sp.) (AD 1533-1824) A colony of Spain (from 1535 - Vice-Kingdom). Formed on the territory оf Peru as a result of campaigns F. Pissaro and conquest of the Inca Empire. Ceased to exist defeat in the War of Independence. Capitals - Kusko, Lima
info_1019: NEW GRANADA (Sp.) (AD 1717-1723),(1739-1819) Colony of Spain (Viceroyalty). (Formed on the territory of modern Colombia as a result of separation from Peru (Sp.). Joined Peru (Sp.)),(Recreated. It ceased to exist as a result of defeat in the War of Independence of the Spanish colonies and the declaration of independence of Great Colombia). Capital - Bogota
info_1020: BRAZIL (AD 1822–) State, capitalistic, republic (Federative Republic of Brazil; before 1889 - Brazilian Empire, 1889–1967 - United States of Brazil). Formed on the territory. modern Brazil as a result of the liquidation of the United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarve and the proclamation of Brazilian independence. Capital - Brasilia (from 1960), Rio de Janeiro (until 1960)
info_1021: GRAN COLOMBIA (AD 1819-1831) State Republic. It was born on the territory of Colombia, as a result of the defeat of Spain in the War of Independence and the independence of New Granada. It was divided into three states: New Granada, Venezuela and Ecuador. Capital - Bogota
info_1022: BRITISH HONDURAS (AD 1840-1981) Ownership of the UK (since 1862 - a crown colony). It was born on the territory of Belize as a result of the transition of the English settlements under the authority of the United Kingdom and separation from Guatemala. Capitals - Belize (until 1971), Belmopan (1971). September 21, 1981 proclaimed independent state Belize
info_1023: NEW GRANADA (AD 1831-1863) State Republic (until 1858 the Republic of New Granada, Granada Confederation from 1858). It was born on the territory of Colombia, as a result of the collapse of Gran Colombia. Converted to Colombia. Capital - Bogota
info_1024: FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF CENTRAL AMERICA (AD 1823-1840) State, Federal Republic. It was born on the territory of Belize, Guatemala, Honduras, Costa Rica, Nicaragua, El Salvador as a result of separation from Mexico. Collapsed. Capital - Guatemala (1823-1834), San Salvador (1834-1840)
info_1025: HONDURAS (AD 1838-) A state capitalist, republic (Republic of Honduras). Formed on the territory of Honduras, following the withdrawal of the Federal Republic of Central America. Capital - Tegucigalpa
info_1026: COSTA RICA (AD 1838-) A state capitalist, republic (Republic of Costa Rica). Formed on the territory of Costa Rica, following the withdrawal of the Federal Republic of Central America. Capital - San José
info_1027: NICARAGUA (AD 1838-) A state capitalist, republic (Republic of Nicaragua). Formed on the territory of Nicaragua, following the withdrawal of the Federal Republic of Central America. Capital - Managua
info_1028: GUATEMALA (AD 1840-) A state capitalist, republic (Republic of Guatemala). Formed on the territory of Nicaragua, following the withdrawal of the Federal Republic of Central America. Capital - Guatemala
info_1029: SALVADOR (AD 1840-) A state capitalist, republic (Republic of El Salvador). Formed on the territory of Nicaragua, following the withdrawal of the Federal Republic of Central America. Capital - San Salvador
info_1031: COLOMBIA (AD 1863-) A state capitalist, republic (Republic of Colombia, in 1886 the United States of Colombia). Formed on the territory of Colombia,as a result of the conversion of New Granada. Capital - Bogota
info_1032: PANAMA (AD 1903-) A state capitalist, republic (Republic of Panama). Formed on the territory of Panama as a result of separation from Colombia. Capital - Panama
info_1033: BELIZE (AD 1981-) A state capitalist, republic (Republic of Belize). Formed on the territory of Belize as a result of the proclamation of independence from Britain British Honduras. Capital - Belmopan
info_1034: PANAMA CANAL ZONE (USA) (AD 1903-1979) Possession of the United States. Founded on the territoryof Panama as a result of the transition area around the Panama Canal under the control of the United States. Attached to Panama. Capital - Balboa
info_1035: TIWANAKU (AD 300-1000) State, slave, monarchical. It was born on the territory of Bolivia. Capital - Tiwanaku. Destroyed
info_1036: WARI (AD 500-1000) State, slave, monarchical. It was born on the territory of Bolivia. Capital - Wari. Destroyed
info_1037: INCA EMPIRE (AD 1438-1533) State, slave, monarchical. It was born on the territory of Peru, through the Kuzko conquest of the nabour lands. The capital - Kuzko. It conquered Spain in 1533, became part of Peru (Sp.)
info_1050: AUSTRALIA (AD 1901–) Capitalist State (Commonwealth of Australia). Formed on the territory of modern Australia as a result of the unification of the British colonies and the creation of a dominion of the Commonwealth of Australia independent of Great Britain. Capital - Canberra
info_1051: NEW ZEALAND (AD 1907–) Capitalist state. Formed on the territory of modern New Zealand as a result of the declaration of independence from Great Britain and obtaining the status of dominion. Capital - Wellington
info_1052: PRC (PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA) (AD 1949–) State, socialist republic. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the victory in the civil war over the army of the Republic of China and the proclamation of the People's Republic of China on the territory of mainland China (Republic of China relocated to Taiwan, which is now a partially recognized state). Capital - Beijing
info_1053: HONG KONG (Brit.) (AD 1841-1941),(1945-1997) Possession of Great Britain. (Formed on the territory of of modern PRC as a result of Britain's secession of Hong Kong Island from the Chinese Qing Empire. Occupied by Japan),(Returned to Great Britain. Attached to PRC). Capital - Victoria.
info_1054: MACAO (port) (AD 1557-1999) Possession of Portugal. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the lease of Macau from the Chinese Ming Empire. Attached to PRC). Capital - Macau.
info_1055: TIBET (AD 1912-1951) State, theocratic, headed by the Dalai Lama. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the collapse of the Chinese Qing Empire. Attached to the PRC. Capital - Lhasa
info_1056: TAIWAN (Jap.) (AD 1895-1945) Possession of Japan (General Government). Formed on the territory of modern Republic of China as a result of the transfer of the island of Taiwan by the Qing Empire to Japan after the defeat in the Sino-Japanese War. Transferred to Republic of China after Japan's defeat in World War II. Capital - Taipei.
info_1057: RYUKYU (AD 1429-1879) State, feudal, monarchical (Ryukyu Korodevstvo). Formed on the territory of modern Japan on the Ryukyu Islands as a result of the unification of separate principalities. Attached to Japan. Capital - Shuri
info_1058: MONGOLIA (AD 1911–1919),(1921–) State, republic. (Formed on the territory of modern. Mongolia (monarchical State of Mongolia) as a result of separation from the Chinese Qing Empire. Occupied by Republic of China),(Separated from the Republic of China). In 1924-1992 - Mongolian People's Republic. Capital - Ulan Bator (until 1924 it was called Urga)
capital_1058: Ulan Bator (until 1924 it was called Urga)
info_1060: PERU (AD 1824–1836),(1839–) State, capitalistic, republic (Republic of Peru). (It was born on the territory of modern Peru as a result of the defeat of Spain in the War of Independence and the proclamation of independence in Peru (Sp.)),(It became a member of the Confederation of Peru and Bolivia. It seceded from the Confederation of Peru and Bolivia). Capital - Lima
info_1068: INDONESIA (AD 1949–) State, capitalistic, republic (Republic of Indonesia). Formed on the territory of modern Indonesia as a result of withdrawal from the declaration of independence from the Netherlands in the Dutch East Indies (proclaimed in 1945, recognized by the Netherlands in 1949). Capital - Jakarta
name_1076: Soviet Zone Of The Occupation Of Korea
label_1076: Soviet Zone Of The Occupation Of Korea
info_1076: SOVIET ZONE OF THE OCCUPATION OF KOREA (AD 1945-1948) Formed on the territory of modern DPRK. Part of Korean territory occupied by the USSR as a result of Japan's defeat in World War II. The Democratic People's Republic of Korea was proclaimed on the territory of the zone. The headquarters of the occupation forces is Pyongyang.
name_1077: American Zone Of The Occupation Of Korea
label_1077: American Zone Of The Occupation Of Korea
info_1077: AMERICAN ZONE OF THE OCCUPATION OF KOREA (AD 1945-1949) Formed on the territory of modern Republic of Korea. Part of Korean territory occupied by the United States as a result of Japan's defeat in World War II. The Republic of Korea was proclaimed on the territory of the zone. The headquarters of the occupation forces is Seoul.
info_1078: KOREA (Jap.) (AD 1910-1945) Possession of Japan (General Government). Formed on the territory of modern North Korea and the Republic of Korea as a result of the annexation of the Korean Empire by Japan. As a result of Japan's defeat in World War II, the USSR and the USA were occupied. Capital - Seoul
info_1079: DPRK (KOREAN PEOPLE'S DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC) (AD 1948–) State, socialist republic. Formed on the territory of modern North Korea as a result of the proclamation of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on the territory of the Soviet zone of occupation of Korea. Capital - Pyongyang
info_1080: REPUBLIC OF KOREA (AD 1948–) State, capitalist, republic. Formed on the territory of modern Republic of Korea as a result of the proclamation of the Republic of Korea within the American Occupation Zone of Korea. Capital - Seoul
info_1082: PHILIPPINES (AD 1946–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of the Philippines). Formed on the territory of modern Philippines as a result of the declaration of independence from the United States. Capital - Manila
info_1085: SAINT. LUCIA (Brit.) (AD 1803-1838),(1962-1979) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Saint Lucia as a result of the British conquest of the French colony Saint Lucia (Fr.). Joined the British Windward Isles colony),(Separated from the West Indies Federation (Brit.). The independent state of Saint Lucia is proclaimed). Capital - Castries
info_1086: SRI LANKA (AD 1972–) State, republic (Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka). Formed on the territory of modern Sri Lanka as a result of the renaming of Ceylon. Capitals - Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte (from 1982; to 1982 - Colombo)
info_1088: CEYLON (Brit.) (AD 1796-1948) Possession of Great Britain. Formed on the territory. modern Sri Lanka as a result of the British conquest of Ceylon (Dutch). Independence from Great Britain is proclaimed and the dominion of Ceylon is formed. Capital - Colombo
info_1089: MALDIVES (AD 1965–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Maldives). Formed on the territory of modern Maldives as a result of the proclamation of the Maldives' independence from Great Britain. Capital - Male
info_1090: MALDIV ISLANDS (Brit.) (AD 1887-1965) British possession, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Maldives as a result of the British conquest of the Maldiv islands. Independence from Great Britain is proclaimed and the Republic of Maldives is formed. Capital - Male
info_1091: BANGLADESH (AD 1971–) State, capitalist, republic (People's Republic of Bangladesh). Formed on the territory of modern Bangladesh as a result of separation from Pakistan. Capital - Dhaka
info_1092: BRITISH INDIAN OCEAN TERRITORY (AD 1965–) British possession (overseas territory). Formed on the territory. modern British Indian Ocean Territory as a result of the separation, in fact, of the British occupation of the islands from Mauritius (Chagos archipelago) and Seychelles (Aldabra, Farquhar and Desroches islands) into a separate overseas territory; the only residents are British and American military personnel. Capital - Diego Garcia.
info_1093: MAURITIUS (AD 1968–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Mauritius). Formed on the territory of modern Mauritius as a result of Mauritius (Brit.) proclamation of independence from Great Britain. Capital - Port Louis
info_1094: MAURITIUS (Brit.) (AD 1887-1968) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Mauritius as a result of the British conquest of the French colony Ile-de-France. Independence from Great Britain was proclaimed and the Republic of Mauritius was formed. Capital - Port Louis
info_1095: SEYCHELLES (AD 1976–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Seychelles). Formed on the territory of modern Seychelles as a result of the proclamation of Seychelles (Brit.) independence from Great Britain. Capital - Victoria
info_1096: SEYCHELLES (Brit.) (AD 1903-1976) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Seychelles as a result of separation from Mauritius (Brit.). Independence from Great Britain was proclaimed and the Republic of Seychelles was formed. Capital - Victoria
info_1097: NEPAL (AD 1768–) State, republic (Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal). Formed on the territory of modern Nepal as a result of the unification of several dozen small principalities; in 1768-2008 - the monarchy (Kingdom of Nepal): in 1816-1923 - actually under the protectorate of Great Britain. Capital - Kathmandu
info_1098: BUTAN (AD 1907–) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Bhutan). Formed on the territory of modern Bhutan as a result of the unification of the country by the Wangchuk Dynasty; in 1907-1947 - actually under the protectorate of Great Britain, 1947-1971 - India. Capitals - Thimphu (from 1955), Punakha (until 1955)
info_1099: MYANMAR (AD 1989–) State, republic (Republic of the Union of Myanmar). Formed on the territory of modern Myanmar as a result of the renaming of Burma. Capitals - Naypyidaw (from 2005; to 2005 - Yangon)
info_1100: BIRMA (AD 1948-1989) State, republic (Socialist Republic of the Union of Burma; until 1962 - Union of Burma). Formed on the territory of modern Myanmar as a result of the declaration of independence from Great Britain in Burma (Brit). Renamed to Myanmar. Capital - Rangoon (since 1989 it became known as Yangon)
capital_1100: Rangoon (since 1989 it became known as Yangon)
info_1101: BIRMA (Brit.) (AD 1937-1942),(1945-1948) Possession of Great Britain. (Formed on the territory of modern Myanmar as a result of separation from British India. Occupied by Japan),(Liberated from occupation. Independence from Great Britain was proclaimed and an independent state of the Union of Burma was formed). The capital is Rangoon.
info_1102: SIAM (AD 1782-1939) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Siam or Kingdom of Rattanakosin). Formed on the territory of modern Thailand as a result of the coup in the Kingdom of Thonburi and the accession of the Chakri dynasty. Renamed Kingdom of Thailand. Capital - Bangkok
info_1103: THAILAND (AD 1939–) State, monarchy (Thailand). Formed on the territory of modern Thailand as a result of the renaming of the Kingdom of Siam to the Kingdom of Thailand. Capital - Bangkok
info_1104: CAMBODIA (AD 1953-1975),(1989-) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Cambodia, in 1970-1975 - the Khmer Republic; in 1989-1993 - the State of Cambodia). Formed on the territory of modern Cambodia as a result of the declaration of independence from France in French Indochina. Renamed to Kampuchea),(Name of Cambodia restored). Capital - Phnom Penh
info_1105: CAMPUCHIA (AD 1975-1989) State, republic (People's Republic of Kmpuchea, in 1975-1979 - Democratic Kampuchea). Formed on the territory of modern Cambodia as a result of the overthrow of the monarchy and the renaming of Cambodia to Kampuchea. The name Cambodia was restored. Capital - Phnom Penh
info_1106: FRENCH INDOCHINA (AD 1887–1940),(1945–1954) Possession of French (Indochina Union). (Formed on the territory of modern Vietnam and Cambodia as a result of the unification of the French protectorates of Annam, Cambodia and the Cochin Khin colony; in 1889 - Laos (Fr.) was included, in 1898 - Guangzhouwan (Fr.). Occupied by Japan),(Liberated from occupation. Independence from France was proclaimed and the independent states of Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam were formed). Capital - Hanoi.
info_1107: CAMBODIA (Fr.) (AD 1863-1887) Possession of France, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Cambodia as a result of the establishment of a French protectorate over the Kingdom of Cambodia (under the rule of Siam). It became part of French Indochina. Capital - Phnom Penh
info_1108: LAOS (AD 1953–) State, republic (Lao People's Democratic Republic, until 1975 - monarchy, Kingdom of Laos). Formed on the territory of modern Laos as a result of the declaration of independence from France in French Indochina. Capital - Vientiane
info_1109: STATE OF VIETNAM (AD 1954-1955) State. Formed on the territory of modern Vietnam as a result of the declaration of independence from France in French Indochina. Divided into DRV and South Vietnam. Capital - Saigon
info_1110: DRV (DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM) (AD 1955-1976) State, republic. Formed on the territory of modern Vietnam as a result of the partition of the State of Vietnam. It united with South Vietnam, as a result, the SRV (Socialist Republic of Vietnam) was proclaimed. Capital - Hanoi
info_1111: SOUTH VIETNAM (REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM) (AD 1955-1976) State, republic. Formed on the territory of modern Vietnam as a result of the partition of the State of Vietnam. It merged with the DRV, as a result, the SRV (Socialist Republic of Vietnam) was proclaimed, the capital - Saigon
info_1112: VIETNAM (SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM) (AD 1976–) State, republic. Formed on the territory of modern Vietnam as a result of the unification of the DRV and South Vietnam. Capital - Hanoi
info_1113: KOKHINKHINA (Fr.) (AD 1867-1887) Possession of France. Formed on the territory of modern Vietnamese as a result of the conquest of the state of Dainam by France. It became part of French Indochina. Capital - Saigon
info_1114: ANNAM (Fr.) (AD 1884-1887) Possession of France, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Vietnam as a result of France's establishment of a protectorate over the Vietnamese Nguyen dynasty. It became part of French Indochina. Capital - Hue
info_1115: TONKIN (Fr.) (AD 1884-1887) Possession of France, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Vietnam as a result of France's establishment of a protectorate over the Vietnamese Nguyen dynasty. It became part of French Indochina. Capital - Hanoi
info_1116: MALAYSIA (AD 1963–) State, federal monarchy (State of Malaysia). Formed on the territory of modern Malaysia as a result of the unification of the Federation of Malay, Singapore, Sarawak and North Borneo. Capital - Kuala Lumpur
info_1117: MALAY FEDERATION (AD 1957-1963) State, federal monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern Malaysia. as a result of the declaration of independence from Great Britain by the Malay Federation (UK). Merged with Singapore, Sarawak and North Borneo. Capital - Kuala Lumpur
info_1118: MALAY FEDERATION (Brit.) (AD 1948-1957) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Malaysia as a result of the transformation of the Malay Union (UK) into the Federation of Malay (UK). Independence from Great Britain was proclaimed and the independent state of the Malay Federation was formed. Capital - Kuala Lumpur
info_1119: UNION OF MALAYS (Brit.) (AD 1946-1948) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Malaysia as a result of the unification of the British protectorate the Federated Malay States, the unfederated Malay states (UK) and the Colony of Straits Settlements (Brit.), which were under the control of the British Military Administration (Malaya). Converted to Federation of Malay (Brit.). Capital - Kuala Lumpur
info_1120: SARAVAK (Brit.) (AD 1888-1941),(1945-1946),(1946-1963) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate (since 1946 - crown colony). (Formed on the territory of modernMalaysia as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over the Brunei Empire. Occupied by Japan),(Liberated from occupation and transferred under the control of the British military administration (Borneo)),(The colony of Sarawak (Brit.) was formed. After the declaration of independence from Great Britain became part of Malaysia). Capital - Kuching
info_1121: NORTH BORNEO (Brit.) (AD1888–1941),(1945–1946),(1946–1963) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate (since 1946 - crown colony). (It was formed on the territory of modern Malaysia as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over North Borneo (part of the Brunei Empire). Occupied by Japan),(Liberated from occupation and transferred under the control of the British military administration (Borneo)),(The colony of North Borneo was formed (Brit. After the declaration of independence from Great Britain became part of Malaysia).). Capital - Kudat (1881-1884), Sandakan (1884-1945), Jesselton (from 1946)
info_1122: LABOIN (Brit.) (AD 1848-1941) Possession of Great Britain, crown colony. Formed on the territory. modern Malaysia as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over the skeleton of Labuan (part of the Brunei Empire). Occupied by Japan, after liberation, it passed under the control of the British Military Administration (Borneo), then became part of North Borneo (Brit.). Capital - Victoria
info_1123: BRITISH MILITARY ADMINISTRATION (Malaya) (AD 1945-1946) Possession of Great Britain. Formed on the territory. modern Malaysia as a result of the liberation of the British Malay protectorates and colonies from Japanese occupation. Converted to Union of Malay (UK). Capital - Kuala Lumpur
info_1124: BRITISH MILITARY ADMINISTRATION (Borneo) (AD 1945-1946) Possession of Great Britain. Formed on the territory of modern Malaysia as a result of the liberation of Sarawak (Brit.), North Borneo (UK) and Labuan (UK) from Japanese occupation. The colonies of Sarawak (UK) and North Borneo (Brit.) were formed. Capital - Victoria
info_1125: SINGAPORE (AD 1965–) State, republic (Republic of Singapore). Formed on the territory of modern Singapore as a result of separation from Malaysia. Capital - Singapore
info_1126: SINGAPORE (Brit.) (AD 1819-1826) Possession of Great Britain. Formed on the territory of modern Singapore as a result of the purchase of the island from the local owner. It became part of the British colony Straits Settlements. Capital - Singapore
info_1127: STRATES SETLEMENTS (Brit.) (AD 1826-1941) Possession of Great Britain, colony. (Formed on the territory of modern Malaysia and Singapore as a result of the unification of British possessions in Malaya. Occupied by Japan, after liberation passed under the control of the British Military Administration (Malaya), then became part of the Malay Union. Capital - Singapore
info_1128: BRUNEI (AD 1984–) State, monarchy (State of Brunei Darussalam). Formed on the territory of modern Brunei. as a result of the declaration of independence from Great Britain Brunei (brit.). Capital - Bandar Seri Begawan
info_1129: BRUNEI (Brit.) (AD 1888-1941),(1945-1946),(1946-1984) (Possession of Great Britain, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Brunei as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over the Brunei Empire. Occupied by Japan),( Released from occupation and transferred under the control of the British Military Administration (Borneo)),(Restored the protectorate of Brunei (Brit.). Declared independence from Great Britain). Capital - Bandar Seri Begawan (until 1970 - it was called Brunei)
info_1130: NEW GUINEA (Neth.) (AD 1949-1962) Colony of the Netherlands. (Formed on the territory of modern. Indonesia as a result of separation from the Dutch East Indies. Joined Indonesia. Сapital - Hollandia.
info_1131: EASTERN TIMOR (AD 1975–1976),(1976–1999),(2002–) State, republic (Democratic Republic of East Timor). (Formed on the territory of modern. East Timor as a result of the declaration of independence from Portugal. Occupied by Indonesia),(Liberated from occupation. Transferred under the protectorate of the UN Interim Administration in East Timor),(Restored independence). Capital - Dili
info_1132: TIMOR (Port.) (AD 1702–1942),(1945–1975) Possession of Portugal. (Formed on the territory of modern East Timor as a result of the Portuguese conquest of the eastern part of the island of Timor. Occupied by Japan}, { Released from occupation. Independence from Portugal is proclaimed and the Democratic Republic of East Timor is formed). Capital - Dili
info_1133: EASTERN TIMOR (UN Protectorate) (AD 1999-2002) UN Protectorate under the control of the UN Transitional Administration in East Timor Formed on the territory of modern East Timor as a result of the liberation of East Timor from the occupation of Indonesia and transferring it under the control of the UN Interim Administration. The independence of the Democratic Republic of East Timor was restored. Capital - Dili
info_1134: PHILIPPINES (USA) (AD 1898-1941),(1945-1946) Possession of the USA. (Formed on the territory of the present-day Philippines as a result of the transfer of the Philippines (Spanish) to the USA. Occupied by Japan),(Liberated from occupation. The independent state of the Philippine Republic is proclaimed). Capital - Manila.
info_1135: COCONUT (KEALING) ISLANDS (Austr.) (AD 1955–) Possession (Outer Territory) of Australia. Formed on the territory of modern Cocos (Keeling) Islands (Austr.) as a result of the transfer of the islands by Great Britain to Australia. Capital - West Island
info_1136: COCONUT (KEALING) ISLANDS (Brit.) (AD 1857-1955) Possession of Great Britain. Formed on the territory of modern Cocos (Keeling) Islands (Austr.) as a result of the annexation of the islands by Great Britain. Transferred to Australia. Capital - West Island
info_1137: CHRISTMAS ISLAND (Austr.) (AD 1958–) Possession (Outer Territory) of Australia. Formed on the territory of modern Christmas Island (Austr.) as a result of the transfer of the island by Great Britain to Australia. Capital - Flying Fish Cove
info_1138: CHRISTMAS ISLAND (Brit.) (AD 1888-1958) Possession of Great Britain. Formed on the territory of modern Christmas Island (Austr.) as a result of the annexation of the island by Great Britain. Transferred to Australia. Capital - Flying Fish Cove
info_1139: NEW ZEALAND (Brit. (AD 1841-1907) Possession of Great Britain (colony). Formed on the territory of modern New Zealand as a result of separation from the colony of New South Wales (British). Independence was proclaimed and dominion status granted. Capitals - Old Rassal (1841), Auckland (1841-1865), Wellington (from 1865)
info_1140: NORFOLK ISLAND (Australian) (AD 1914–) Possession (Outer Territory) of Australia. Formed on the territory of modern Norfolk Islands (Austr.) as a result of separation from the colony of Tasmania (Brit.). Transferred to Australia. Capital - Kingston
info_1141: NORFOLK ISLAND (Brit.) (AD 1788-1914) Possession of Great Britain. Formed on the territory of modern Norfolk Island (Austr.) as a result of the annexation of the island by Great Britain. Transferred to Australia. Capital - Kingston
info_1142: CEYLON (AD 1948-1972) State, dominion of Great Britain. Formed on the territory of modern Sri Lanka as a result of the declaration of independence from Great Britain in Ceylon (brit.). Converted to Republic and renamed Sri Lanka. Capital - Colombo
info_1143: VANUATU (AD 1980–) State, republic (Republic of Vanuatu). Formed on the territory of modern Vanuatu as a result of the declaration of independence in the condominium of Great Britain and France and the New Hebrides (Fr., Brit.) and the formation of the Republic of Vanuatu. Capital - Port Vila
info_1144: NEW HEBRIDES (Fr., Brit) (AD 1906-1980) Joint possession of France and Great Britain, condominium. Formed on the territory of modern Vanuatu as a result of the transformation of the disputed territory, under the control of the joint Anglo-French interim naval administration, into the New Hebrides (Fr., Brit.) condominium. The independent Republic of Vanuatu is proclaimed. Capital - Port Vila
info_1145: NEW CALEDONIA (Fr.) (AD 1853–) Possession of France (overseas department). Formed on the territory of modern New Caledonia (Fr.) as a result of the annexation of the island of New Caledonia by France. Capital - Noumea
info_1146: PAPUA - NEW GUINEA (AD 1975–) State, capitalist (Independent State of Papua New Guinea). Formed on the territory of modern Papua New Guinea as a result of the declaration of independence from Australia in the UN Trust Territory Papua New Guinea (Austral.). Capital - Port Moresby
info_1147: PAPUA - NEW GUINEA (Austral.) (AD 1919-1949) Possession of Australia (Trust Territory of the United Nations Territory of Papua New Guinea). Formed on the territory of modern Papua New Guinea as a result of the unification of the Austral. colony of Papua (Austral.) and the Mandatory Territory of New Guinea (Austral.). Capital - Port Moresby
info_1148: PAPUA (Austral.) (AD 1902-1949) Possession of Australia, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Papua New Guinea as a result of the transfer of the colony of New Guinea (Britain) under the control of Australia. As a result of the unification with the Mandatory Territory of New Guinea (Australia), the Trust Territory of the United Nations Papua New Guinea (Australia) was formed. Capital - Port Moresby
info_1149: NEW GUINEA (Austral.) (AD 1914-1949) Possession of Australia, Mandatory Territory. Formed on the territory of modern Papua New Guinea as a result of the transfer of the colony of German New Guinea under the mandate administration of Australia and Japan. As a result of the merger with the Austral. colony of Papua (Austral.), the Trust Territory of the United Nations Papua New Guinea (Austral.) was formed. Capital - Rabaul (1921-1937), Lae (1937-1942), Wow (1942-1949)
info_1150: PAPUA (Brit.) (AD 1883-1902) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Papua New Guinea as a result of the annexation of the territory by Great Britain. Transferred under the control of Australia .. Capital - Port Moresby
info_1151: GERMAN NEW GUINEA (AD 1885-1914),(1919-1919) Possession of Germany, colony. (Formed on the territory of modern Papua New Guinea, Marshall Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, Northern Mariana Islands (USA), Palau, Nauru as a result of the annexation of the northeast of New Guinea and other islands by Germany),(Occupirwana by Australia (northeast of New Guinea Island, Nauru Island) and Japan (the rest of the islands). The occupation regime was terminated, transferred under the mandate control of Australia (New Guinea) and Japan (South Pacific Mandate). Capital - Finshafen (1885-1891), Friedrich-Wilhelm-Hafen (1891-1899), Herbertshohe (1899-1910), Rabaul (1910-1919)
info_1152: SOLOMON ISLANDS (AD 1978–) Capitalist state. Formed on the territory of modern Solomon Islands as a result of the independence of the Solomon Islands (Brit.). Capital - Honiara
info_1153: SOLOMON ISLANDS (British) (AD 1893-1942),(1943-1978) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate. (Formed on the territory of the present-day Solomon Islands as a result of the annexation of the southern and central parts of the Solomon Islands by Great Britain. Occupied by Japan),(Liberated from occupation. The independent state of Solomon Islands was proclaimed). Capital - Tulagi (until 1952), Honiara
info_1154: FIJI (AD 1970–) State, capitalistic, republic (Republic of Fiji), until 1987 - dominion. Formed on the territory of modern Fiji as a result of Fiji's declaration of independence (UK). Capital - Suva
info_1155: FIJI (Brit.) (AD 1874-1970) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Fiji as a result of the annexation of the Kingdom of Fiji. Independence from Great Britain is proclaimed. Capital - Levuka (1874-1877), Suva (1877-1970)
info_1156: KINGDOM OF FIJI (AD 1871-1874) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern Fiji as a result of the unification of small states that existed in the Fiji archipelago. Annexed by Great Britain with the establishment of the colony of Fiji (Brit.). Capital - Levuka
info_1157: GUAM (USA) (AD 1898–1941),(1944–) Possession of the USA (Territory of Guam). (Formed on the territory of modern Guam (USA) as a result of the transfer of the island of Guam (Spanish) to the USA. Occupied by Japan),(Liberated from occupation. Returned to the USA). Capital - Hagatna.
info_1158: GUAM (USA) (AD 1668-1898) Possession of Spain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Guam (USA) as a result of the declaration of the island as a Spanish colony. Transferred to the USA
info_1159: KIRIBATI (AD 1979–) State, capitalistic, republic (Republic of Kiribati). Formed on the territory of modern Kiribati as a result of the proclamation of independence in the possessions of Great Britain Gilbert Islands (Brit.) and Canton and Enderbury Islands (Brit.). Capital - South Tarawa
info_1160: GILBERT ISLANDS (Brit.) (AD 1976-1979) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Kiribati as a result of the division of the colony of Gilbert and Ellis Islands (Brit.) into Gilbert Islands (Brit.) and Tuvalu (Brit.). Independence from Great Britain was proclaimed and the Republic of Kiribati was created. Capital - South Tarawa
info_1161: GILBERT AND ELLIS ISLANDS (Brit.) (AD 1892-1941),(1943-1975) Possession of Great Britain, colony. (Formed on the territory of modern Kiribati as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over the Gilbert and Ellis Islands. Occupied by Japan),(Liberated from occupation. Divided into the colonies of Gilbert Island (Brit.) and Tuvalu (Brit.). Capital - Tarawa.
info_1162: CANTON AND ENDERBERRY ISLANDS (Brit., USA) (AD 1939-1979) Joint possession of Great Britain and the USA, condominium. Formed on the territory of modern Kiribati as a result of separation from the colony of Gilbert and Ellis Islands (Brit). After the proclamation of independence, Kiribati became a part of it. Capital - Tebaronga
info_1163: TUVALU (AD 1978–) State, capitalistic. Formed on the territory of modern Tuvalu as a result of the declaration of independence in the British colony Tuvalu (British). Capital - Funafuti
info_1164: TUVALU (Brit.) (AD 1976-1978) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory. modern Tuvalu as a result of the division of the colony of Gilbert and Ellis Islands (Brit.) into Gilbert Islands (Brit.) and Tuvalu (Brit.). Independence from Great Britain was proclaimed and the state of Tuvalu was created. Capital - Funafuti
info_1165: MARSHALL ISLANDS (AD 1986–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of the Marshall Islands). Formed on the territory of modern Marshall Islands as a result of the withdrawal from the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands (USA) and the declaration of independence. Capital - Majuro
info_1166: PACIFIC ISLANDS (US Trusteeship) (AD 1947-1994) US Trust Territory. Formed on the territory of modern Marshall Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, Northern Mariana Islands (USA) and Palau as a result of the transfer of the South Pacific Mandate (Jap.) to US control. Capital - Saipan
info_1167: SOUTH SEAS MANDATE (Jap.) (AD 1919-1947) Mandatory territory under Japanese rule. Formed on the territory of modern Marshall Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, Northern Mariana Islands (USA) and Palau as a result of the secession from German New Guinea and the transfer of the islands to Japanese control (formally in 1919). Capital - Koror
info_1168: FEDERATED STATES OF MICRONESIA (AD 1986–) State, capitalist, republic. Formed on the territory of modern Federated States of Micronesia as a result of the withdrawal from the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands (USA) and the proclamation of independence. Capital - Palikir
info_1169: NORTHERN MARIAN ISLANDS (USA) (AD 1986–) United States unincorporated organized territory (Commonwealth Northern Mariana Islands). Formed on the territory. modern Guyana as a result of the founding of the Dutch West India Company settlement on the banks of the Pomeroon River. Destroyed by France, the territory became part of Essequibo (Dutch). Capital - New Middelburg
info_1040: ESSEQUIBO (Dutch) (AD 1616–1814) The colony of the Netherlands. Formed on the territory of Guyana as a result of the base by the river settlement Essequibo Dutch West India Company. Transferred to Great Britain Capitals - Fort Kyk-Over-Al (1616–1739), Fort Zeelandia (1739–1814)
info_1041: BERBICE (Dutch) (AD 1627–1814) The colony of the Netherlands. Formed on the territory of Guyana as a result of the base by the river settlement Berbice Dutch West India Company. Transferred to Great Britain. Capitals - Fort Nassau (1627–1785) Fort Sint Andries (1785–1814)
info_1265: DEMERARA-ESSEKIBO (Brit.) (AD 1814-1831) Colony of Great Britain. Formed on the territory of modern Guyana as a result of the transfer of the colonies of Essequibo (Dutch) and Demerara (Dutch) To Great Britain and their unification. Merged with Berbys (Brit.) To form the colony of Guiana (Brit.)
info_1266: BERBIS (Brit.) (AD 1814-1831) Colony of Great Britain. Formed on the territory of modern Guyana as a result of the transfer of the colony of Berbice (Dutch) To Great Britain. Merged with Demerara-Essequibo (Brit.), forming the colony of Guiana (Brit.)
info_1267: DEMERARA (Dutch) (AD 1745-1814) Colony of the Netherlands. Formed on the territory. modern Guyana as a result of separation from the colony of Essequibo (Dutch). Transferred to Great Britain. Capital - Stabruk
info_1043: SURINAME (Brit.) (AD 1652-1668) a British colony. Founded on the territory of Suriname, as a result of British colonization. Transmitted by the Netherlands in exchange for New Amsterdam (now New York)
info_1075: ARGENTINA (AD 1861–) State, capitalistic, republic (Argentine Republic). Formed on the territory of modern Argentina as a result of the renaming of the Argentine Confederation to Argentina. Capital - Buenos Aires
name_1268: United Provinces of Rio de la Plata
label_1268: United Provinces of Rio de la Plata
info_1268: UNITED PROVINCES OF RIO DE LA PLATA (AD 1810-1816) State. It was formed on the territory of modern Argentina as a result of the declaration of independence from Spain in the Rio de la Plata (Sp.). Renamed United Provinces of South America. Capital - Buenos Aires
info_1269: UNITED PROVINCES OF SOUTH AMERICA (AD 1816-1831) State. It was formed as a result of the renaming of the United Provinces of Rio de la Plata into the United Provinces of South America. Capital - Buenos Aires
info_1270: ARGENTINE CONFEDERATION (AD 1831-1861) State. It was formed as a result of renaming the United Provinces of South America into the Argentine Confederation. Capital - Buenos Aires (1831-1853), Parana (1853-1861)
info_1067: URUGUAY (AD 1828–) State, capitalistic, republic (Eastern Republic of Uruguay). Formed on the territory. modern Uruguay as a result of the withdrawal from the United Provinces of South America. Capital - Montevideo
info_1069: FALKLAND ISLANDS (Brit.) (AD 1833–2021) British possession, overseas territory. Formed on the territory. modern Falkland Islands (Brit.) as a result of the occupation of Great Britain. Capital - Stanley
info_1271: NOVA COLONIA DEL SACRAMENTO (Port.) (AD 1680-1705),(1716-1776) Colony of Portugal. (Formed on the territory of modern Uruguay as a result of the founding of a colony on the banks of La Plata),(Conquered by Spain, became part of Peru (Sp.)),(Returned to Portugal. Joined the Rio de la Plata (Sp.)). Capital - Colonia del Sacramento
name_1272: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands (Brit.)
label_1272: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands (Brit.)
info_1272: SOUTH GEORGE AND SOUTH SANDWICH ISLANDS (Brit.) (AD 1985–2021) British possession, overseas territory. Formed on the territory. modern South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands (Brit.) as a result of secession from the Falkland Islands (Brit.). Capital - King Edward Point
info_1038: BRAZIL (Port.) (AD 1530-1815) A colony of Portugal (Colonial Brazil). Founded on the territory of Brazil, as a result of the development opened in 1500 Pedro Cabral lands and the founding of the first settlement of San Vicente in the coastal part of the modern State of Sao Paulo. It became part of the United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and Algarve. Capitals - Salvador (1549-1763), Rio de Janeiro (1763-1815)
