info_1042: BRAZIL (Dutch) (AD 1630-1654) A colony of the Netherlands. Founded on the territory of Brazil, as a result of the occupation of the Dutch West India Company northeastern Brazil (Port.). Reconquer Brazil (Port.). Capital - Mauritsstad
info_1273: PARAGUAY (AD 1811–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Paraguay). Formed on the territory of modern Paraguay as a result of the withdrawal from the Rio de la Plata (Sp.) and the proclamation of the independence of the Republic of Paraguay. Capital - Asuncion
name_1274: United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarve
label_1274: United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarve
info_1274: UNITED KINGDOM OF PORTUGAL, BRAZIL AND ALGARVE (AD 1815-1822) State. Formed on the terr. modern Portugal and Brazil as a result of the unification of Portugal, Brazil (Port.) and other Portuguese colonies. Liquidated after the proclamation of Brazilian independence. Capital - Rio de Janeiro
info_212: MOROCCO (AD 1956–) State, capitalist (Kingdom of Morocco). Formed on the territory of modern Morocco as a result of the declaration of independence from France Morocco (fr.) March 2, 1956 Capital - Rabat
info_1275: SAHRAWI ARAB DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC (SADR) (AD 1976–) Partially recognized state. Formed on the territory of modern Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic as a result of the declaration of independence in the possession of Spanish Sahara, most of the country is occupied by Morocco. Capital - Tifariti (actual)
info_1276: MAURITANIA (AD 1960–) Capitalist State (Islamic Republic of Mauritania). Formed on the territory of modern Mauritania as a result of the declaration of independence from France Mauritania (Fr.). Capital - Nouakchott
info_1277: WESTERN SAHARA (AD 1845-1975) Colony of Spain (since 1958 - a province of Spain). Formed on the territory of modern Sahara Arab Democratic Republic as a result of the Spanish occupation of the coastal regions of Western Sahara. Divided between Morocco and Mauritania. Capital - Villa Cisneros (until 1958), El Aaiun (from 1958)
info_1278: MAURITANIA (Fr.) (AD 1903-1904),(1958-1960) Possession of France, colony. (Formed on the territory of modern Mauritania as a result of the establishment of a protectorate over the emirates of Adrar, Trarza, Brakna and Tagant),(became part of French West Africa),(seceded from French West Africa. Mauritania proclaimed independence). Capitals - Nouakchott
info_1280: MALI (AD 1960–) Capitalist state (Republic of Mali). Formed on the territory of modern Mali as a result of the disintegration of the Federation of Mali (Fr.) and the declaration of independence of Mali. Capital - Bamako
info_1281: UPPER SENEGAL (Fr.) (AD 1880-1890) Possession of France, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Mali as a result of the conquests of the states of Vassulu, Tijania, Kenedugu, Mosi. Renamed to French Sudan Capital - Bamako
info_1282: FRENCH SUDAN (Fr.) (AD 1890-1895) Possession of France, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Mali as a result of the change of the colony of Upper Senegal (Fr.). It became part of French West Africa. Capital - Bamako
info_1283: SUDANESE REPUBLIC (Fr.) (AD 1958-1959) Possession of France, autonomous republic. Formed on the territory of modern Mali as a result of the secession from French West Africa by the French Sudan under the name of the Sudanese Republic (Fr.). Merged with Senegal (Fr.) into the Federation of Mali (Fr.) Capital - Bamako
info_1284: MALI FEDERATION (Fr.) (AD 1959-1960) Possession of France, federation. Formed on the territory of modern Mali and Senegal as a result of the unification of the Sudanese Republic (Fr.) and Senegal (Fr.). Disbanded after the declaration of independence of Senegal and Mali. Capital - Dakar
info_1285: NIGER (AD 1960–) State, capitalist Republic of Niger). Formed on the territory of modern Niger as a result of the declaration of independence from France in Niger (Fr.). Capital - Niamey
info_1286: NIGER (Fr.) (AD 1958-1960) Possession of France, autonomous republic. Formed on the territory of modern Niger as a result of secession from French West Africa. The independence of Niger is proclaimed. Capital - Niamey
info_1279: FRENCH WEST AFRICA (AD 1895-1958) Possession of France, federation of colonies. Formed on the territory of modern Guinea, Cote d'Ivoire, Mali and Senegal as a result of the unification of the colonies of French Sudan, Guinea (Fr.), Ivory Coast (Fr.) and Senegal (Fr.). It ceased to exist and was divided into the colonies of the Ivory Coast (Fr.), Upper Volta (Fr.), Guinea (Fr.), Dahomey (Fr.), Mauritania (Fr.), Niger (Fr.), Senegal (Fr. ), French Sudan. Capitals - St. Louis (1895-1902), Dakar (1902-1958)
info_1287: SENEGAL (AD 1960–) Capitalist state (Republic of Senegal). Formed on the territory of modern Senegal as a result of the disintegration of the Federation of Mali (Fr.) and the declaration of independence of Senegal. Capital - Dakar
info_1288: SENEGAL (Fr.) (AD 1890–1895),(1958–1959) Possession of France, since 1958 - an autonomous republic. (Formed on the territory of modern. Senegal as a result of the establishment of a French protectorate over the tribes of Senegal. It became part of French West Africa),(Withdrawn from French West Africa. Merged with the Republic of Sudan (Fr.) into the Federation of Mali (Fr.) Capital - Dakar
info_1289: THE GAMBIA (AD 1965–) Capitalist state (Republic of the Gambia). Formed on the territory of modern Gambia as a result of the declaration of independence from Great Britain Gambia (Brit.). Capital - Banjul (until 1973 - Bathurst)
info_1290: THE GAMBIA (Brit.) (AD 1766-1779), (1809-1965) Possession of Great Britain, colony and protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern. Gambia as a result of the establishment of British rule. Occupied by France, became part of Senegal (Fr.). Returned to Great Britain, founded a colony and protectorate of Gambia (Brit.) in 1816. The independence of the Gambia is proclaimed. Capital - Bathurst
info_1291: BURKINA-FASO (AD 1984–) Capitalist state. Formed on the territory of modern Burkina Faso as a result of the renaming of Upper Volta. Capital - Ouagadougou
info_1292: UPPER VOLTA (AD 1960-1984) Capitalist state (Republic of Upper Volta). Formed on the territory of modern Burkina Faso as a result of the declaration of independence from France by Upper Volta (Fr.). Renamed Burkina Faso. Capital - Ouagadougou
info_1293: UPPER VOLTA (Fr.) (AD 1958–1960) Possession of France, autonomous republic. Formed on the territory of modern Burkina Faso as a result of the secession from French West Africa. The independence of Upper Volta is proclaimed. Capital - Ouagadougou
info_1294: GUINEA (AD 1958–) State, capitalist (Republic of Guinea). Formed on the territory of modern Guinea as a result of the secession from French West Africa and the declaration of independence from France. Capital - Conakry
info_1295: RIVIÈRES DU SUD (Fr.) (AD 1882-1891} Possession of France, a colony. Formed on the territory of modern Guinea as a result of the unification of the coastal Guinean territories occupied by France into the colony of Rivières du Sud (Fr.). Renamed into Guinea (Fr.). Capital - Conakry
info_1296: GUINEA (Fr.) (AD 1891–1895) Possession of France, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Guinea as a result of renaming the colony Rivières du Sud (Fr.) into Guinea (Fr.). It became part of French West Africa. Capital - Conakry
info_1297: CÔTE D'IVOIRE (AD 1985–) State, capitalist (Republic of Côte d'Ivoire). Formed on the territory of modern Côte d'Ivoire as a result of the renaming of the Ivory Coast. Capital - Yamoussoukro
info_1298: IVORY COAST (AD 1960-1985) Capitalist state (Republic of Ivory Coast). Formed on the territory of modern Côte d'Ivoire as a result of the declaration of independence from France by the Ivory Coast (Fr.). Renamed Cote d'Ivoire. Capital - Abidjan (until 1983), Yamoussoukro (from 1983)
info_1299: IVORY COAST (Fr.) (AD 1889-1895),(1958-1959) Possession of France, colony and protectorate. (Formed on the territory of modern. Côte d'Ivoire as a result of separation from the colony of Riviere du Sud (Fr.). It became part of French West Africa),(Withdrawn from French West Africa. Independence of the Ivory Coast was proclaimed) Capital - Abidjan
info_1300: BENIN (AD 1975–) Capitalist state (Republic of Benin). Formed on the territory of modern Benin as a result of the renaming of Dahomey. Capital - Porto-Novo
info_1301: DAHOMEY (AD 1960-1974) State, capitalist (Republic of Dahomey). Formed on the territory of modern Benin as a result of the declaration of independence from France Dahomey (Fr.). Renamed to Benin. Capital - Porto-Novo
info_1302: DAHOMEY (Fr.) (AD 1958-1960) Possession of France, autonomous republic. Formed on the territory of modern Benin as a result of the secession from French West Africa. The independence of Dahomey is proclaimed. Capital - Porto-Novo
info_1303: TOGO (AD 1960–) State, capitalist (Togolese Republic). Formed on the territory of modern Togo as a result of the declaration of independence from France in Togo (Fr.). Capital - Lome
info_1304: TOGO (Fr.) (AD 1916-1919),(1937-1960) Possession of France, mandated territory. (Formed on the territory of modern Togo as a result of the joint British-French occupation (in 1914) of the possession of Togoland (Germ.) and its division into Togo (Brit.) and Togo (Fr.). It became part of French West Africa),(It seceded from the French West Africa. The independence of Togo was proclaimed). Capital - Lome
info_1305: TOGOLAND (Germ.) (AD 1884-1916) Possession of Germany, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Togo as a result of the conquest of territory by Germany. It was occupied (in 1914) by Great Britain and France, and the mandated territories of Togo (Brit.) and Togo (Fr.) were formed. Capitals - Bagida (1884–87), Zebeab (1887–97), Lome (1897–1916)
info_1306: GHANA (AD 1957–) State, capitalist (Republic of Ghana). Formed on the territory of modern Ghana as a result of the declaration of independence from Great Britain in the possession of the Gold Coast (Brit.). Capital - Accra
info_1307: GOLD COAST (Brit.) (AD 1821-1957) Possession of Great Britain, a colony. Formed on the territory of modern Ghana as a result of the conquest of part of the territory of the state of Ashanti. The independent state of Ghana is proclaimed. Capital - Accra
info_1308: TOGO (Brit.) (AD 1916-1956) British possession, Mandatory Territory. Formed on the territory. modern Ghana as a result of the joint British-French occupation (in 1914) of the possession of Togoland (Germ.) and its division into Togo (Brit.) and Togo (Fr.). It became part of the Gold Coast (Brit.). Capital - Ho
info_1030: REPUBLIC OF SOUTH AFRICA (RSA) (AD 1961–) State, capitalist, republic. Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the transformation of the Union of South Africa into Republic of South Africa. Capitals - Pretoria (administrative), Cape Town (legislative), Bloemfontein (judicial)
info_1070: NAMIBIA (AD 1990–) State, capitalist (Republic of Namibia). Formed on the territory of modern Namibia as a result of the declaration of independence in the Trust Territory of South West Africa (RSA) and the formation of the Republic of Namibia. Capital - Windhoek
info_1309: UNION OF SOUTH AFRICA (AD 1910-1961) State, capitalist. Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the unification of the British colonies Cape Colony, Colony of Natal, Orange River Colony, Transvaal Colony, , part of Bechuanaland (Brit.) and the creation of the Union of South Africa dominion independent from Great Britain. Converted to South Africa. Capitals - Pretoria (administrative), Cape Town (legislative), Bloemfontein (judicial)
info_1310: CAPE COLONY (Brit.) (AD 1806-1910) Possession of Great Britain, a colony. Formed on the territory of modern South Africa as a result of the British conquest of the Dutch colony Cape Colony (Dutch). Joined the Union of South Africa. Capital - Cape Town
info_1311: COLONY OF NATAL (Brit.) (AD 1843-1910) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the British conquest of the Republic of Natal. Joined the Union of South Africa. Capital - Pietermaritzburg
info_1312: ORANGE RIVER COLONY (Brit.) (AD 1902-1910) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the British conquest of the Orange Free State. Joined the Union of South Africa. Capital - Bloemfontein
info_1313: TRANSVAAL COLONY (Brit.) (AD 1877-1881),(1902-1910) Possession of Great Britain, colony. (Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the British conquest of the South African Republic (Transvaal). As a result of the victory in the first Boer War, an independent South African Republic (Transvaal) was recreated),(As a result of the British victory in the second Boer War reconstituted. Became a part of the Union of South Africa). Capital - Pretoria
info_1314: CAPE COLONY (Dutch) (AD 1652-1795),(1803-1806) Possession of the Netherlands, a colony. (Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the conquest of the Cape of Good Hope by the Dutch West India Company. Occupied by Great Britain),(Transferred to the Batavian Republic (Netherlands). Conquered by Great Britain with the formation of the Cape Colony (Brit.). Capital - Cape Town
info_1315: NATALIA REPUBLIC (AD 1839-1843) State of the Boers. Formed on the territory modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the Boers' conquest of part of the Zulu Kingdom. Conquered by Great Britain to form the Colony of Natal (Brit.). Capital - Pietermaritzburg
info_1316: ORANGE FREE STATE (AD 1854-1902) State of the Boers. Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the recognition by Great Britain of the independence of the possession of Great Britain Orange River Sovereignty (Brit.). Conquered by Great Britain to form the Orange River Colony (Brit.). Capital - Bloemfontein
info_1317: ORANGE RIVER SOVEREIGNTY (Brit.) (AD 1848-1854) State of the Boers. Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the British conquest of the Orange River region. Great Britain recognized independence with the formation of the Orange Free State. Capital - Bloemfontein
info_1318: SOUTH AFRICAN REPUBLIC (TRANSVAAL) (AD 1856-1877),(1881-1902) State of the Boers. (Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the unification of several small Boer states. Conquered by Great Britain, Transvaal Colony (Brit.) established),(Recreated. As a result of the victory of Great Britain in the second Boer War, it was conquered and turned into the Transvaal Colony (Brit.)). Capital - Pretoria
info_1319: KLEIN VRYSTAAT (AD 1886-1891) State of the Boers. Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the transfer of land to the Boers in lease by the Swazi leader. It became part of South African Republic (Transvaal). Capital - Pit Retif
info_1320: NIEUWE REPUBLIEK (AD 1884-1888) State of the Boers. Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the transfer of land to the Boers by the leader of the Zulu. It became part of South African Republic (Transvaal). Capital - Freyheid
info_1322: GRIKVALAND EAST (AD 1862-1879) State of Griqua (from 1874 - British possession). Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the relocation of the Griqua group to no man's land. It became part of the Cape Colony (Brit.). Capital - Kokstad
info_1323: KAFFRARIA (Brit.) (AD 1835-1866) Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the British conquest of the territory of the Kos tribes. Annexed to the Cape Colony (Brit.). Capital - King Williams Town
info_1324: BECHUANALAND (Brit.) (AD 1885-1966) Possession of Great Britain, colony and protectorate. Formed on the territory. modern Botswana as a result of the British conquest of the lands of the Tswana people. The independent state of Botswana was proclaimed (in 1910, part of the property (colony) became part of the Union of South Africa). Capital - Mafikeng (1885-1965), Gaborone (1965-1966)
info_1325: STELLALAND (AD 1882-1885) State of the Boers. Formed on the territory of modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the conquest of the Grikwa and Tswanwa lands. It became part of the colony of Bechuanaland (Brit.). Capital - Freiburg
info_1326: GRIKVALAND WEST (AD 1870-1871) State of Griqua. Formed on the territory modern Republic of South Africa as a result of the seizure of the territory of the Hoi-Hoi and Bushmen peoples by the Griqua group. It became part of the Cape Colony (Brit.). Capital - Kimberley
info_1327: BOTSWANA (AD 1966–) State, capitalist (Republic of Botswana). Formed on the territory of modern Botswana as a result of the declaration of independence of Bechuanaland (Brit.). Capital - Gaborone
info_1328: ESWATINI (AD 2018–) State, capitalist, monarchy (Kingdom of Eswatini). Formed on the territory of modern Eswatini as a result of the renaming of Swaziland. Capital - Mbabane (official), Lobamba (royal and parliamentary)
info_1329: SWAZILAND (AD 1968–2018) State, capitalist, monarchy (Kingdom of Swaziland). Formed on the territory of modern Eswatini as a result of the declaration of independence of Swaziland (Brit.). Changed to Eswatini. Capital - Mbabane (official), Lobamba (royal and parliamentary)
info_1330: SWAZILAND (Brit.) (AD 1902-1968) British possession, protectorate. Formed on the territory. modern Eswatini as a result of the transfer of a protectorate over Swaziland from South African Republic (Transvaal) of Great Britain. Swaziland proclaimed its independence. Capital - Mbabane
info_1331: SWAZILAND (SAR) (AD 1894-1902) Possession of the South African Republic (Transvaal), protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Eswatini as a result of the establishment of a protectorate by Swaziland. Transfer of the protectorate to Great Britain. Capital - Mbabane
info_1332: LESOTHO (AD 1966–) State, capitalist, monarchy (Kingdom of Lesotho). Formed on the territory of modern Lesotho as a result of the declaration of independence of Basutoland (Brit). Capital - Maseru
info_1333: BASUTOLAND (Brit.) (AD 1868-1871),(1884-1966) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate (from 1884 - colony). (Formed on the territory of modern Lesotho as a result of Great Britain establishing a protectorate over the Basuto lands. Annexed to the Cape Colony (Brit>)),(Restored as a British colony. Lesotho's independence proclaimed). Capital - Maseru
info_1334: SOUTH-WEST AFRICA (RSA) (AD 1915-1990) Possession of the Republic of South Africa. Formed on the territory of modern Namibia as a result of the occupation of South-West Africa (Germ.) by the Union of South Africa and the transfer of the colony under mandate management. The independent republic of Namibia is proclaimed. Capital - Windhoek
info_1335: SOUTH-WEST AFRICA (Germ.) (AD 1884-1915) Possession of Germany, a colony. Formed on the territory of modern Namibia as a result of the conquest of lands in South West Africa by Germany. Occupied by the Union of South Africa and placed under imperative control. Capital - Windhoek
info_1336: WALVIS BAY (British) (AD 1868-1910) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Namibia as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over Walvis Bay. Capital - Walvis Bay
info_1337: WALFISH BAY (RSA) (AD 1910-1994) Possession of the Republic of South Africa. Formed on the territory of modern Namibia as a result of the transfer of British ownership to the South African Union. Transferred to Namibia. Capital - Walvis Bay
info_1338: CABO VERDE (AD 2013–) State, capitalist (Republic of Cabo Verde). Formed on the territory of modern Cabo Verde as a result of the renaming of the Cape Verde Islands. Capital - Praia
info_1339: CAPE VERDE ISLANDS (AD 1975–) State, capitalist. Formed on the territory of modern Cabo Verde as a result of the proclamation of independence of Portugal's possession of Cape Verde (Port). Capital - Praia
info_1340: CAPE VERDE ISLANDS (Port.) (AD 1495-1580),(1640-1975) Possession of Portugal. (Formed on the territory of modern Cabo Verde as a result of the colonization of the Cape Verde Islands by Portuguese colonists. Passed into the possession of Spain),(Returned to Portugal. The independence of the Cape Verde Islands was proclaimed). Capital - Praia
info_1341: CAPE VERDE ISLANDS (Sp.) (AD 1580-1640) Possession of Spain. Formed on the territory of modern Cabo Verde as a result of the transfer of the Cape Verde Islands (Port) colony to Spain. Returned to Portugal. Capital - Praia
info_1342: GUINEA-BISSAU (AD 1973–) Capitalist state (Republic of Guinea-Bissau). Formed on the territory of modern Guinea-Bissau as a result of the proclamation of the independence of the possession of Portugal Guinea (Port.). Capital - Bissau
info_1343: GUINEA (Port.) (AD 1879-1973) Possession of Portugal, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Guinea-Bissau as a result of separation from the Cape Verde Island (Port). Capital - Bolama (1879-1942), Bissau (1942-1973)
info_1344: SIERRA LEONE (AD 1973–) Capitalist state (Republic of Sierra Leone). Formed on the territory of modern Sierra Leone as a result of the proclamation of independence of the possession of Sierra Leone (Brit.). Capital - Freetown
info_1345: SIERRA LEONE (Brit.) (AD 1808-1961) Possession of Great Britain, colony and protectorate (from 1896). Formed on the territory of modern Sierra Leone as a result of the coastal conquest and the founding of the settlement of Freetown. Capital - Freetown
info_1346: LIBERIA (AD 1847–) State, capitalist (Republic of Liberia). Formed on the territory of modern Liberia as a result of the proclamation of the independent state of Liberia by free African American settlers from the United States. Capital - Monrovia
name_1347: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha (Brit.)
label_1347: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha (Brit.)
info_1347: SAINT HELENA, ASCENSION AND TRISTAN DA CUNHA (Brit.) (AD 2009–) British possession. Formed on the territory of modern Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha (Brit.) as a result of the renaming of Saint Helena (Brit.). Capital - Jamestown
info_1348: SAINT HELENA (Brit.) (AD 1657-2009) Possession of Great Britain. Formed on the territory. modern Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha (Brit.) as a result of the British conquest of Saint Helena. Renamed Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha (Brit.). Capital - Jamestown
info_1349: FRENCH EQUATORIAL AFRICA (AD 1910-1958) Possession of France, federation of colonies. Formed on the territory of modern Gabon, Central African Republic, Chad, Republic of the Congo as a result of the unification of the colonies Gabon (Fr.), Ubangi-Shari-Chad (Fr.), Middle Congo (Fr.). It ceased to exist and was divided into the colonies of Ubangi-Shari (Fr.), Chad (Fr.), Congo (Fr.), Gabon (Fr.). Capital - Brazzaville
info_1350: CHAD (AD 1960–) Capitalist state (Republic of Chad). Formed on the territory of modern Chad as a result of the proclamation of the independence of the possession of Chad (Fr.). Capital - N'Djamena
info_1351: CHAD (Fr.) (AD 1900-1906),(1958-1960) Possession of France, autonomous republic (since 1958). (Formed on the territory of present-day Chad as a result of France's establishment of a protectorate over the Baghirmi sultanate. It merged with the Ubangi-Shari (Fr.) colony into the Ubangi-Shari-Chad (Fr.) colony),(Withdrawn from French Equatorial Africa. Independence proclaimed Chad). Capital - Fort Lamy
info_1352: UBANGI-SHARI-CHAD (Fr.) (AD 1906-1910) Possession of France. Formed on the territory. modern Chad and the Central African Republic as a result of the unification of the Ubangi Shari (Fr.) and Chad (Fr.) colonies. It became part of the French Equatorial Africa. Capital - Bangui
info_1353: CAMEROON (Germ.) (AD 1884-1916) Possession of Germany, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Cameroon as a result of the establishment of a protectorate over a number of states in North-West Africa. Divided into Cameroon (Brit.) and Cameroon (Fr.). Capital - Yaounde
info_1354: CENTRAL AFRICAN REPUBLIC (AD 1960–1976),(1979–) State, capitalist. (Formed on the territory of the modern Central African Republic as a result of the proclamation of the independence of the possession of Ubangi-Shari (Fr.). Central African Empire was proclaimed.),(Central African Republic was re-established). Capital - Bangui
info_1355: CENTRAL AFRICAN EMPIRE (AD 1976-1979) State, capitalist. Formed on the territory of modern Central African Republic as a result of the transformation of the Central African Republic into Central African Empire. Central African Republic was re-established. Capital - Bangui
info_1356: UBANGI-SHARI (Fr.) (AD 1903-1906),(1958-1960) Possession of France, autonomous republic (since 1958). (Formed on the territory of the modern Central African Republic as a result of secession from Congo (Fr.). It became part of French Equatorial Africa),(Seceded from French Equatorial Africa. The independence of Central African Republic was proclaimed). Capital - Bangui
info_1357: CONGO (Fr.) (AD 1882-1903),(1958-1960) Possession of France, autonomous republic (since 1958). (Formed on the territory of the modern Congo (Brazzaville) as a result of France's establishment of a protectorate over the people of Bateke on the northern bank of the Congo River. Renamed to Middle Congo (Fr.)),(Seceded from French Equatorial Africa. The independence of Republic of the Congo was proclaimed). Capital - Brazzaville
info_1358: MIDDLE CONGO (Fr.) (AD 1903-1910). Possession of France. Formed on the territory of modern Congo (Brazzaville) as a result of the renaming of the Congo (Fr.). Became part of French Equatorial Africa. Capital - Brazzaville
info_1359: CONGO (Brazzaville) (AD 1960–) State, capitalist (Republic of the Congo; 1970–1991 - People's Republic of the Congo). Formed on the territory of modern Congo (Brazzaville) as a result of the proclamation of the independence of the possession of the Congo (Fr.). Capital - Brazzaville
info_1360: GABON (AD 1960–) State, capitalist (Gabonese Republic). Formed on the territory of modern Gabon as a result of the proclamation of the independence of the possession of Gabon (Fr.). Capital - Libreville
info_1361: GABON (Fr.) (AD 1883-1886),(1903-1910),(1958-1960) Possession of France, autonomous republic (since 1958). (Formed on the territory of modern Gabon as a result of France's establishment of a protectorate over local tribes. It became part of the Congo colony (Fr.), Withdrawn from the Congo (Fr.). It became part of French Equatorial Africa, Withdrawn from French Equatorial Africa. The independence of Gabon is proclaimed). Capital - Libreville
info_1362: CAMEROON (Fr.) (AD 1916-1959). Possession of France. Formed on the territory of modern Cameroon as a result of the partition of Cameroon (Germ.) and the transfer of the mandate to govern the eastern part of Cameroon to France. The independence of Cameroon is proclaimed. Capital - Yaounde
info_1363: CAMEROON (Brit.) (AD 1916-1961). British ownership. Formed on the territory of modern Cameroon as a result of the partition of Cameroon (Germ.) and the transfer of the control mandate of the western part of Cameroon to Great Britain. Shared between Cameroon and Nigeria. Capital - Buea
info_1364: CAMEROON (AD 1960–) State, capitalist (Republic of Cameroon). Formed on the territory of modern Cameroon as a result of the proclamation of the independence of the possession of Cameroon (Fr.). Capital - Yaounde
info_1365: NIGERIA (AD 1960–) Capitalist state (Federal Republic of Nigeria). Formed on the territory fo modern Nigeria as a result of the proclamation of independence of the possession of Nigeria (Britain). Capital - Lagos (until 1991), Abuja (from 1991)
info_1366: NIGERIA (Brit.) (AD 1914-1960) Possession of Great Britain, colony and protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Nigeria as a result of the unification of the possessions of Northern Nigeria (Brit.) and Southern Nigeria (Brit.). Capital - Lagos
info_1367: NORTHERN NIGERIA (Brit.) (AD 1900-1914) British possession, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Nigeria as a result of the establishment of a protectorate over the states of Sokoto and Bornu. Merged with Southern Nigeria (Brit.) to Nigeria (Brit.). Capital - Zungeru
info_1368: SOUTH NIGERIA (Brit.) (AD 1900-1914) British possession, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Nigeria as a result of the unification of the possessions of Great Britain Protectorate of Niger Coast Protectorate (Brit.) and the Colony of Lagos (Brit.). Merged with Northern Nigeria (Brit.) to Nigeria (Brit.). Capital - Lagos (from 1906)
info_1369: NIGER COAST PROTECTORATE (Brit.) (AD 1893-1900) British possession, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Nigeria by renaming the Oil Rivers Protectorate (Brit.) to Niger Coast Protectorate (Brit.). It became part of Southern Nigeria (Brit.). Capital - Calabar
info_1370: OIL RIVERS PROTECTORATE (Brit.) (AD 1884-1893) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Nigeria as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over local tribes. Renamed Niger Coast Protectorate (Brit.). Capital - Calabar
info_1371: LAGOS (Brit.) (AD 1862-1906) Possession of Great Britain, colony and protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Nigeria as a result of the establishment of a protectorate over the Yoruba peoples. Entered into South Nigeria (Brit.). Capital - Lagos
info_1372: EQUATORIAL GUINEA (AD 1968–) Capitalist state (Republic of Equatorial Guinea). Formed on the territory of modern Equatorial Guinea as a result of the proclamation of the independence of the possession of Guinea (Sp.). Capital - Malabo (until 1973 Santa Isabel)
info_1373: GUINEA (Sp.) (AD 1778-1968) Possession of Spain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Equatorial Guinea as a result of the Spanish conquest of the island of Fernando Po. Equatorial Guinea proclaimed its independence. Capital - Santa Isabel
info_1374: SAN TOME AND PRINCIPE (AD 1975–) State, capitalist (Democratic Republic of Sao Tome and Principe). Formed on the territory of modern Sao Tome and Principe as a result of the proclamation of the independence of the possession of Sao Tome and Principe (Port.). Capital - Sao Tome
info_1375: SAN TOME AND PRINCIPI (Port.) (AD 1753-1975) Possession of Portugal. Formed on the territory ща modern Sao Tome and Principe as a result of the Portuguese conquest of the islands. the proclamation of independence of Sao Tome and Principe. Capital - Sao Tome
info_1376: ANGOLA (AD 1975–) Capitalist state (Republic of Angola). Formed on the territory of modern Angola as a result of the declaration of independence of the possession of Angola (Port.). Capital - Luanda
info_1377: ANGOLA (Port.) (AD 1575-1975) Possession of Portugal, until 1951 the name Portuguese West Africa was also used. Formed on the territory of modern Angola as a result of the conquest by Portugal of the territories of the states of the Kingdom of the Congo, Ndongo, Lunda. The independence of Angola is proclaimed. Capital - Luanda
info_1087: KENYA (AD 1963–) State, republic (Republic of Kenya; until 1964 - dominion). Formed on the territory of modern Kenya as a result of Kenya's independence (Brit.). Capital - Nairobi
info_1378: SUDAN (AD 1956–) Capitalist state (Republic of Sudan). Formed on the territory of modern Sudan as a result of the declaration of independence of the Anglo-Egyptian Sudan. Capital - Khartoum
info_1379: ANGLO-EGYPTIAN SUDAN (AD 1899-1956) Joint possession of Great Britain and Egypt, condominium. Formed on the territory of modern Sudan as a result of the suppression of the Mahdist uprising in Egyptian Sudan (formally part of the Ottoman Empire) and its occupation by British-Egyptian troops. The independence of Sudan is proclaimed. Capital - Khartoum
info_1380: SOUTH SUDAN (AD 2011–) Capitalist state (Republic of South Sudan). Formed on the territory of modern Sudan as a result of separation from Sudan. Capital - Juba
info_1381: ETHIOPIA (AD 1270–1936),(1944–) State, capitalist, republic (until 1974 - empire) (Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia). (Born on the territory of modern Ethiopia as a result of the proclamation of the Ethiopian Empire. Included in the Italian East Africa),(Recreated as a result of the end of the British military administration in Ethiopia). Capital - Addis Ababa
info_1382: ITALIAN EASTERN AFRICA (AD 1936-1941) Possession of Italy. Formed on the terr. modern Ethiopia, Eritrea and Somalia as a result of Italy's occupation of Ethiopia and its unification with the colonies of Eritrea (It.) and Somalia (It.). Occupied by Great Britain. Capital - Addis Ababa
info_1383: ERITREA (AD 1993–) State, capitalist, republic (State of Eritrea). Formed on the territory of modern Eritrea as a result of separation from Ethiopia. Capital - Asmara
info_1384: ERITREA (It.) (AD 1882-1936) Possession of Italy. Formed on the terr of modern Eritrea as a result of the Italian conquest of Eritrea from the Ottoman Empire. Included in the Italian East Africa. Capital - Asmara
info_1385: DJIBOUTI (AD 1977–) State, capitalist (Republic of Djibouti). Formed on the territory of modern Djibouti as a result of the declaration of independence of Territory of Afar and Issa (Fr.). Capital - Djibouti
info_1386: SOMALILAND (Fr.) (AD 1896-1977) Possession of France (French Coast of the Somalis), overseas territory. Formed on the territory of modern Djibouti as a result of the establishment of the France protectorate over the port of Djibouti. Djibouti proclamation of independence. Capital - Djibouti
info_1387: SOMALIA (AD 1960-) Capitalist state (Federal Republic of Somalia). Formed on the territory of modern Somalia as a result of the declaration of independence in the colonies of Somaliland (Brit.) and Somalia (It.) and their unification. Capital - Mogadishu
info_1388: SOMALILAND (Brit.) (AD 1884-1940),(1941-1960) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate. (Formed on the territory of modern of Somalia as a result of the establishment of a Great Britain protectorate over the Somali sulanates. Occupied by Italy and included in Italian East Africa),(Liberated from occupation. Independence proclaimed and incorporated into Somalia). Capital - Hargeisa
info_1389: SOMALIA (It.) (AD 1889-1936),(1947-1960) Possession of Italy. (Formed on the territory of modern Somalia as a result of the establishment of Italian protectorate over a number of Somali sultanates. Including in Italian East Africa),(Recreated as a result of the end of the British military administration in Somalia. Independence was proclaimed and incorporated into Somalia). Capital - Mogadishu
info_1390: KENYA (Brit.) (AD 1920-1963) British possession, colony and protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Kenya as a result of the renaming of British East Africa. The independence of Kenya is proclaimed. Capital - Nairobi
info_1391: BRITISH EAST AFRICA (AD 1895-1920) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Kenya as a result of the transfer of Kenya from the Imperial British East African Company of Great Britain. Renamed Kenya (Brit.). Capital - Mombasa (until 1907), Nairobi (from 1907)
info_1392: ZANZIBAR (British) (AD 1861-1963) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate (Sultanate of Zanzibar). Formed on the territory of modern Tanzania as a result of separation from the colony of Muscat and Oman (Brit.). The independence of Zanzibar is proclaimed. Capital - Zanzibar
info_1393: UGANDA (Brit.) (AD 1894-1962) Possession of Great Britain, colony and protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Uganda as a result of the handover of Uganda from the Imperial British East African Company of Great Britain. The independence of Uganda is proclaimed. Capital - Entebbe
info_1394: UGANDA (AD 1962–) State, republic (Republic of Uganda; until 1963 - dominion). Formed on the territory of modern Uganda as a result of Uganda's independence (Brit.). Capital - Kampala
info_1395: ZANZIBAR (AD 1963– 1964) State (until January 1964 - Sultanate of Zanzibar; from January to April 1964 People's Republic of Zanzibar and Pemba). Formed on the territory of modern Tanzania as a result of Zanzibar's independence (Brit.). It merged with Tanganyika to form Tanzania. Capital - Zanzibar
info_1396: TANZANIA (AD 1964–) Capitalist state (United Republic of Tanzania). Formed on the territory of modern Tanzania as a result of unification with Tanganyika and Zanzibar. Capital - Dar es Salaam (until 1996), Dodoma (from 1996)
info_1397: TANGANYIKA (AD 1961-1964) Capitalist state, republic (Republic of Tanganyika). Formed on the territory of modern Tanzania as a result of the declaration of independence of Tanganyika (Brit.). Capital - Dar es Salaam
info_1398: TANGANYIKA (Brit.) (AD 1916-1961) Possession of Great Britain, mandate (trust) territory. Formed on the territory of modern Tanzania as a result of the occupation of German East Africa by Great Britain and later (since 1919) transferring it under the mandate control of Great Britain. The independence of Tanganyika is proclaimed. Capital - Dar es Salaam
info_1399: GERMAN EAST AFRICA (AD 1885-1916) Possession of Germany, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Tanzania as a result of the colonization of the territory by the German East African Society and the transfer of the colonized lands to the protectorate of Germany. It was occupied by Great Britain and later (from 1919) it was transferred under the mandate control of Great Britain as Tanganyika (Brit.). Capital - Bagamoyo (until 1890), Dar es Salaam (from 1890)
info_1400: RWANDA (AD 1962–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Rwanda). Formed on the territory of modern Rwanda as a result of the declaration of independence of the possession of Ruanda-Urundi (Belg.) and its division into the states of Rwanda and Burundi. Capital - Kigali
info_1401: BURUNDI (AD 1962–) State, capitalist, republic (Republic of Burundi). Formed on the territory of modern Burundi as a result of the declaration of independence of the possession of Ruanda-Urundi (Belg.) and its division into the states of Rwanda and Burundi. Capital - Bujumbura (until 2019), Gitega (from 2019)
info_1402: RUANDA-URUNDI (Belg.) (AD 1916-1962) Possession of Belgium, mandate (trust) territory. Formed on the territory of modern Tanzania as a result of the occupation of part of the territory of German East Africa by Belgium and later (since 1922) transferring it under the mandate control of Belgium. Independence was proclaimed and divided into the states of Rwanda and Burundi. Capital - Usumbura
info_1403: DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF THE CONGO (AD 1997–) State, capitalist. Formed on the territory of modern DR Congo as a result of the renaming of Zaire. Capital - Kinshasa
info_1404: ZAIRE (AD 1971-1997) The state, capitalist. Formed on the territory of modern DR Congo as a result of renaming Congo (Kinshasa). Capital - Kinshasa
info_1405: CONGO (Kinshasa) (AD 1960-1971) State, capitalist. Formed on the territory of modern DR Congo as a result of the declaration of independence of the Congo (Belg.). Renamed to Zaire. Capital - Kinshasa (until 1966 - Leopoldville)
info_1406: CONGO (Belg.) (AD 1908-1960) Possession of Belgium, colony. Formed on the territory of modern DR Congo as a result of the annexation of the Congo Free State by Belgium. Congo (Kinshasa) independence proclaimed. Capital - Boma (until 1926), Leopoldville (from 1926)
info_1407: CONGO FREE STATE (AD 1885-1908) State in personal union with the king of Belgium. Formed on the territory of modern DR Congo as a result of colonization of the territory of modern DR Congo by Belgium. Annexed by Belgium. Capital - Boma
info_1408: MOZAMBIQUE (AD 1975–) Capitalist state (Republic of Mozambique). Formed on the territory of modern Mozambique as a result of the proclamation of the independence of the possession of Mozambique (Port.). Capital - Maputo
info_1409: MOZAMBIQUE (Port.) (AD 1505-1975) Possession of Portugal, also called Portuguese East Africa. Formed on the territory of modern Mozambique as a result of the Portuguese conquest of the territories of the Sultanate of Kilva, the kingdoms of Monomotapa, Maravi. The independence of Mozambique is proclaimed. Capital - Laurence Markish (from 1897)
info_1410: ZAMBIA (AD 1964–) Capitalist state (Republic of Zambia). Formed on the territory of modern Zambia as a result of the proclamation of independence, the possession of the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland (Brit.) and its partition into Zambia, Malawi and Rhodesia. Capital - Lusaka
info_1411: FEDERATION OF RHODESIA AND NYASALAND (Brit.) (AD 1953-1963) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Zambia, Zimbabwe and Malawi as a result of the unification of the possession of Northern Rhodesia (Brit.), Southern Rhodesia (Brit.) and Nyasaland (Brit.). Declared underdependence and divided into Zambia, Malawi and Rhodesia. Capital - Salisbury
info_1412: RHODESIA (Brit.) (AD 1895-1924) A British holding run by the British South African Company. Formed on the territory of modern Zambia and Zimbpbwe as a result of the establishment of a protectorate over Barotseland. Divided into Northern Rhodesia (Brit.) and Southern Rhodesia (Brit.). Capital - Salisbury
info_1413: NORTHERN RHODESIA (Brit.) (AD 1924-1953) British possession, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Zambia as a result of the division of Rhodesia (Brit.) into Northern Rhodesia (Brit.) and Southern Rhodesia (Brit.). Joined the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland (Brit.). Capital - Lusaka
info_1414: ZIMBABWE (AD 1980–) Capitalist state (Republic of Zimbabwe). Formed on the territory of modern Zimbabwe as a result of the declaration of independence of Southern Rhodesia (Brit.). Capital - Harare
info_1415: SOUTHERN RHODESIA (Brit.) (AD 1923-1953)),(1979-1980) Possession of Great Britain, protectorate. (Formed on the territory of modern Zimbabwe as a result of the division of Rhodesia (Brit.) into Northern Rhodesia (Brit.) and Southern Rhodesia (Brit.). It became part of the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland (British)),(Reconstructed the possession of Great Britain in Southern Rhodesia (Brit.) The independence of Zimbabwe is proclaimed). Capital - Salisbury
info_1416: RODESIA (AD 1964-1979) An unrecognized state (since 1970 - the Republic of Rhodesia; in 1979 - Zimbabwe-Rhodesia). Formed on the territory of modern Zimbabwe as a result of the collapse of the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland (Brit.). British possession of Southern Rhodesia (Brit.) is re-established. Capital - Salisbury
info_1417: MALAWI (AD 1964–) State, capitalist (Republic of Malawi). Formed on the territory. modern Malawi as a result of the proclamation of independence, the possession of the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland (Brit.) and its partition into Zambia, Malawi and Rhodesia. Capital - Zomba (until 1975), Lilongwe (from 1975)
info_1418: NEWSLAND (Brit.) (AD 1907-1953) British possession, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Malawi as a result of the renaming of the British Central African Protectorate. It became part of the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland (Brit.). Capital - Zomba
info_1419: BRITISH CENTRAL AFRICAN PROTECTORATE (AD 1893-1907) British owned by the British South African Company. Formed on the territory of modern Malawi as a result of the establishment of a protectorate over Marawi. Renamed to Nyasaland (Brit.). Capital - Zomba
info_1420: MADAGASCAR (AD 1975–) State, capitalist (Republic of Madagascar). Formed on the territory of modern Madagascar as a result of the renaming of the Malagasy Republic. Capital - Antananarivo
info_1421: MALAGASY REPUBLIC (AD 1960-1975) Capitalist state. Formed on the territory of modern Madagascar as a result of the proclamation of independence of the possession of Madagascar (Fr.). Capital - Tananarive
info_1422: MADAGASCAR (Fr.) (AD 1896-1960) Possession of France (since 1958 - the autonomous Republic of Malagasy). Formed on the territory of modern Madagascar as a result of the establishment of a French protectorate over Kingdom of Madagascar. The independent Republic of Malagasy is proclaimed. Capital - Tananarive
info_1423: KINGDOM OF MADAGASCAR (AD 1817-1896) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory. modern Madagascar as a result of the unification by the King of Imerina of all states of the island of Madagascar into a single kingdom. Establishment of the protectorate of France. Capital - Tananarive
info_1424: COMOROS (AD 1975–) State, capitalist (Union of the Comoros; until 1978 - the Comoros state, until 2002 - the Islamic Federal Republic of the Comoros). Formed on the territory of modern Comoros as a result of the declaration of independence of the possession of the Comoros (Fr.). Capital - Moroni
info_1425: COMORES (FR.) (AD 1886-1914),(1946-1975) Possession of France, protectorate. (Formed on the territory of modern Comoros as a result of separation from the protectorate of Mayotte (Fr.). It became part of Madagascar (Fr.)),(Withdrawn from Madagascar (Fr.). The independent state of the Comoros was proclaimed). Capital - Moroni
info_1426: MAYOTTA (Fr.) (AD 1843–1896),(1899–1914),(1975–) Possession of France, overseas department. (Formed on the territory of modern Mayotte (Fr.) as a result of the establishment of a protectorate over the island of Mayotte. It became part of Madagascar (Fr.)),(Withdrew from Madagascar (Fr.). Was a part of Madagascar (Fr.)),(Withdrew from the Comoros (Fr.)). Capital - Dzaudzi (until 1977), Mamudzu (from 1977)
info_1427: REUNION (Fr.) (AD 1793–1801),(1848–) Possession of France, overseas department. (Formed on the territory of modern Reunion (Fr.) as a result of renaming the island of Bourbon (Fr.). Renamed to Bonaparte Island (Fr.)),(Island of Bourbon (Fr.) renamed to Reunion (Fr.)). Capital - Saint-Denis
info_1428: ISLAND OF BOURBON (Fr.) (AD 1764-1793),(1815-1848) Possession of France. (Formed on the territory of modern. Reunion (Fr.) as a result of the transfer of the island from the French East India Company of France. Renamed to Reunion (Fr.)),(Liberated from the occupation of Great Britain, the possession of the Island of Bourbon (Fr.) was restored. Renamed to Reunion (Fr.)). Capital - Saint-Denis
info_1429: BONAPARTE ISLAND (Fr.) (AD 1801-1810) Possession of France. Formed on the territory of modern Reunion (Fr.) as a result of the renaming of Reunn (Fr.) to Bonaparte Island (Fr.). Renamed Bourbon Island (Fr.). Capital - Saint-Denis
info_1430: MAURITIUS (Dutch) (AD 1638-1710) Possession of the Netherlands under the control of the Dutch East India Company. Formed on the territory of modern Mauritius as a result of the Dutch colonization of the island of Mauritius. Dutch settlers left the island. Capital - Port de Warwick
info_1431: ISLE DE FRANCE (Fr.) (AD 1715-1810) Possession of France, colony (until 1767 - under the control of the French East India Company. Formed on the territory of modern Mauritius as a result of French colonization of the island. Conquered by Great Britain with the formation of the colony of Mauritius (Brit.) Capital - Port Louis
info_1432: GHANA EMPIRE (AD 300-1240) Ancient state (another name for Wagadu). Formed on the territory of modern Mali by the people of the soninka. Conquered by the Mali Empire. Capital - Kumbi-Sale
info_1433: MALI EMPIRE (AD 1240-1545) The ancient state of the Malinke people. Formed on the territory of modern Mali as a result of its breakaway from the Ghana Empire. Conquered by the Songhai Empire. Capital - Kangaba
info_1434: SONGHAI (AD 1464-1591) The ancient state of the Songhai people. Formed on the territory. modern Mali as successor to the state of Gao. Destroyed by the Saadite State. Capital - Gao
info_1435: ADRAR (AD 1740-1903) State, emirate. Formed on the territory of modern Mauritania as a traditional confederation of semi-nomadic peoples. Entered into Mauritania (Fr.)
info_1436: TRARZA (AD 1740-1903) State, emirate. Formed on the territory of modern Mauritania as a traditional confederation of semi-nomadic peoples. Entered into Mauritania (Fr.)
info_1437: BRAKNA (AD 1600-1903) State, emirate. Formed on the territory of modern Mauritania as a traditional confederation of semi-nomadic peoples. Entered into Mauritania (Fr.)
info_1438: TAGANIT (AD 1580-1903) State, emirate. Formed on the territory of modern Mauritania as a traditional confederation of semi-nomadic peoples. Entered into Mauritania (Fr.)
info_1439: WOGODOGO (AD 1182-1895) State, kingdom. Formed on the territory of modern Burkina Faso by the Mossi people. As a result of the establishment of the protectorate of France, it became part of French West Africa (Fr.). Capital - Ouagadougou
info_1440: KONG (AD 1710-1889) State, Islamic empire. Formed on the territory of modern Cote d'Ivoire by immigrants from Mali. As a result of the establishment of the protectorate of France, it became part of the Ivory Coast (Fr.). Capital - Kong
info_1441: FUTA JALLON (AD 1725-1891) Theocratic State (Imamat Futa Jallon). Formed on the territory of modern Guinea as a result of the Fula jihad. As a result of the establishment of the protectorate of France, it became part of Guinea (Fr.). Capital - Timbo
info_1442: ASHANTI (AD 1701-1902) State, early feudal, absolute monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern Ghana as a military alliance of the Ashanti people. Conquered by Great Britain, became a part of the Gold Coast colony (British). Capital - Kumasi
info_1443: KINGDOM OF DAHOMEY (AD 1620-1895) State, early feudal, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern Benin as a state of the people background. As a result of the establishment of the protectorate of France, it became part of French West Africa (Fr.). Capital - Abomey
info_1444: LIBERIA (AD 1822-1847) Possession of the USA, colony (from 1839 - Commonwealth of Liberia). Formed on the territory. modern Liberia as a result of the resettlement from the United States of African Americans by the American Colonization Society. The independent Republic of Liberia is proclaimed. Capital - Monrovia
info_1445: KANEM-BORNU (AD 700-1893) State, feudal, monarchy. Born on the territory of modern Nigeria around Lake Chad. Broken up. Capital - Ngazargami
info_1446: BAGIRMI (AD 1522-1900) State, feudal, sultanate. Born on the territory of modern Chad as a state of the people bilala. It became part of Chad (Fr.). Capital - Masenya
info_1447: WADAI (AD 1635-1900) State, feudal, sultanate. Born on the territory. modern Chad as a state of the Maba people. It became part of Chad (Fr.). Capital - Abeche
info_1448: KINGDOM OF CONGO (AD 1390-1885) State, early feudal, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern Angola as a state of the Bakongo people. Conquered by Portugal and included in Angola (Port.). Capital - Mbanza Congo
info_1449: LOANGO (AD 1550-1882) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Loango). Formed on the territory of modern Congo (Brazzaville) as a result of secession from the Kingdom of the Congo. It became part of the Congo (Fr.). Capital - Boiley
info_1450: SOKOTO (AD 1804-1900) Islamic State, monarchy (Sokoto Caliphate). Formed on the territory of modern Nigeria as a result of the Fulani jihad. It became part of Northern Nigeria (Brit.). Capital - Sokoto
info_1451: SAO TOME AND PRINCIPI (Sp.) (AD 1580-1640) Possession of Spain. Formed on the territory of modern Sao Tome and Principe as a result of the transfer of islands from Portugal to Spain. The islands were returned to Portugal. Capital - Sao Tome
info_1452: LUNDA (AD 1600-1885) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Lunda). Formed on the territory of modern Angola as a state of the Lunda people. Conquered by Portugal and included in Angola (Port.)
info_1453: NDONGO (AD 1556-1626) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Ndongo). Formed on the territory of modern Angola as a result of secession from the Kingdom of the Congo. Conquered by Portugal and included in Angola (Port.). Capital - Cabaça
info_1454: LUBA (AD 1585-1885) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Luba). Formed on the territory of modern DR Congo as a result of the unification of the tribes of the Ulemba lowlands. It became part of the Free State of the Congo. Capital - Mwibele
info_1455: DARFUR (AD 1603-1874) State, monarchy (Darfur Sultanate). Formed on the territory of modern Sudan based on the Kordofan Sultanate. He entered the Ottoman Empire. Capital - El Fasher
info_1456: SENNAR (AD 1504-1821) State, monarchy (Darfur Sultanate of Sennar). Formed on the territory of modern Sudan by the Fung people. It became part of the Ottoman Empire. Capital - Sennar
info_1457: KUSH (1070–550 BC) State, slave-owning, monarchical (Kingdom of Kush). Born on the the terr of modern Sudan as successor to the kingdom of Kerma. Destroyed by Egypt (Ancient). Capitals - Napata, Meroe
info_1458: TERRITORY OF AFAR AND ISSA (Fr.) (AD 1967-1977) Possession of France, overseas territory. Formed on the territory of modern Djibouti as a result of the renaming of Somalia (Fr.). Djibouti proclaimed its independence. Capital - Djibouti
info_1459: TERRITORY OF OBOCK (Fr.) (AD 1862-1896) Possession of France. Formed on the territory of modern Djibouti as a result of the establishment of a protectorate over the Obock territory. Converted to Somalia (Fr.). Capital - Obock
info_1460: MOGADISHO (AD 1150-1250) State, monarchy (Sultanate of Mogadishu). Formed on the territory of modern Somalia. It became part of the state of Ajuran. Capital - Mogadishu
info_1461: ADJURAN (AD 1250-1700) State, monarchy (Imamat Ajuran). Formed on the territory of modern Somalia as successor to the Sultanate of Mogadishu. It became part of the state of Geledi. Capital - Calaf
info_1462: GELEDI (AD 1700-1889) State, monarchy (Sultanate of Geledi). Formed on the territory of modern Somalia as successor to Imamat Ajuran. It became part of Somalia (It.). Capital - Afgoye
info_1463: MAJIRTIN (AD 1650-1878) State, monarchy (Sultanate of Majirtin). Formed on the territory of modern Somalis by immigrants from the Somali clans Majirtin and Darod. Conquered by the Sultanate of Hobio. Capital - Ras Khafun
info_1464: Hobyo (AD 1878-1889) State, monarchy (Sultanate Hobyo). Formed on the territory of modern Somalia as a result of the conquest of the Sultanate of Majirtin. It became part of Somalia (It.). Capital - Hobyo
info_1465: ADAL (AD 1415-1577) State, monarchy (Sultanate of Adal). Formed on the territory. modern Somalia on the Harar plateau as a result of the Yifat Sultanate. Broken up. Capital - Saila
info_1466: YIFAT (AD 1285-1415) State, monarchy (Sultanate of Yifat). Formed on the territory of modern Somalia on the Harar plateau. Conquered by the Adal Sultanate. Capital - Saila
info_1467: ISAAC (AD 1750-1884) State, monarchy (Sultanate of Isaac). Formed on the territory of modern Somalia by the Isaac clan. Established a protectorate of Great Britain and became part of Somalia (Britain). Capital - Hargeisa
info_1468: ZANZIBAR (Port.) (AD 1505-1698) Possession of Portugal. Formed on the territory of modern Tanzania as a result of the Portuguese conquest of the island of Zanzibar. Conquered by the Sultanate of Oman. Capital - Zanzibar
info_1469: ZANZIBAR (Oman) (AD 1698-1820) Possession of the Sultanate of Oman. Formed on the territory of modern Tanzania as a result of the conquest of the island of Zanzibar by the Sultanate of Oman. It became part of the colony of Muscat and Oman (Brit.). Capital - Zanzibar
name_1470: Ownership of Imperial British East Africa Company
label_1470: Ownership of Imperial British East Africa Company
info_1470: OWNERSHIP OF IMPERIAL BRITISH EASTERN AFRICA COMPANY (AD 1888–1895) Possession of Great Britain. Formed on the territory of modern Kenya as a result of the granting of the right to manage British holdings in East Africa. Transferred to Great Britain and renamed British East Africa. Capital - Mombasa
info_1471: BUGANDA (AD 1300-1890) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Buganda). Formed on the territory of modern Uganda Bantu peoples. Established a protectorate of the Imperial British East African Company. Capital - Mengo
info_1472: BUNYORO-KITARA (AD 1400-1896) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Bunyoro-Kitara). Formed on the territory. modern Uganda Bantu peoples. After the establishment of the British protectorate, it became part of Uganda (Britain). Capital - Hoima
info_1473: TOORO (AD 1830-1896) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Tooro ). Formed on the territory of modern Uganda Bantu peoples. After the establishment of the British protectorate, it became part of Uganda (Britain). Capital - Fort Portal
info_1474: ANKOLE (AD 1478-1896) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Ankole). Formed on the territory of modern Ugandan Bantu peoples. After the establishment of the British protectorate, it became part of Uganda (Britain). Capital - Mbarara
info_1475: KINGDOM OF RWANDA (AD 1400-1885) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern Rwanda Tutsi peoples. After the establishment of the protectorate of Germany, it became part of German East Africa. Capital - Nyanza
info_1476: KINGDOM OF BURUNDI (AD 1680-1885) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern Burundi Bantu peoples. After the establishment of the protectorate of Germany, it became part of German East Africa. Capital - Gitega
info_1477: MARAVI (AD 1680-1893) State, monarchy (Kingdom of Maravi). Formed on the territory of modern Malawi. It became part of the British Central African Protectorate. Capital - Mantimba
info_1478: IMERINA (AD 1540-1817) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern Madagascar as a result of the conquest of the territories of central Madagascar by King Alasora Andriamanelo. As a result of the unification by the King of Imerina of all the states of the island of Madagascar into a single kingdom, the Kingdom of Madagascar was created. Capital - Tananarive
info_1479: VIRGIN ISLANDS (Dutch) (AD 1960–) Ownership of the Netherlands. Formed on the territory of modern Virgin Islands (Brit.) as a result of the establishment of settlements on the islands of Tortola and Virgin Gorda. Transferred to Great Britain and incorporated into the British Leeward Islands.
info_1480: GRENADA (Fr.) (AD 1649-1762),(1779-1833) Possession of France, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Grenada as a result of the conquest of the island of Grenada by France. Occupied by Great Britain),(Released from occupation. Became part of the British Windward Isles). Capital - Saint Georges
info_1481: SAINT-DOMINGUE (Fr.) (AD 1625-1804) Colony of France. Created on the territory of modern Haiti as a result of the conquest of the island of Tortuga from Spain. The independent empire of Haiti is proclaimed. Capital - Cap-France (until 1770), Port-au-Prince (from 1770)
info_1482: OWNERSHIP OF A DUTCH WEST INDIAN COMPANY (AD 1634-1792) Possessions of the Netherlands. Formed on the territory of modern Curacao (Nid.) In the transfer of the rights of the West India Company to manage the island of Curacao. Transferred to the Netherlands
info_1483: SWAN RIVER (Brit.) (AD 1829-1833) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Australia as a result of the founding of a settlement at the mouth of the Swan River. Renamed Western Australia (Brit.). Capital - Fremantle
info_1484: WESTERN AUSTRALIA (Brit.) (AD 1833-1901) Possession of Great Britain, a colony. Formed on the territory of modern Australia as a result of the renaming of the Swan River Colony (Brit.). It became part of the dominion of the Commonwealth of Australia. Capital - Perth
info_1485: NEW SOUTH WALES (Brit.) (AD 1829-1833) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Australia as a result of the founding of the first british settlement in Australia. It became part of the dominion of the Commonwealth of Australia. Capital - Sydney
info_1486: VAN DIEMAN'S LAND (Brit.) (AD 1825-1856) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Australia as a result of separation from the colony of New South Wales (Brit.). Renamed Tasmania (Brit.). Capital - Hobart
info_1487: TASMANIA (Brit.) (AD 1856-1901) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Australia as a result of the renaming of the colony Van Diemen's Land (Brit.). It became part of the dominion of the Commonwealth of Australia. Capital - Hobart
info_1488: SOUTH AUSTRALIA (Brit.) (AD 1836-1901) Possession of Great Britain, a colony. Formed on the territory of modern Australia as a result of separation from the colony of New South Wales (Brit.). It became part of the dominion of the Commonwealth of Australia. Capital - Adelaide
info_1489: VICTORIA (Brit.) (AD 1851-1901) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Australia as a result of separation from the colony of New South Wales (Brit.). It became part of the dominion of the Commonwealth of Australia. Capital - Melbourne
info_1490: QUEENSLAND (Brit.) (AD 1859-1901) Possession of Great Britain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Australia as a result of separation from the colony of New South Wales (Brit.). It became part of the dominion of the Commonwealth of Australia. Capital - Brisbane
info_1491: MARSHALL ISLANDS (Germ.) (AD 1885-1906) Possession of Germany, protectorate. Formed on the territory of modern Marshall Islands as a result of the annexation of the archipelago by Germany. Included in German New Guinea. Capital - Majuro
info_1492: MARIANA ISLANDS (Sp.) (AD 1668-1899) Possession of Spain, colony. Formed on the territory of modern Northern Mariana Islands (USA) as a result of the declaration of the archipelago by the Spanish colony. Sold to Germany and incorporated into German New Guinea
info_1493: XIA (2070-1600 BC) Legendary dynasty (state). Formed on the territory of modern PRC and ruled in ancient China. Power passed to the Shang dynasty Capital - Yangcheng
info_1494: SHANG (1600-1046 BC) Ancient kingdom (other names are Yin, Shang-Yin). Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the replacement of the Xia dynasty. Overthrown by the Zhou Dynasty. Capital - Yin
info_1495: WESTERN ZHOU (1045–771 BC) Ancient kingdom. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the overthrow of the Shang dynasty and the beginning of the Zhou era. Replaced by the Eastern Zhou Dynasty. Capital - Fenghao
info_1496: EASTERN ZHOU (770–256 BC) Ancient kingdom. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the replacement of the Western Zhou Dynasty. It broke up into small kingdoms, united in the Qin Empire in 221 BC . Capital - Wangcheng
info_1497: KINGDOM OF QIN (771–221 BC) Ancient state. Formed on the territory of modern PRC in the Zhou era, until 256 BC was part of the Eastern Zhou. As a result of the unification of small appanage principalities by the ruler of the Kingdom of Qin Shi Huang, the Qin Empire was created. Capital - Xianyang
info_1498: QIN EMPIRE (221–206 BC) Ancient state . Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the unification of small appanage principalities by the ruler of the kingdom of Qin Shi Huangdi. As a result of the uprising, a new Han dynasty came to power. Capital - Xianyang
info_1499: HAN (206 BC – AD 9),(AD 24–220) Ancient state (Han Empire). (Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the overthrow of the Qin dynasty. Power transfer to the Xin dynasty),(Restoration of the Han dynasty (Eastern Han). Broken up into the kingdoms of Wei, Shu and Wu. Capital - Chang'an, Luoyang
info_1500: XIN (AD 9-23) Ancient state (Xin Empire). Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the transfer of power from the Han dynasty. Power returned to the Han dynasty (Eastern Han. Capital - Chang'an
info_1501: WEI (AD 220-266) The ancient kingdom of the era of the Three Kingdoms. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the collapse of the Han Empire. It became part of the Jin state. Capital - Luoyang
info_1502: SHU (AD 221–263) The ancient kingdom of the era of the Three Kingdoms. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the collapse of the Han Empire. It became part of the Wei State. Capital - Chengdu
info_1503: WU (AD 222-280) Ancient kingdom of the era of the Three Kingdoms. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of separation from the Wei kingdom. It became part of the Jin state. Capital - Wuhang
info_1504: JIN (AD 266-420) Ancient state, empire. Formed on the territory. modern PRC, founded by the military leader Sima Yan. After the transfer of power to Liu Yu, the state of Liu Song was formed in the south, and the state of Northern Wei was formed in the north. Capitals - Luoyang, Jiankang
info_1505: LIU SONG (AD 420–479) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the transfer of power to Liu Yu in the Jin Empire. After the change of the dynasty, the state of Southern Qi was formed. Capital - Jiankang
info_1506: NORTHERN WEI (AD 386-535) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the unification of small states after the collapse of the Jin Empire. Broken up into Western Wei and Eastern Wei. Capital - Pingcheng
info_1507: SOUTHERN QI (AD 479-502) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern PRC after the change of dynasty in the state of Liu Song. After the change of the dynasty, the state of Liang was formed. Capital - Jiankang
info_1508: LIANG (AD 502–557) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern PRC after the change of dynasty in the state of Southern Qi. After the change of the dynasty, the state of Chen was formed. Capital - Jiankang
info_1509: WESTERN WEI (AD 535–557) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the division of the state of Northern Wei. Was replaced by the state of Northern Zhou. Capital - Pingcheng
info_1510: EASTERN WEI (AD 534–550) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the division of the state of Northern Wei. Replaced by the state of Northern Qi. Capital - Luoyang (534), Yechen (534-550)
info_1511: CHEN (AD 557–589) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern PRC after the change of dynasty in the state of Liang. The Sui Empire was conquered. The capital is Jiankang
info_1512: NORTHERN QI (AD 550–577) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of a coup in the state of Eastern Wei. Conquered by the state of Northern Zhou. Capital - Yechen
info_1513: NORTHERN ZHOU (AD 557–581) State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of a coup in the state of Western Wei. Destroyed by the Sui Dynasty and the Sui Empire formed. Capital is Chang'an
info_1514: SUI (AD 581–618) State, monarchy (Sui Empire). Formed on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the unification of the country after a long period of unrest. As a result of the coup, the Tang Empire was founded. Capital is Chang'an
name_1515: Five dynasties and ten kingdoms period in China
label_1515: Five dynasties and ten kingdoms period in China
info_1515: FIVE DYNASTIES AND TEN KINGDOMS PERIOD IN CHINA (AD 907-960) The era of political upheavals in China on the territory of modern PRC, which began with the overthrow of the Tang dynasty and ended with the establishment of the Song dynasty
info_1516: TAIWAN (AD 1949–) Partially recognized state (Republic of China). Educated on the territory of modern Taiwan as a result of relocation to the island of Taiwan of the Republic of China after the proclamation of the People's Republic of China in mainland China. Capital - Taipei
info_1517: LIAO (AD 907–1124) State, monarchy (Liao Empire). Educated on the territory modern PRC nomadic Khitan tribes. Transformed into the Kara-Khitay Khanate. Capital is Shangjing
info_1518: SONG (AD 960–1279) State, monarchy (Song Empire). Educated on the territory of modern PRC after the end of the Age of Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms. Conquered by the Mongol Yuan Empire. Capitals — Bianjing, Lin'an
info_1519: JIN EMPIRE (AD 1115–1234) State, monarchy. Educated on the territory of modern PRC as a result of the conquest of the northern part of the Song Empire by the Jurchens. Conquered by the Mongol Empire. Capitals - Huiningfu (1122-1153), Zhongdu (1153-1214), Kaifeng (1214-1233)
info_1520: XI XIA (AD 1038–1227) State, monarchy (Xi Xia Empire). Educated on the territory of modern PRC as a Tangut state. Conquered by the Mongol Empire. Capital - Yinchuan
info_1521: MING EMPIRE (AD 1368–1644) State, monarchical. Originated on the territory modern PRC as a result of the overthrow of the power of the Mongol Yuan Empire in Chinese lands. As a result of the transfer of power to the Qing Dynasty, the Qing Empire of China was formed. Capitals - Nanjing (1368-1421), Beijing (1421-1644)
info_1083: MANCHUKUO (AD 1932-1945) Puppet state (in 1932-34 -the State of Manchuria; in 1935-45 -Empire of Great Manchuria), Formed on the territory. modern PRC by the Japanese military administration in the Japanese-occupied territory of Manchuria. Became part of the Republic of China. Capital is Xinjing
info_1522: FORMOSA (Dutch) (AD 1624–1668) Possession of the Netherlands (Dutch East India Company). Educated on the territory modern Taiwan as a result of the construction of forts by the Dutch East India Company. It ceased to exist as a result of the invasion of Taiwan by the Chinese army and the creation of the Kingdom of Tungning. The capital is Zeelandia
info_1523: FORMOSA (Sp.) (AD 1626–1642) Possession of Spain. Educated on the territory modern Taiwan as a result of the capture of the northern coast by Spain. Conquered by Formosa (Dutch). The capital is San Salvador
info_1524: DUNNING (AD 1661–1683 State, monarchy. Formed on the territory of modern Taiwan as a result of the capture of part of the territory of Formosa (Dutch) by supporters of the Ming dynasty. Included in the Chinese Qing Empire. Capital - Dongdu
info_1525: NORTHERN YUAN (AD 1368–1691) State, monarchical (Northern Yuan Mongolian Khaganate). Originated on the territory modern Mongolia as a result of secession from the Mongol Yuan Empire. It became part of the Chinese Qing Empire. Capitals - Shangdu (1368–69), Yingchang (1369–70), Karakoram (1371–88)
info_1526: KOREAN EMPIRE (AD 1897–1910) State, monarchical. Originated on the territory modern North Korea and the Republic of Korea as a result of the proclamation of the empire by the king of the kingdom of Joseon. Annexed by Japan and turned into the possession of Korea (Yp.). Capital - Seoul
info_1527: JOSEON (AD 1392–1897) State, monarchical (State of Great Joseon). Originated on the territory modern North Korea and the Republic of Korea as a result of the coming to power of the Joseon Dynasty in the state Goryeo. As a result of the proclamation of the empire by the king of the kingdom of Joseon, it was transformed into the Korean Empire. Capital - Seoul
info_1528: GORYEO (AD 918–1392) State, monarchical (in 1259–1368 a vassal of the Mongol Empire and the Mongol Yuan Empire). Originated on the territory modern North Korea and the Republic of Korea as a result of the fall of the state of Silla. As a result of the coming to power of the Joseon Dynasty, it was transformed into the Kingdom of Joseon. Capitals - Gaegyeong (936-1232), Ganghwa (1232-1270), Gaegyeong (1270-1392)
info_1529: SILLA (57 BC–AD 935) State, monarchical. Originated on the territory modern Republic of Korea as a result of the unification of tribal unions. As a result of the fall of the state of Silla, the state of Goryeo was formed. Capitals - Gyeongju
info_1530: BAEKJE (18 BC–AD 660) State, monarchical. Originated on the territory modern Republic of Korea as a result of the unification of tribal unions. Conquered by the State of Silla. Capitals - Palson
info_1531: GOGURYEO (37 BC–AD 668) State, monarchical. Originated on the territory modern Republic of Korea as a result of the unification of tribal unions. Conquered by the State of Silla. Capitals - Gongne (15-427), Pyongyang (427-668)
info_1532: GORKHA (AD 1559–1768) State, monarchical (Kingdom of Gorkha) Originated on the territory of modern Nepal as a confederation of 24 principalities. After unification with other principalities, it was transformed into the Kingdom of Nepal. Capitals - Gorkha
info_1533: CEYLON (Dutch) (AD 1656–1796) Colony of the Netherlands. Formed on the territory modern Sri Lanka as a result of the conquest of Ceylon (Port.) by the Dutch East India Company. Transferred to the UK. Capital - Colombo
info_1534: KANDY (AD 1469–1581),(1593–1815) State, monarchical (Kandy Kingdom) (Born in the territory of modern Sri Lanka as a result of separation from the state of Kotte. Conquered by the Kingdom of Sitawaka),(Recreated as a result of the transfer of power in the Kingdom Sitawaka became part of Ceylon (Brit.)). Capital is Kandy
info_1535: KOTTE (AD 1412–1597) State, monarchical. Originated on the territory modern Sri Lanka. Conquered by Portugal and created the possession of Ceylon (Port.). Capital - Kotte
info_1536: SITAWAKA (AD 1521–1593) State, monarchical. Originated on the territory modern Sri Lanka as a result of secession from the state of Kotte. It became part of the Kingdom of Kandy. The capital is Sitawaka
info_1537: CEYLON (Port.) (AD 1597–1658) A colony of Portugal. Formed on the territory modern Sri Lanka as a result of the conquest of the state of Kotte by Portugal. Included in Ceylon (Nid.). Capital - Colombo
info_1538: JAFFNA (AD 1215–1619) State, monarchical (Kingdom of Jaffna). Originated on the territory modern Sri Lanka as a result of secession from the state of Pandya. Entered Ceylon (Port.). The capital is Nallur
info_1539: PAGAN (AD 1044–1297) State, monarchical (Kingdom of Pagan). Formed on the territory modern Myanmar as a result of the unification of disparate principalities by the king of Anoratha. Destroyed as a result of Mongol raids. Capital - Pagan
info_1540: MYINSAING (AD 1297–1313) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Myanmar on the site of the Pagan kingdom by the Shan leaders. Destroyed as a result of Mongol raids. Capital is Myinsaing
info_1541: PINYA (AD 1313–1365) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Myanmar as a result of a coup in the state of Myinsaing. Disintegrated, in its place the state of Ava was formed. Capital - Pinya
info_1542: AVA (AD 1365-1555) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Myanmar by the fugitive rulers of the state of Sikain. It became part of the kingdom of Taungoo. Capital - Ava
info_1543: SAGAING (AD 1315-1365) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Myanmar after the destruction of the state of Pagan. Transformed into the State of Ava. Capital - Sagaing
info_1544: HANTHAWADDY (AD 1287–1552) State, monarchical (other names - Pegu, Ramannadesa). Formed on the territory modern Myanmar as a result of secession from the state of Bagan. It became part of the kingdom of Taungoo. Capital - Tathoun (1287-1369), Pegu (1369-1539)
info_1545: MRAUK U (AD 1429–1785) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Myanmar in the historical region of Arakan. Conquered by the Kingdom of Burma. Capital - Launggyet (1429-1433), Mrauk U (1433-1785)
info_1546: TAUNGOO (AD 1510–1752) State, monarchical (Toungoo Kingdoms). Formed on the territory modern Myanmar as a result of the unification of the Burmese states by the Taungoo dynasty. With the advent of the Konbaung dynasty, it was transformed into the Kingdom of Burma. Capital - Taungoo (1486-1539), Pegu (1539-1599), Ava (1599-1752)
info_1547: BURMESE KINGDOM (AD 1752–1852) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Myanmar as a result of the accession of the Konbaun dynasty in the state of Taungoo. Conquered by the British East India Company. Capital - Shuebo
info_1548: SUKHOTHAI (AD 1238–1438) State, monarchical (Kingdom of Sukhothai). Formed on the territory modern Thailand as a result of secession from Cambujadesh. Conquered by the kings of Ayutthaya. Capital - Sukhothai (1238-1347), Song Khwa (1347-1438)
info_1549: AYUTTHAYA (AD 1351–1767) State, monarchical (Kingdom of Ayutthaya). Formed on the territory modern Thailand as a result of secession from Cambujadesh. Destroyed by the kingdom of Thonburi. The capital is Ayutthaya
info_1550: THONBURI (AD 1767–1782) State, monarchical (Kingdom of Thonburi). Formed on the territory modern Thailand as a result of the destruction of the kingdom of Ayutthaya. As a result of the coup and the accession of the Chakri dynasty, the kingdom of Siam was founded. The capital is Thonburi
info_1551: LAN NA (AD 1292–1578) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Thailand as a result of secession from Cambujadesh. Conquered by the kingdom of Tanggu (in 1775 the territory came under the control of Thonburi). Capital - Chiang Rai (1262-1275), Fang (1275-1281), Wiang Kum Kam (1281-1296), Chiang Mai (1296-1578)
capital_1551: Chiang Rai (1262-1275), Fang (1275-1281), Wiang Kum Kam (1281-1296), Chiang Mai (1296-1578)
info_1552: LAN XANG (AD 1353–1707) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Laos as a result of secession from Cambujadesh. It broke up into three kingdoms - Luang Prabang, Vientiane and Champasak. Capital: Luang Prabang, Vientiane
info_1553: KHMER EMPIRE (AD 802–1431) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Cambodia as a result of the decomposition of tribal relations among the Khmer tribes. Disintegrated. The capital is Yashodharapura
info_1554: FUNAN (AD 68-627) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Cambodia as the first Khmer state. Conquered by the state of Chenla. Disintegrated. The capital is Vadhyapura
info_1555: CHENLA (AD 550-802) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Cambodia as a Mon-Khmer state. It became part of Kambujadesh. Capital - Bhavapura (VI c.), Ishanapura (since the 7th c.)
info_1556: KINGDOM OF CAMBODIA (AD 1431–1863) State, monarchical (vassal of Siam, Vietnam). Formed on the territory modern Cambodia as a result of the collapse of Cambujadesh. It was conquered by France and the protectorate of Cambodia (Fr.) was created. Capital - Srey Sorchhor (1431–1434), Chaktomuk (1434–1525), Longwek (1525–1603), Lwea Em (1603–1620), Oudong (1620–1863)
capital_1556: Srey Sorchhor (1431–1434), Chaktomuk (1434–1525), Longwek (1525–1603), Lwea Em (1603–1620), Oudong (1620–1863)
info_1557: LUANG PRABANG (AD 1707–1893) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Laos as a result of the collapse of Lan Xang. After the establishment of the protectorate of France, it was included in French Indochina. The capital is Luang Prabang
info_1558: VIENTIANE (AD 1707–1828) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Laos as a result of the collapse of Lan Xang. Annexed by Siam. The capital is Vientiane
info_1559: CHAMPASAK (AD 1713–1904) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Laos as a result of the collapse of Lan Xang. After the establishment of the protectorate of France, it was included in French Indochina. The capital is Champasak
info_1560: VĂN LANG (2524–258 BC) State, slaveholding, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Vietnam as the first state of the Viet. Conquered by the state of Aulak. Capital - Phong Châu
info_1561: ÂU LẠC (258–207 BC) State, slaveholding, monarchy. Formed on the territory modern Vietnam as a result of the conquest of the Văn Lang state by the Auviet mountain tribes. Conquered by the state of Nanyue. Capital - Cổ Loa
