info_1562: NANYUE (207–111 BC) State, slaveholding, monarchy. Formed on the territory modern Vietnam as a result of the Qin Empire's destruction of the Au Lac state. Destroyed by the state of Han. The capital is Panyu
info_1563: LÂM ẤP (AD 192–629) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Vietnam as a Cham state. Conquered by the Champa state. The capital is Simhapura
info_1564: CHAMPA (AD 629–1832) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Vietnam as a result of the conquest of the state of Lâm Ấp. Conquered by the state of Đại Việt (Nguyen dynasty). Capital - Indrapura (875-978), Vijaya (978-1485), Panduranga (1485-1832)
info_1565: ĐẠI VIỆT (AD 968-1804) State, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Vietnam as a result of the liberation of the territory from Chinese dependence. Conquered by the Nguyễn dynasty. Capital - Hoa Ly (968-1010), Tan Long (1010-1398,1428-1789), Fu Xuan (1789-1804)
info_1566: NGUYỄN (AD 1802–1883) State, monarchical (Nguyễn Dynasty). Formed on the territory modern Vietnam as a result of the transfer of power to the Nguyen dynasty in the state of Đại Việt. A protectorate of France was established and the state was divided into the protectorates of Cochinchina (Fr.), Annam (Fr.) and Tonkin (Fr.). The dynasty existed until 1945.Capital - Hue
info_1567: FEDERATED MALAY STATES (Brit.) (AD 1895–1941) British possession, protectorate. Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over the states of Negeri Sembilan, Pahang, Perak and Selangor. Occupied by Japan. The capital is Kuala Lumpur
info_1568: UNFEDERATED MALAY STATES (Brit.) (AD 1826–1941) British possession, protectorate. Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of the establishment of a British protectorate over the states of Kedah, Kelantan, Perlis and Terengganu (Johor was annexed in 1914). Occupied by Japan
info_1569: MALACCA (Dutch) (AD 1641–1795),(1818–1825) Colony of the Netherlands. (Formed on the territory of modern Malaysia as a result of the conquest of the Dutch West India Company of Malacca (Port.). Occupied by Great Britain),(Returned to the Netherlands. Transferred to Great Britain and included in the Straits Settlements (brit.)). Capital - Malacca
info_1570: MALACCA (Port.) (AD 1511–1641) A colony of Portugal. Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of the conquest of the Malacca Sultanate by Portugal. Conquered by the Dutch West India Company and formed the colony of Malacca (Dutch). Capital - Malacca
info_1571: MALACCA SULTANATE (AD 1400–1511) State, feudal. Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of the conquest of the Kingdom of Singapore. Conquered by Portugal and formed the colony of Malacca (Port.). Capital - Malacca
info_1572: JOHOR (AD 1511–1914) State, feudal (Sultanate of Johor). Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of its founding by the son of the Sultan of Malacca, conquered by Portugal. Included in the protectorate of the Unfederated Malay States (Brit.). Capital - Panchor (1700-1708), Pekan (1788-1795), Singapore (1819-1824)
info_1573: RIAU-LINGGA (AD 1824–1911) State, feudal (Sultanate of Riau-Lingga). Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of secession from the Sultanate of Johor. It became part of the Dutch East Indies. Capital - Dyke
info_1574: PAHANG (AD 1770–1895) State, feudal (Sultanate of Pahang). Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of secession from the Sultanate of Johor. It became part of the protectorate of the Federated Malay States (Brit.). Capital - Pecan
info_1575: SELANGOR (AD 1766–1895) State, feudal (Sultanate of Selangor). Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of secession from the Sultanate of Johor. It became part of the protectorate of the Federated Malay States (Brit.). Capital - Shah Alam
info_1576: PERAK (AD 1528–1895) State, feudal (Sultanate of Perak). Formed on the territory modern Malaysia after the collapse of the Malacca Sultanate in 1511. It became part of the protectorate of the Federated Malay States (Brit.). Capital - Ipoh
info_1577: NEGERI SEMBILAN (AD 1773–1895) State, feudal (Sultanate of Negeri Sembilan). Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of secession from the Sultanate of Johor. It became part of the protectorate of the Federated Malay States (Brit.). Capital - Seremban
info_1578: KEDAH (AD 1136–1821) State, feudal (Sultanate of Kedah). Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of the conversion to Islam of the inhabitants of Kedah. conquered by Siam. Capital: Alor Setar
info_1579: TERENGGANU (AD 1725–1781) State, feudal. Formed on the territory modern Malaysia as a result of secession from Johor. conquered by Siam. The capital is Kuala Terengganu
info_1580: KELANTAN (AD 1411–1499),(1511–1781) State, feudal. (It was formed on the territory of modern Malaysia as a result of separation from the Malacca Sultanate. It became part of the Malacca Sultanate),(It left the Malacca Sultanate. It was conquered by Siam). The capital is Kota Bharu
info_1581: KINGDOM OF SINGAPORE (AD 1299–1399) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Singapore as a result of the collapse of the state of Srivijaya. Conquered by the Malacca Sultanate. Capital - Singapore
info_1582: SRIVIJAYA (AD 650–1275) State, feudal, Malay, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Indonesia on the island of Sumatra. Conquered by the state of Singasari. Capital is Palembang
info_1583: BRUNEI EMPIRE (AD 1368–1888) State, feudal, monarchical (in 1368–1425 - vassal of Majapahit). Formed on the territory modern Malaysia, as a result of the establishment of the British protectorate, Sarawak (Brit.), North Borneo (Brit.) and Brunei (Brit.) were formed. Capital: Kota Batu, Kampung Ayer, Brunei
info_1584: SULU (AD 1405–1915) State, feudal, monarchical (sultaenate). Formed on the territory modern Philippines as a result of secession from the Brunei Empire. It became part of the Philippines (USA). Capital - Jolo
info_1585: BENCOOLEN (Brit.) (AD 1685–1824) Possession of Great Britain. Formed on the territory modern Indonesia as a result of the acquisition by the British East India Company from local rulers as a trading post. It became part of the Dutch East Indies. Capital: Benculen
info_1586: ACEH (AD 1496–1903) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Indonesia as a result of secession from the principality of Pasai. It became part of the Dutch East Indies. Capital: Banda Aceh
info_1587: PASAI (AD 1267–1521) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Indonesia as a result of separation from the state of Srivijaya. Became part of the Aceh Sultanate. Capital - Pasai
info_1588: MATARAM (AD 716–1016) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Indonesia as a result of its foundation by the feudal lord - Shaivite Sanjaya on the island of Java. Conquered by the state of Kediri. The capital is Mamratipura
info_1589: KEDIRI (AD 1045–1221) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Indonesia as a result of the collapse of the state of Mataram. It became part of the state of Singasari. Capital - Kediri
info_1590: SINGASARI (AD 1222–1292) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Indonesia as a result of the conquest of the state of Kediri. Transformed into the state of Majapahit. Capital - Malang
info_1591: MAJAPAHIT (AD 1293–1520) State, feudal, monarchical. Formed on the territory modern Indonesian Prince of the State of Singasari. Disintegrated. Capital is Majapahit
info_1592: PHILIPPINES (Sp.) (AD 1565–1898) Colony of Spain (captainship general). Created on the territory modern Philippines as part of New Spain. It ceased to exist as a result of the Spanish-American War and the occupation of the United States and the transformation into the possession of the United States. Capitals - Cebu (1565-1571), Manila (1571-1898)
